loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 29 years old and lives in Locsoon,Tudela. She is married and has two children.

Mercy has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for two years. Mercy requested a loan of PHP 6,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Mercy has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is married and has two children. He is 36 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.

Christopher is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. He has been doing this for two years. Christopher has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional piglets to sell.

Christopher has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, he hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional piglets to sell.

loans.name: Merla

texts.en:
Merla is 54 years old and lives in Libertad Bajo, Sinacaban. She is married and has four children.

Merla has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for five years. Merla requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Merla has been a member of PMPC for one year.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Elezabeth

texts.en:
Elezabeth is 51 years old and lives in Centro Napu, Tudela. She is married and has 6 children. Elezabeth works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 5 years.

She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Elezabeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Dannys

texts.es: Dannys de 32 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Cartagena, donde se dedica a la actividad comercial en un negocio que tiene de variedades,  donde ofrece perfumería, cosméticos, accesorios femeninos y también servicios de fotocopiaje y comunicaciones. Ella inició su negocio desde hace 5 años, cuando vendiendo unos pocos productos de belleza, organizó una pequeña clientela, con la  que gradualmente fue creciendo y así mismo Dannys fue agregando artículos variados, hasta llegar a vincularse a una empresa a través de la cual ofrece productos mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, con la cual le fue muy bien y así mismo fue ganando una mayor clientela que amplió su expectativas, porque su especialidad es comprar los productos que llegan con los mejores descuentos, para impactarlos y fidelizarlos. Dannys al mismo tiempo trabajaba como empleada y esto le ayudó a construir su propio capital y una clientela con muchos méritos, que la reconocía.  Posteriormente como tenia muchos inventarios de mercancía guardada en casi todas las habitaciones de su casa, decidió organizar un espacio solo para el negocio y compró vitrinas con las que organizó un pequeño punto comercial y como hace tres meses dejó de trabajar como empleada de una empresa, invirtió el dinero producto de su liquidación, en la compra de  fotocopiadoras, equipos de cómputos y estableció su sala internet en su propia vivienda para ofrecer el servicio de telecomunicaciones, pero necesita hacer adecuaciones en el salón para volverlo mas confortable y atractivo y para ganar aun mas clientela. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer finecimiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual adecuará su local, comprara una puerta de vidrio, una puerta metálica corrediza tipo estera, para aumentar la seguridad de sus clientes y la suya propia. Dannys todos sus esfuerzos los tiene dirigidos a su negocio, pues con su crecimiento quiere poder brindarle, cada vez mas bienestar a su familia conformada por su esposo quien la apoya en todo y a su hijo de 1 año de edad, con quien en compañía de su cónyuge sueña verlo convertido en un profesional exitoso.
texts.en:
Dannys, 32 years old, lives in the city of Cartagena where she has a commercial business, selling  a variety of merchandise, such as perfume, cosmetics, feminine accessories, and also, services for photocopying and communications.  

Dannys launched her business some 5 years ago; while selling a few beauty products, she organized a small clientèle, which gradually grew. Danny added various articles, until building an enterprise that offers products through specialized guides and catalogs. It went well, as she earned an ample customer base; since her specialty is to buy products that come with the best discounts, she had an impact and it made her customers loyal.

At the same time, Dannys worked as an employee and this enabled her to build her own capital and a meretricious clientèle who recognized her. Subsequently, as she came to have a lot of merchandise inventory stored in almost all the rooms of her house, she decided to organize a space strictly for her business and to buy glass showcases in which she could organize a small commercial area. Then 3 months ago, she ceased to work as an employee at an enterprise, investing her separation money in photocopiers, computer equipment, and establishing an internet station and a telecommunications center in her own home. But, for this, she needs to make improvements to the space, making it more comfortable and attractive if she is to gain more customers. 

This is why she sought a Kiva loan, her 1st approach to the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to fix up her shop, buying a glass door, and a metal, matting-style, sliding door, to improve security for her customers and herself.

All of Dannys' efforts are aimed at her business, since with its growth, she hopes to be able to offer greater wellbeing to her family, composed of her husband, who helps her in everything, and her son who is 1 year old. She and her husband hope to see him develop into a successful professional.

loans.use: to make her internet shop adequate, buying a glass door and a sliding matting-style, metal door for security reasons.

loans.name: Paz

texts.en:
Paz is 22 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela. She is married and has 2 children. To earn a living, she has a business of selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work.

She has requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.  She has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, she would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: Kholmahmad

texts.ru: Холмахмад два года как работает таксистом. Он проживает в городе Вахдат. Ему 35 лет. Он разведен. Холмахмад берет кредит для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Kholmahmad has been working as a taxi driver for two years. He lives in the city of Vahdat. He is 35 years old and divorced. Kholmahmad is taking this loan to repair his vehicle.

loans.use: to repair his taxi

loans.name: Anne Loraine

texts.en:
Anne Loraine is 24 years old and lives in P-3 Dolores, Clarin. She is married with one child. 
For three years, Anne Loraine has operated a store that sells a variety of products. She has requested a loan of 30000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.
Anne Loraine has been a member of PMPC for two months. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, and detergents.

loans.name: Ozoda

texts.ru: Озода проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 62 года. Замужем. Имеет двоих детей. Более десяти лет занимается шитьем. Она в основном шьет национальные платья. Этим видом деятельности занимается у себя дома. Кредит берет для приобретения швейной машинки.
texts.en: Ozoda lives in the city of Vahdat. She is 62 years old, married, and has two children. Ozoda has been a seamstress for over ten years, and specializes in creating traditional dresses. She works from home. Ozoda is taking this loan to purchase a new sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Larisa

texts.ru:
Лариса – предприниматель, работает на рынке Новой Каховки, торгует клеенкой для столов, салфетками, скатертями, москитными сетками. Лариса занимается рыночной торговлей уже 16 лет. Товара у нее на данный момент на сумму в 20 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль достигает иногда и 7 000 гривен. 

Лариса планирует вложить кредит в 8 000 гривен в закупку оптовой партии клеенки, скатертей, салфеток и москитной сетки для последующей продажи на своей точке. Лариса сама воспитывает детей и обеспечивает семью, так как она уже несколько лет состоит в разводе. Она надеется на дальнейший успех своего дела, которое является основным источником дохода для всей ее семьи. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Larisa is en entrepreneur. She works at a market in Novaya Kahovka. She sells vinyl table clothes, napkins, table clothes and mosquito nets.  Larisa has been engaged in the business for 16 years. She currently has 20,000 hryven worth of goods. Her net profit sometimes amounts to 7,000 hryven. 

With her loan of 8,000 hryven, Larisa is planning on purchasing table clothes, napkins and mosquito nets in bulk for their future resale at the market. Larisa is divorced, raises her children and provides for her family alone. She has been divorced for several years. She hopes to continue developing a successful business, which is the main source of her family's income.

NB: the background information is in Russian.

loans.use: to purchase vinyl table clothes, table clothes, napkins, and mosquito nets

loans.name: Raisa

texts.ru:
Раисе 56 лет. Она трудолюбивый и ответственный предприниматель. Раиса торгует на районном рынке своего родного города Мелитополя. Она реализует детский и женский трикотаж.  У нее свое торговое место, опыт работы уже 14 лет. 

Раиса обратилась в КИВА за кредитом в размере 6 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить сезонный товар, а именно платья, сарафаны и футболки, которые хорошо расходятся летом. За счет расширения ассортимента товара под реализацию Раиса надеется развивать свой бизнес и дальше и за счет бизнеса улучшать быт семьи. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Raisa is 56 years old. She is a hardworking and responsible entrepreneur. Raisa sells kids' and women's knitted wear at a local market in Melitopol.  
She has her own market stall and has been in the business for 14 years. 
Raisa is seeking help at KIVA and asking for a loan of 6,000 hryven to buy seasonal goods, namely dresses, pinafore dresses and T-shirts, which are in high demand in summer. Raisa would like to diversify the range of goods and continue developing her business and improving the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to buy seasonal goods, namely dresses, pinafore dresses and T-shirts

loans.name: Aty Jeheka Group

texts.es:
El comité "Aty Jeheka"surge gracias a una de las miembros del grupo, que en vistas de ayudar a sus vecinas y amigas surge el grupo. El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La Sra. Alba, es una de las miembros del grupo. Ella comenta que por medio de su trabajo y con la ayuda de sus compañeras ha logrado salir adelante. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida donde surte a los vecinos de su barrio y a personas de otros lugares, ella con mucho esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y desea poder seguir creciendo y continuar ayudando a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, gaseosas, enlatados, verduras, hortalizas y otros insumos para poder seguir con su local bien abastecido. Ella y sus amigas agradecen por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Aty Jeheka Group is developed thanks to the help of one of the group members who, in order to help her neighbors and friends, set up the group. The objective of each of the members is to work, encourage the spirit of solidarity and reach the highest possible level of their action.

Señora Alba is one of the members of the group. She says that through her work and with the help of her colleagues she managed to progress. She has a well-stocked grocery which serves her neighbors and people from other places. She puts a lot of effort in her activity and experiences good progress. She wants to continue to grow and keep on helping her family.

Alba applies for the loan to buy meat, soda, canned food, vegetables and other garden produce as well as cooking ingredients in order to keep her store well stocked. She and her friends are grateful for the provided opportunity.

loans.use: to buy meat, soda, canned food, vegetables and other garden produce, and cooking ingredients.

loans.name: Babelita

texts.en:
Babelita is 46 years old and lives in Punta, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is married and has five children.
Babelita works in the fishing industry and sells/catches fish for a living. She has been doing this for five years. She has requested a loan of 14900 PHP to purchase a fishing net for her business.
Babelita has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Babelita hopes to expand her fishing business.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net for her fishing business.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 44 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. She is married and has seven children.
Elisa has a business selling a variety of foods for snacks and earns about 4000 PHP each month. She has a requested a loan to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.
Elisa has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Elisa would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
EL SR. JOSE LUIS DE 42 AÑOS, CASADO Y CON 3 HIJOS, CUENTA CON UNA ANTIGÜEDAD DE MAS DE 22 AÑOS LABORANDO EN LA CUAL MANTIENE UN PUESTO FIJO, DONDE PUDO HACERSE DE SU PROPIA CASA Y BRINDARLE A SU FAMILIA LAS NECESIDADES SUFICIENTES. ACTUALMENTE ESTA EN TRAMITE DE UNA SEGUNDA CASA, YA QUE LE ESTAN HACIENDO UN DESCUENTO Y QUIERE APROVECHAR PARA EN UN FUTURO BRINDARLE A US FAMILIA UN BUEN PATRIMONIO. POR LO CUAL SOICITA UN CREDITO PARA IR REMODELANDO POCO A POCO LA NUEVA VIVIENDA, EMPEZANDO CON LAS PROTECCIONES.
ASI LE BRINDARA A SU FAMILIA UNA MAYOR SEGURIDAD Y NO ESTARA PREOCUPADO PORQUE SABRA QUE SU FAMILIA ESTA PROTEIJIDA.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is 42 years old, is married, and has three children. He has spent more than 22 years working at a permanent position, where he could make his own house and provide his family with the necessities. Currently, he is in the process of getting a second house, since they are giving a discount and he wants to take advantage in order to provide his family with more wealth. For this reason, he is asking for a loan to remodel the new house little by little, beginning with the fencing and other safety features.
This way, he will provide his family with more security and won't be worried because his family isn't protected.

loans.use: to construct fencing and safety features

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Don Pedro tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Él es contador y se desempeña en esta área, tiene una casa alquilada en ella vive y trabaja de contador, allí realiza sus trabajos solicitados. Comenta que desde muy pequeño le gustaron los números, cuando estudio bachillerato contador se dio cuenta que era la carrera universitaria que le gustaría aprender. 

Todo lo que necesita para su oficina lo compra en las librerías de la ciudad, pues son pequeños los trabajos que realiza junto con su hermana.

El préstamo que solicita es para comprar 18 pliegos de lamina, clavos, pago de mano de obra; para reparar el techo de la casa que esta construida de teja, y se encuentra en mal estado, algunas están quebradas, otras resbalan y cuando llueve se filtra mucho el agua, mojando todo lo que tiene en la casa, hasta los materiales de su trabajo. Con la inversión mejorara las condiciones de salubridad, ya que por la humedad favorece la formación de hongos y hay dos niños en casa, por lo que ya no correrían el riesgo de enfermarse. 

Don Pedro desea reparar la fachada de la casa, construirle gradas, ya que se llena de agua cuando llueve, además quiere reparar el desagüe para que circule mejor el agua lluvia.
texts.en:
Pedro is 36 years old, married, and has two children. He is an accountant and does well in that area. He rents a house in which he lives and works as an accountant, and it is here that he does his very sought-after work. He says that since he was a small child, he liked numbers. When he was getting his bachelor's degree in accounting, he realized that it was the field that he wanted to learn.

He purchases everything that he needs for his office in the bookstores in the city, so the jobs he does with his sister are small.

The loan is to purchase 18 metal sheets, nails, and to pay for labor in order to repair the roof of his house, which is made of tile. It is in poor condition; some of the tiles are cracked, others sliding down the roof. When it rains, a lot of water leaks, getting everything in the house wet including his work materials. With the investment, he will improve his health, since humidity is good for mold, and there are two children in the house that won't run the risk of getting sick anymore.

Pedro wants to repair the front of his house and build steps, since it fills with water when it rains, and also wishes to repair the drainage system so that the rainwater flows better.

loans.use: to buy 18 metal sheets, nails, and to pay for labor in order to repair the roof of his house, which is made of tile.

loans.name: Kairyl

texts.ru: Кайрыл 44 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В 1997 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Кайрыл начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммой в 14,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Кайрыл  сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 2 коровы и 15 голов мелкого рогатого скота и  ежемесячным доходом  около 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кайрыл обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Кайрыл планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kairyl is 44 years old, married, and is raising 3 children. In 1997, while looking for a source of income for her family, Kairyl started her own business in animal husbandry with an initial investment of 14,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Kairyl's persistence and hard work, her business has grown and currently includes 2 cows and 15 goats and sheep, while monthly profits amount to approximately 18,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Kairyl has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 135,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Arceli

texts.en:
Arceli is 38 years old and lives in Mialen, Clarin. She is married with three children.

Arceli works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to purchase additional fish to sell.

Arceli has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
With limited job opportunities in his native Haiti, Eugene moved to the United States in 1972 in hopes of providing a better life for his family. He has always considered himself an entrepreneur and when the limousine business slowed down with the economic recession, he took the opportunity to pursue his passion for herbal medicine. 

In 2001, he retired from his job as a limo driver and opened St. Pierre Botanicals, an herbal store right outside of New York. Many of the products he sells are from Haiti. He currently has two employees and prides himself on ensuring that his employees are just as passionate about his products as he is. 

Eugene will use this loan to increase inventory and supplies. He hopes that with the continuing expansion of the store, he will be able to hire a store manager to run the business so that he can focus more on his customers. Since his business opened 11 years ago, he has worked 12 hours a day, 7 days a week. In the near future, Eugene hopes to cut down his hours in order to spend more time with his eight grandchildren - all boys - and "show them how to become men of character and integrity."

loans.use: to increase his inventory of herbal products

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La señora Marina, de 52 años de edad, habitante de la ciudad de Estelí, de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace 30 años, madre de 3 hijos. Ella tiene su propia tienda la cual saca adelante por si sola pues no tiene apoyo de nadie, hoy en día  Marina desea ver mas surtida su tienda con los productos que están de moda en esta temporada es por ese motivo que requiere del crédito Kiva para invertir en su negocio en la compra de zapatos, edredones, camisetas, mercadería en general.  Ella estima que esta inversión será de ayuda porque podrá surtir  más su tienda para mayor atracción de  clientes  generando a la vez  más ganancias, ella espera contar con el apoyo de Kiva para mantener  su negocio activo, ampliar su tienda con diversidad de productos para poder obtener mayores ingresos y ofrecerles una mejor educación  a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mrs. Marina, 52 years old, citizen of the city of Esteli and a merchant by trade, has worked selling clothing for 30 years. She is a mother of 3 children. She has her own store which she owns herself and has no support from anyone today. Marina wishes to see her store stocked better with products that are in-style right now. It's for this reason that she requires a loan from Kiva to invest in her business, which is the sale of shoes, quilts, shirts, and general merchandise. She estimates that the investment will be of help because she she will be able to stock more in her store in order to attract more customers, at the same time generating more sales. She hopes count on Kiva to keep her business running, increasing her store's diverse products in order to obtain better sales and offer a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy shoes, quilts, shirts, and general merchandise.

loans.name: Ignacio

texts.es: EL SR. IGNACIO DE 65 AÑOS, VIUDO VIVE CON UNA HIJA YA CASADA, EL CUENTA CON SU TIENDA DE ABARROTES DESDE HACE UN MES LA CUAL LE AYUDA A DISTRAERSE Y A BRINDARLES A SUS VECINOS UNA VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTOS, EL DESEA AMPLIAR SU NEGOCIO Y REMODELAR EL LOCAL PARA ASI TENER UNA MAYOR VISIBILIDAD ANTE LOS CLIENTES. CUENTA CON INGRESO EXTRA QUE SU PENSION, LA CUAL LE AYUDA CON US GASTOS FAMILIARES. SOLICITA DE NUESTRA AYUDAD PARA SACAR ADELANTE SU NEGOCIO Y PODER AMPLIARLO.
texts.en: Señor Ignacio, aged 65, is widowed and lives with his married daughter. He has had a grocery store for one month, which helps him to have something to do and offer a variety of goods to his neighbors. He wants to expand his business and remodel the premises for greater visibility to his customers. He counts on this income in addition to his retirement pension to help with household expenses. He asked for our support to make his business successful and expand it.

loans.use: to enlarge and remodel his grocery store.

loans.name: Merelou

texts.en:
Merelou is 37 years old and lives in San Isidro, Sinacaban. Merelou is divorced with two children. She  has a general store that sells a variety of products.  

Merelou  has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Merelou has been a member of PMPC for 3 years.  In the future, Merelou hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Толиб проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Толиб предоставляет услугу такси. В этой области он три года. Кредит берет для приобретения машины.
texts.en: Tolib lives in the city of Dushanbe. He is 33 years old, married, and has a child. Tolib has been offering taxi services for the past three years. He is taking this loan to purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: to buy a car

loans.name: Nurjan

texts.ru: Нуржан –участник группы «Илим - 2», ей  42 года, имеет 6 детей. В 1995 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Нуржан начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 2,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Нуржан сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 5 коров и 10 голов мелкого рогатого скота и  ежемесячным доходом около 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нуржан обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Нуржан планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Nurjan is a member of the Ilim-2 group. She is 42 years old and has 6 children. In 1995, while looking for a source of income for her family, Nurjan started her livestock and farming business with an initial sum of 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, the business grew, and presently includes 5 cows and 10 goats and sheep, while monthly earnings total roughly 4,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue expanding her business, Nurjan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Khaliss

texts.fr:
Khaliss est une femme mariée, mère de quatre enfants.Elle mène depuis plus de 20 ans l'activité de mareyage.Elle achète des caisses de poissons sur le quai de pêche.Elle les revend en détail aux femmes qui approvisionnent les marchés des quartiers et villages de sa zone.Cette activité lui permet de prendre en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille et de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants notamment les frais de scolarité...
Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter des caisses de poissons.Son ambition est d'acheter une pirogue et un moteur.
texts.en: Khaliss is a married mother of four. She has been in the fish trade for more than 20 years. She buys cases of fish on the fishing dock. She sells them at retail to women who stock up at neighborhood and village markets in her area. This business allows her to support her family and to meet the needs of her children, notably school costs. In order to increase her business funds, she is seeking a loan of 400,000 f to buy cases of fish. Her goal is to buy a canoe and a motor.

loans.use: to buy cases of fish

loans.name: Vergilita

texts.en:
Vergilita is 64 years old and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban. Vergilita is married with six children. 

Vergilita has a general store that sells a variety of products.She has had this business for 15 years. Vergilita requested a loan  to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Vergilita has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future,Vergilita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is 58 years old and lives in Basirang, Tudela. Emelia is married with two children. 

Emelia has a store that sells a variety of products. Emelia has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Emelia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years.  In the future,Emelia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 55 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Cecilia has a grocery store that sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale.

Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for almost 8 years.  In the future, Cecilia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old and lives in Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is married with three school-aged children.

Ruth has general store and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of business. She has  requested a loan to purchase more stock for her sari-sari (variety) store.

Ruth has been a member of PMPC for 5 years. In the future, Ruth hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is 42 years old and lives in Butuay, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married and has three children. To earn a living, Cristina has a business selling dried fish. She earns about 3,000 PHP each month doing this work. Cristina has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional dried fish for resale. Cristina has been a member of PMPC for almost a year. In the future, Cristina would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase dried fish

loans.name: Mira Fe

texts.en: Mira Fe is married and has four children. She is 51 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin. Mira Fe is a farmer and raises hogs to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Mira Fe has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to purchase feed for her hogs. Mira Fe has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Mira Fe hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed for hogs

loans.name: Dr Djibril

texts.fr:
Dr Djibril est un pharmacien qui gère une officine de pharmacie depuis mars 2004.En plus de la vente de médicaments, il a aménagé un espace pour proposer à ses clients des produits de beauté et des aliments pour bébé.
Cette diversité de services lui rapporte des revenus qui lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins de son épouse, de ses enfants ainsi que ses propres besoins.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 500000f pour acheter des médicaments et des produits de beauté.Son ambition est de construire ses propres locaux.
texts.en: Dr Djibril is a pharmacist who has been running a pharmacy since March 2004. In addition to selling medications, he converted a space to offer his clients beauty products and baby food. This diversity of services helps earn him income which allows him to meet the needs of his wife and his kids as well as his own. In order to increase his business funds, he is seeking a loan of 500,000 f to buy medications and beauty products. His goal is to build his own premises.

loans.use: to buy medications and beauty products

loans.name: Vincent

texts.en: Vincent is single and has no children. He is 22 years old and lives in Señor, Sinacaban. Vincent is a farmer who grows corn to earn a living. He has been doing this for three years. Vincent has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial. He has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Vincent hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Ziynat

texts.ru: Зыйнат –участник группы «Илим - 2», ей  42 года, вдова, воспитывает 3 детей. В 1995 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Зыйнат начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 4,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Зыйнат сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 1 корову и 22 головы мелкого рогатого скота и  ежемесячным доходом около 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зыйнат обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Зыйнат планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ziynat is a member of the Ilim-2 group. She is 42 years old, widowed, and is raising 3 children. In 1995, while searching for a source of income for her family, Ziynat launched her livestock and farming business with an initial investment of 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Ziynat's business grew well and currently includes 1 cow and 22 goats and sheep, while monthly earnings total roughly 4,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Ziynat has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 60,000 som (KGS) to purchase additional livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Josefa

texts.en:
Josefa is 72 years old and lives in Upper Centro, Tudela. Josefa is widowed with one child. She has a general store that sells a variety of products.

Josefa has had this business for six years. She requested a loan to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Josefa has been a member of PMPC for seven years.  In the future, Josefa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.fr: Sandrine est une jeune femme de 27 ans célibataire avec un enfant agé de 5 ans qui va déjà à l'école .Elle a aussi deux autres personnes à sa charge. Elle a ouvert un salon de coiffure dans la capitale qu'elle gère depuis trois ans déjà, grâce à sa comptétence, elle acquis une clientèle au fil du temps.Mais la petité de  son capital l'emmène souvent à  aller chercher des mèches et les produits de beauté dans les parfumeries à chaque fois qu'il faut coiffer un de ses clients parce qu'elle achète en petite quantité donc est en rupture permanente ce qui la pénalise tout le temps. Aussi il y'a des périodes ou la clientèle devient rare pour la coiffure et les autres soins, d'où son besoin de s'acheter des mèches et autres produits de beauté en carton pour revendre. Ceci l'aidera à à agrandir son activité en ouvrant une mini parfumerie, limitera sa perte de temps, satisfera sa clientèle. Elle réinvestira une partie de ses bénéfices dans son fonds de commerce et l'autre lui permettra de subvenir à ses besoins et ceux de sa famille.
texts.en: Sandrine is a young, single 27-year-old mother of a 5-year-old who already goes to school. She also takes care of two other people. She opened a hair salon in the capital, which she has been running for three years, and due to her competence, she is acquiring a clientele as time goes by. But she needs to go to her capital to get hair extensions and beauty products in perfumeries each time she has a client, because she buys in small quantities and is therefore constantly out of stock, which penalizes her all the time. There are also periods where the clientele don't come often for hairstyling and other services, which makes her need to buy hair extensions and other beauty products by the box to sell. This will help her grow her business: by opening a mini perfumery, she will lose less time and satisfy her clientele. She will reinvest a part of her revenues into her business funds and the rest will allow her to meet her own needs and those of her family.

loans.use: to buy boxes of hair extensions

loans.name: Marryjo

texts.en:
Marryjo is 34 years old and lives in Canicapan, Clarin. Marryjo is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Marryjo has a business selling snacks in the community. She earns about PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. Marryjo has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

Marryjo has been a member of PMPC for 2 months.  In the future, Marryjo would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil, etc.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a married man. He describes himself as a principled man. He operates a motorcycle providing transportation services . He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of fuel. 

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy a bicycle to expand the transportation services. His business goal is to own many motorcycles within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a bicycle.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.en:
After seeing the impact that Sistema Biobolsa biodigesters have had in his region, Jaime decided that he wanted to start installing the system in his community. Jaime has a family-run business based in Tecamachalco that is focused on dissemination of appropriate farming technologies and micro credit. Sistema Biobolsa will now be an additional product that he offers. An agricultural engineer, Jaime has been working in the Central Mexico region and is now focused on sustainable farming applications. He and his wife Dolores installed their first group of Sistema Biobolsa biodigesters in November 2011 after seeing several success stories in their home region. Jaime was particularly motivated by the impact that organic fertilizers and renewable energy can have to improve the economic viability of farmers in the region. They have installed over 50 biodigesters and have dramatically increased knowledge of the technology in the region through community events.

This loan will allow Jaime to invest in his business, allowing him to increase the scope of his business, train and hire new technicians, cover a larger geographic area, and continue to provide excellent service to farmers wanting to invest in sustainable farming and renewable energy through the technology he provides.

loans.use: To distribute Sistema Biobolsa biodigesters in his region

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.en:
Luis is 38 years old and single, living in a rural area in the North of Peru. He has, for a long time now, been establishing his small business raising and commericalizing animals. He has been able to consolidate his client base, which is mainly composed of other suppliers who then sell the products in the open market in the towns nearby. 

As a result of his current operations, Luis has identified an opportunity to increase the number of animals he has and, perhaps, to increase the area where the animals are kept. For this reason, he is looking to take a loan of 1500 soles (PEN, Peruvian Sol) with Edpyme Alternativa, so that he can continue to consolidate his business. Kiva and Edpyme's role is particularly important in this area, given that access to formal channels of credit is often more difficult in this region.

loans.use: to buy animals and improve the conditions of the farm in his backyard.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a divorced woman. She has two children, 18 and 20 years old. She describes herself to be honest and sociable woman. She operates a food stall where she sells food and snacks. Her business is located in a viable business environment and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. 

Esha will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy food ingredients for preparing meal to sell to customers. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children with profits generated.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals to sell

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 40-year-old married man. He has two children, 10 months and 7 years old. He describes himself to be a humble and honest man. He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

William's business is located in a viable business environment and his primary customers are female. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell.

Earlier on, William had taken a loan of Kes 48,000 which he managed to repay well. His business goal is to venture into a retail store and boutique business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a successful business running.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lwambi

texts.en:
Lwambi is a 73-year-old married man with five children. He describes himself as a patient man.

For the past ten years Lwambi has operated a shop from which he sells home products. His shop is located in a busy area, and his primary customers are local residents. The high wholesale price for his shop’s stock is his biggest business challenge.

Lwambi has requested a 40,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more stock for his shop. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within five years. He is working now to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his shop.

loans.name: Jonathan Miguel

texts.es:
Jonathan Miguel tiene 22 años es soltero  tiene un hijo de un año vive con los padres en el Canton Pueblo Viejo Provincia de LOs Rios.

Jonathan pertenece a la ventanilla ANCHOVETA se encuentre ubicada en la parroquia Puerto Pechiche recinto Anchoveta pertenece al Canton Pueblo Viejo se dedica a labores agricolas.

Jonathan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maiz, las compras las realiza en ventanas y las realiza en la ciudad de ventanas.

El credito solicita para la compra de semillas, fertilizantres, y abonos la sembrar maiz. El credito le ayudado a suplir las necesidades de la familiares y de la produccion. El sueño de Jonathan es sembran as y comprar un terreno.

Ha enfrentado desafios como la lluvia que ha dañado la siembra. En los tiempos libres le gusta jugar indor con los amigos del barrio.
texts.en:
Jonathan Miguel is 22 years old, he is single and has a child aged 1. He lives with his parents in Pueblo Viejo, a canton of the province of Los Rios.

Jonathan is a member of Anchoveta (Anchovy), a Communal Bank located in the parish of Puerto Pechiche in the canton of Pueblo Viejo. He engages in agriculture.

Jonathan is a farmer and he plants corn. He buys seeds in the town of Ventanas.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy seeds, fertilizers and manure to sow corn. The loan has helped him in supporting both his family and his production. Jonathan dreams of planting more corn and of buying some land.

He has faced many challenges such has the rain that has caused damages to his harvest. In his free time he likes playing indoor soccer with friends of his neighborhood.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and manure.

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María de la Cruz tiene cuarenta y dos años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con los padres en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

María de la Cruz se dedica a la agricultura  a la siembra de arroz, maíz, además se dedica a la cría de gallinas, patos y cerdos. Solicita el crédito comprar semillas, urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas.

Con el apoyo del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hace para la siembra. Realiza sus compras en Guayaquil.

El sueño de la señora es tener un negocio de ropa grande. El desafío al que se enfrenta la señora es la competencia y las plagas.

En su tiempo libre se dedica a pensar cosas positivas para su vida.
texts.en:
María de la Cruz is 42 years old, single and doesn't have any children.  She lives with her parents in Ventanas canton, in los Ríos province.

The Cevallos community bank is located in San Francisco, in San Juan de Pueblo Viejo parish.  The members of this bank work in agriculture.

María de la Cruz is a farmer who grows rice and corn.  She also raises hens, ducks and pigs.  She is requesting this loan to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and insecticides.

With the support of this loan, she will be able to buy the fertilizers that she really needs in order to grow her crops.  She makes her purchases in Guayaquil.

María de la Cruz's dream is to have a large clothing business.  The challenges that she faces are competition and pests.  In her free time, she likes to think positive thoughts.

loans.use: to buy seeds, urea, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from 1 year to 14 years old. She describes herself to be social and loyal woman. She operates a retail business where she sells fish and household items. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Rose describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy household items. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop  within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children.

loans.use: to buy household items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food ingredients for preparing meals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruit.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a 53 years old woman, who no longer lives with her husband. She has a son who supports her in her activities. Being an independent woman has pushed her to look for new sources of income. With her determination, she has managed to set up a shop where she sells basic staple foods. Part of her success has been thanks to her responsibility and punctuality regarding previous credit taken with Edpyme Alternativa. 

Yolanda is now looking to expand the range of products offered in order to have a wider client base and to consolidate the health of her shop. As a result, she is looking to take a loan of 1200 soles (PEN). Based on her history, she is sure to put the loan to good use and continue improving her shop.

loans.use: to buy food product to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Magno

texts.en:
Magno is 34 years old, married and has 2 children. He is one of those determined and hard working people who has proven that these characteristics, combined with appropriate and responsible financial support, can bear fruit (or lemons in his particular case). He has previously taken two successful credits with Edpyme Alternativa, supported by Kiva, and his lemon crop business continues to help him support his family.

Magno lives in a rural area in Northern Peru with no basic water or electricity services. He grows lemons, which he harvests on a weekly basis. He has also started raising a couple of animals, which he sells in the local market, in order to have a diversified income stream. He has a long history of experience in agriculture and carries out this activities in his own backyard. This time he is looking to get a loan of 2000 soles (PEN) in order to buy fertilizers and to clean his lemon crop, so that his crop can remain of good quality.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his lemon crop and to invest in the cleaning of the harvest.

loans.name: Manuel Eladio

texts.en:
Manuel is 34 years old, single and has no children. He lives in Northern Peru in a house with his parents and brothers in a rural community without basic water or electricity services. He cares for his family following traditions in his region and dedicates his days to growing lemons and mangoes. 

Manuel also has strong skills raising poultry, having more than 11 years experience in agricultural activities. He is now looking take a loan to invest in the protection of his lemon crop during its consolidation stages, to buy compost and fertilizers. He has previously taken credit with Edpyme Alternativa, which he has always taken care of responsibly and puncutally. At the same time, he continues to use the services because it helps him to improve his business planning.

loans.use: to protect his lemon crop during its consolidation stages, to buy compost and fertilizers.

loans.name: Koshbu

texts.ru: Кошбу – лидер группы «Илим - 2», ей  43 года, замужем, воспитывает 4 детей. В 2000 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи,  Кошбу начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве со стартовой суммой в 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Кошбу  сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающем 3 коровы и 20 голов мелкого рогатого скота и  ежемесячным доходом около 4,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кошбу обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 90,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота.  Доходы от кредита Кошбу планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Koshbu is the leader of the "Ilim-2" group.  She's forty-three, married, and has four children.  In the year 2000 she was in search of income for her family, so she started her agriculture and livestock business with starting capital of 3000KGS.  Thanks to persistence and dogged hard work, Koshbu managed to develop her business, which now includes three cows and twenty head of small livestock, earning an income of nearly 4000KGS.  To further grow her business, Koshbu turned to "Bai-Tushum and Partners" for a loan of 90,000KGS to purchase more cattle.  She plans to use income from the loan to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
La socia Marcelina continua dedicandose a la venta de ropa como casacas,pantalones,chompas entre otros,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia a su negocio,ella vende su mercaderia en la feria que se realizan los dias domingos a todos sus clientes que le solicitan,la socia es una persona responsable siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el prestamo para la compra de mas ropa como casacas.

La socia se siente agradecida por el prestamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Marcelina continues to sell clothing such as jackets, trousers, sweaters, and other items.  She enjoys being in this line of work and is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts forth each day in her business.  Marcelina sells her merchandise at the fair on Sundays when all of her customers request her products.  She is a responsible person who works in order to help her family get ahead.  The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more clothing, such as jackets.  

Marcelina is grateful for the loan that has been provided and promises to complete her payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy more clothing.

loans.name: Wilson Agustin

texts.es:
Wilson Agustin tuene 45 años vive en unión libre no tiene hijos, vive con la esposa en el cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

VRC CEVALLOS, SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL RECINTO SAN FRANCISCO, PERTENECE A LA PARROQUIA SAN JUAN DE PUEBLO VIEJO SE DEDICAN A LABORES AGRICOLAS.

Wilson Agustin se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos. Solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, cerdos, patos.
Con el apoyo del crédito va incrementar su negocio. Realiza sus compras y ventas en San Juan y Babahoyo.
El sueño del señor es tener un negocio mas grande.

El desafío al que se enfrenta es la competencia.
En su tiempo libre piensa en que puede invertir para incrementar su utilidad.
texts.en:
Wilson Agustin is 45 years old, is in a common-law relationship, and does not have children.  He and his wife live in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  The Cevallos Communal Bank is located in the San Francisco precinct, in the San Juan parish, an old town where people make their living in agriculture. 
 
Wilson Agustin raises pigs and chickens.  He is requesting the loan to purchase pigs, chickens, and ducks.  The loan will help him increase his business.  He makes his purchases and sales in San Juan and Babahoyo.  He dreams of expanding his business.  The challenge that he faces is the competition.  In his spare time, he thinks about ways to invest in his business to increase profits.  
.

loans.use: to purchase chickens, pigs, and ducks.

loans.name: Neyser Gonzalo

texts.es:
NEYSER GONZALO tiene 27 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo de 2 años de edad, vive con el hijo en la ciudad de Montalvo Provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC. 3 cruces se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja y maíz. 

NEYSER GONZALO se dedica al cultivo de cacao y naranja. Solicita el crédito para comprar abonos, urea, líquidos para la maleza.

Con el apoyo del crédito esta segura de mejorar el cultivo. Realiza sus compras y ventas  en la ciudad de Montalvo cada semana.

El sueño del señor es mejorar la situación económica. El desafío al que se enfrenta es enfrentar la crisis económica.

En su tiempo libre le gusta divertirse e ir al río a pescar.
texts.en:
Neyser Gonzalo is 27 years old. He is single and has one two-year-old son. He lives with his son in the city of Montalvo in the province of Los Ríos.

Neyser Gonzalo is a member of the communal bank "3 Cruces" and works in the cultivation of cocao, oranges, and corn. He buys and sells in the city of Montalvo every week. 

He is requesting the loan to purchase fertilizer, urea, and herbicides for weeds. With the support of the loan, he is sure to improve his crops. 

His dream is to improve his economic situation. His challenge is facing the economic crisis. 

In his free time, he likes to have fun and go fishing in the river.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, urea, and herbicides for weeds.

loans.name: Neyser Dario

texts.es:
NEYSER DARIO tiene 31 años, es soltero tiene un hijo de dos años, vive con el hijo, en la ciudad de Montalvo Provincia de los Ríos.

VRC. Las 3 cruces se dedican al cultivo de cacao, naranja y maíz. 

NEYSER DARIO se dedica a la siembra de maíz y cacao. Solicita el crédito para la compra de urea, abonos, insecticidas para los cultivos. Con el apoyo del crédito podra comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos.

Realiza sus compras y ventas cada semana en la ciudad de Montalvo Provincia de los Ríos. El sueño es ponerse una tienda de víveres.

El desafío al que se enfrenta el señor es problemas de dinero. En su tiempo libre se dedica hacer deporte
texts.en:
Neyser Dario, 31, is single and has a two year-old child.  He lives with his child in the city of Montalvo in Los Rios province.  The members of the communal bank "Las 3 Cruces" are farmers who cultivate cocoa, oranges and corn.

Neyser Dario is a farmer who cultivates corn and cocoa.  He is requesting a loan to buy urea, organic fertilizers, and insecticides for his crops.  With the support of this loan, he will be able to buy the materials he now lacks for his crops.

He makes his purchases and sales every week in the city of  Montalvo in Los Rios province.  His dream is to start up his own grocery store.

The main challenge he faces is money problems.  In his free time he enjoys participating in sports.

loans.use: to buy urea, organic fertilizers, and insecticides for his crops

loans.name: Juliver Gil

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 7:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo,el sueño del socio es mejorar el negocio de transporte.El socio solicita el credito para comprar llantas para su carro.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member is still in the transportation business. He has a car he uses to provide taxi services. He works from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Thanks to this business he supports his child. His dream is to improve the transportation business. He requests the loan to buy tires for his car. He is happy about the loan and commits to honor all the repayments.

loans.use: to buy tires for his car

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is a 39-year-old married man. He has three children with ages ranging from two to ten years. He describes himself to be sociable and loyal.

For the past two years Robert has sold coconuts and charcoal. A lack of money to improve his trade is his biggest business challenge.

Robert is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy greater amounts of charcoal to sell. He is working to expand his business within the next five years. His ambition is to be a wholesale dealer.

loans.use: to buy greater amounts of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a 29-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 4 to 9 years. She describes herself to be jovial and committed to her work. She operates a food stall where she sells food. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Nwanakombo describes her biggest business challenge to be high prices of food ingredients. She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy cupboards and a cooker. Her business goal is to run a restaurant within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide for her family financially.

loans.use: to buy cupboards and a cooker so as to improve the hygiene of the food stall.

loans.name: Ronald

texts.en:
Ronald is a married man. He has two children, 4 and 7 years old. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as sugar, salt, milk, brooms, bread, etc. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a residential area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Ronald describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent harrassment from the city council. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy household necessities. His business goal is to improve his retail business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy more home products.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a married man. He has a son who is three years old. He describes himself to be an honest man. He operates a store where he sells clothes and shoes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy environment  and his primary customers are local residents.

Wilson describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more shoes and clothes to sell. His business goal is to be a supplier of shoes  within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his business.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes for resale.

loans.name: Yda Consuelo

texts.en:
Yda is 42 years old and a single mother who continues to work hard to provide for her child. She lives in Tambogrande in Northern Peru, in an area which only has basic electricity services. For the last 15 years she has been working in the raising of cows and sheep and commericializing milk and animals in the main areas of the district. 

Yda has managed to work as an independent woman, taking care of her child and thinking strategically regarding her life activity. As a result, she is looking to take a loan of 1000 pesos with Edpyme Alternativa to invest in the care of her animals. She has previously taken out credit with the institution and has proven a responsible and punctual person.

loans.use: buy animal feed to produce better quality products

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina es una mujer de  41  años de edad. Es madre soltera y vive con sus 2 hijos en una zona urbano - marginal del distrito de Mochumí, ubicado cerca de la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 30 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. En una comunidad pequeña de gente emprendedora y trabajadora. 

Josefina se dedica desde hace más de 5 años a la venta de pescado fresco. Esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulatoria (a través de una mototaxi) o en un pequeño puesto ubicado en su propio domicilio. Josefina cuenta con clientela establecida, que se siente contentan con el producto y servicio que ella brinda. Además conoce muy bien el oficio ya que su madre también trabajaba en ese rubro.

Josefina había solicitado un crédito anteriormente y este fue financiado a través de Kiva, con este crédito pudo agenciarse de una unidad móvil con la que comercializa su producto con mayor facilidad, por ello ella se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que colaboraron con ella. Ahora se encuentra solicitando un nuevo crédito de 4000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mejoramiento de su vivienda.

Josefina agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con ella en esta oportunidad y que le permitirán seguir mejorando su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos poco a poco.
texts.en:
Josefina is a 41-year-old woman.  She is a single mother and she lives with her two children in an outlying urban area in the district of Mochumí, close to the city of Lambayeque and 30 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.  It is a small community of enterprising and hardworking people.

Josefina has sold fresh fish for a living for over five years.  Her business is both mobile (through use of a mototaxi) and at a small stand located in her own home.  Josefina has an established clientele who is happy with the products and service that she offers.  She is also very familiar with the profession because her mother also worked in this field.  

Josefina has taken out a loan before, which was financed through Kiva.  With that loan, she was able to get herself a mobile unit with which to sell her product more easily.  She is very thankful to the people who helped her.  Currently, she is seeking a new loan for 4,000 nuevos soles that she hopes to use to make improvements to her home.

Josefina would like to thank the people who will help her in advance for allowing her to keep improving her quality of life and that of her children, little by little.

loans.use: to make repairs to her living room floor and fix leaks

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is a 48-year-old single mother who has set up her own shop selling staple foods thanks to her hard work and responsibility in the repayment of credits. She lives in the North of Peru with her daughter, who helps her in the shop, in a community that is mainly agricultural. 

Rosa spotted the opportunity of establishing this food shop over 12 years ago and has developed a reputation in her community as a strong woman. She is now looking to take a loan of 2500 soles to invest in her shop. In particular, she is looking to increase the stock of existing products and perhaps expand the range of goods offered so as to expand her client base and continue to consolidate her shop's reputation.

loans.use: restock her grocery store

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma, 22, is married and has two children, one of whom attends school.  She lives in Msambweni Mombasa where she works as a retailer selling kerosene to her neighbors and town dwellers to support her family. 

Fatuma is currently applying for a Kiva loan because she wants to strengthen her business more each time and plans to use this loan to purchase more kerosene for resale at her business.  Her Kiva loan will make the investment successful and she will be able to provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: buy kerosene to resell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 32-year-old married man. He has four children with ages ranging from three to twelve years. He describes himself to be sociable and talkative.

For the past four years Joseph has sold chickens. He has one employee. His business is in an urban setting, and his primary customers are local residents. A lack of money to improve his trade is his biggest business challenge.

Joseph is requesting a 25,000 KES loan from SMEP to buy more chickens. His goal, though, is to run a hotel within five years. He wants to educate his children using the profits generated from his business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens.

loans.name: Zuberi

texts.en:
Zuberi is a married man and has one child who is still too young for school.  He lives in Msambweni Mombasa, where he works at his grocery stall. For the past two year, he’s been operating his stall to support his family. 

Zuberi is currently applying for a Kiva loan because he wants to strengthen his business more each time and plans to use this loan to purchase bundles of green vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes and onions at a much more special price than usual because he has the capacity to buy at wholesale with his Kiva loan which will make the investment successful.

loans.use: buy vegetables at wholesale

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Because of her need to generate an income so that she can improve her family’s well-being, Mwanasha began her business of selling grocery. Mwanasha is a married woman who lives with her husband and five children. Her main clients are the neighboring community members.  Mwanasha is requesting a first loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, an organization she has been a part of for one year and that made it possible for her to set up her business, in order to give it a more comfortable environment. 

Mwanasha will use the loan to buy stock of green vegetables, tomatoes, onions and potatoes for resale in order to increase the opportunities in the market, such as responding to new customers who have been referred by the current buyers and those whose attention she wants to capture. This is the reason she is asking for this Kiva loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust, with which she will buy supplies in quantity, which will allow her to buy at a discount for cash and large volume.

loans.use: buy vegetables to resell

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
Maria tiene 36 años de edad, casada, con 6 hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, con esposo que es peón agrícola en parcela aledaña del caserío. Se encuentrar en el norte de Peru en una zona rural en la cual no cuentan con  servicios básicos. 

La actividad que desarrolla la titular es la crianza de ovinos como actividad principal ya que cuenta con 25 cabezas de ganado ovino y 20 pavos. La actividad se la reparten entre esposos los cuales se apoyan mutuamente. Se dedica a la crianza hace aproximadamente mas de 20 años. Solicita crédito para la compra de alimento balanceado para animales y mejoras en el corral de los mismos. Para eso cliente cuenta con los conocimientos para la adecuada alimentación de los animales. Ademas clienta trabaja como obrera en fabrica generando ingresos extras al hogar. Previamente Maria a hecho un prestamo con Edpyme Alternativa en el cual fue una clienta ejemplar.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old, married, and has six dependent children. She lives in her own home with her husband, who is an agricultural worker in an adjoining piece of land within the settlement. They live in the northern region of Peru, in a rural area where there are no basic services.

Maria's business is raising sheep. That is her main activity, since she has 25 heads of sheep and 20 turkeys. She and her husband share in the work and support each other. She has been raising animals for over 20 years, approximately.

She is requesting the loan in order to purchase balanced feed for her animals and to fix up their farmyard. In order to do so, our client knows all about how to adequately feed animals. The client also works as a factory worker and generates extra income for the home. Maria had a previous loan with Edpyme Alternativa and proved to be an exemplary client.

loans.use: to purchase balanced feed for her animals.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofía tiene 52 años de edad, es casada y tiene 01 hija a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hija. La cliente vive en una parte rural en el norte del Peru, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla Sofía es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, porcino y aves de corral), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Su esposo es agricultor con parcela propia en la cual tiene sembrado maíz y frijol chileno.  Los ingresos que percibe le alcanza para cubrir sus gastos y los de su familia.

Sofía desea comprar alimento balanceado para su ganado y fertilizantes para el maíz y el frijol chileno, por lo que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 3000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para alcanzar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Sofía is 52 years old, married, and has one child under her care. She lives in her own home with her husband and daughter. She lives in a rural part of the district, but has electricity. 

Sofía raises small livestock (sheep, pigs, farmyard birds), which she sells after they reach ideal weight and size at a local market. Her husband is a farmer with his own plot of land where he plants corn and black eyed peas. The income she receives is used to cover her expenses and those of her family. 

Sofía would like to buy feed for her livestock and fertilizers for the corn and black eyed peas; she believes it expedient to get a loan for 3000 nuevos soles (PEN) from Edpyme Alternative to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 38 años de edad,esta casada y tiene 4 hijos a su cargo. Su prestamo de 2000 soles, muestra su determincacion de seguir incrementando su negocio dado que es una cliente que ya ha hecho prestamos anteriormente con Edpyme Alternativa. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus 4 hijos. La casa está ubicada en Tambogrande, en la parte rural del distrito, pero cuenta con servicio de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla ella es la crianza de ganado menor (ovino, caprino, pavo y gallina), los cuales al alcanzar peso y tamaño ideal los comercializa en el mercado local. Doris tiene experiencia de más de 7 años en la ganadería y le ha ido muy bien. Los clientes prefieren sus animales debido al buen cuidado y crianza que Doris les da. 

Adicionalmente, cuenta con otros ingresos producto de la venta de abarrotes. Doris es conocida y previamente a tenido prestamos con esta organizacion impulsada por Kiva. Gozan de muy buenas referencias y reporta buen record de pagos.
texts.en:
Doris, 38, is married and has four children in her care. Her loan for 2000 soles [PEN] shows her determination to continue expanding her business, given that she is not a client who already has had previous loans with Edpyme Alternativa.

She lives in her own house with her husband and her four children.  The house is in Tambogrande, in the rural area of the district, but she has electricity.  The activity she carries out is raising small animals (sheep, goats, turkeys, and chickens), which she sells in the local market when they reach the ideal weight and size.  Doris has more than seven years of experience in livestock and it has gone very well for her.  Customers prefer her animals because of the good care and breeding that Teresa gives them.

Additionally, she has other income from selling groceries.  Doris is well known and has had loans previously through Kiva with this organization.  She has very good references and a good payment record.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her small farm animals.

loans.name: Yacory

texts.es:
Despues de un exitoso prestamo realisado con Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva, Yacory busca seguir consolidando su negocio y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia que vive en el area rural.

Ella tiene 37 años, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Tambogrande en una zona qie se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadería y artesanía. Es emprendedora y  muy trabajadora. Se dedica a la preparación y venta de tamales, labor que realiza 3 veces a la semana, la preparación lo realiza en su casa y a pedido.  También se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de aves de corral. Al ver que su negocio va creciendo a solicitado un de 1500 soles para comprar alimentos balanceados para sus animales y espera poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos y familia.
texts.en:
After a successful loan through Edpyme Alternativa and with help from Kiva, Yacory wishes to strengthen her business still further and improve her family’s standard of living in the rural area where they live. She is 37 years old and lives with her husband and children in their own home. It has electricity but no other services and is located in the district of Tambogrande, known for its farming, livestock, and crafts.

Yacory is enterprising and very hardworking. She makes and sells tamales three times a week in her home and also takes orders for them. She also raises and sells poultry. Now that she can see her business growing, she is seeking a loan of 1500 soles to buy feed for her animals. Her hope is that she will be able to continue providing support to her family.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Bacha

texts.ru: Бача  44 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей - школьников. Бача работает в школе села Ак-Суу и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи,  занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Бача сумела развить свой бизнес  с хозяйством, насчитывающим 2 коров с приплодом и  ежемесячным доходом около 5,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бача обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скот для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Бача планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, а в будущем мечтает купить машину для семьи.
texts.en: Bacha is forty-four and married with two school-aged children.  She works at the Akh-Su village school to earn additional income for her family.  She raises crops and livestock, a business she started with 10,000KGS in capital.  Thanks to perseverance and hard work she got the business going and now has two cows with calves and a monthly income of 5,000KGS.  To expand her business, Bacha turned to Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 40,000KGS to buy more cows to fatten up.  She plans to use the income from her loan to grow the business and to buy the family a car in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti, 30, is an entrepreneur who has made progress in her goal thanks to her capacity for work and love for her family, which consists of her husband and one child who is still too young for school. 

Binti is the owner of a business.  She generates income for her family by managing a grocery business which she began 2 years ago. Little by little,  Binti has been able to expand what she offers to making fast food and now she has a domestic market made up of her neighbors. The reason for which she is asking for a Kiva loan is to buy foodstuffs:  bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and rice, with which she will be able to get at substantial discounts by buying in large volume.  This is the groundwork for the success of her business and her Kiva loan will enable her to achieve her dreams.

loans.use: buy flour and rice

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha lives in Msambweni, Kenya with her five children. She dreams of a promising future in which she is able to provide her little ones with the potential for success. Her children are the motivation behind her work selling items in a grocery stall. Her business is open on weekends and holidays. It is located near her home and she sells for cash to passersby in her area as well as to neighbors, family members and friends. The customers are familiar with the products that Asha sells and are loyal to her business. 

Asha's goal is to achieve sustainable growth and, in this way, to improve her family's income. Her biggest challenge is to build up enough working capital to be able to grow her business. 

Asha is currently applying for a Kiva loan (her fourth loan through Yehu Microfinance Trust). She will use it to buy supplies such as green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions in larger volumes so that she can develop her offerings even further.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as green vegetables, tomatoes, potatoes and onions.

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya lives in Msambweni, Mombasa. She works everyday because her dream is to have a shop that is well-known in her town. In order to do this, she sells at a vegetable stall to her neighbors and passers-by. With this, she has managed to save and invest in another business of farming vegetables and fruits that has provided the opportunity to generate new income.

The lack of working capital in the face of Hidaya’s dreams are her biggest challenge.  This is why she has turned to Kiva to request her sixth loan with Yehu Microfinance Trust.  With her Kiva credit she will buy bales of clothes, which are in high demand during this rainy season. Her loan should be successful because her sales are based on customer orders.  What she buys has a fast turnover, which causes her working capital to turn quickly and therefore increase her profits. Choosing good customers would increase the recovery of her capital and thereby her earnings.

loans.use: buy clothes to resell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 55, lives in town of Msambweni, Kenya, in a family house. In his store, he sells household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour and rice.  He sells to the neighboring families for their daily use. Ali is a hardworking person who is always involved in productive activities.  He also has a tailoring business, which earns him additional income. 

To further establish his business, Ali is seeking a Kiva loan and has come to Yehu Microfinance for his first financing. With this loan, he will purchase stock of wheat flour, maize flour, rice and cooking fat oil in higher volume than he normally does, so that he can buy at substantial discounts and continue being competitive by taking advantage of market opportunities to support himself and make each day more successful.

loans.use: buy household consumables at wholesale prices

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma 41, is a married woman with six children. She lives in Msambweni, Mombasa where she sells fish to support her family. She’s a very competitive dealer.

Fatuma is currently applying for a 25,000 KES loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She plans to use this loan to buy fish in bulk. By buying at wholesale prices and then selling at retail she will earn more money each time she takes out a loan. In this way her investments will be successful.

loans.use: to buy fish in bulk.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha, 40, is a mother of six children. She lives in Msambweni, Kenya and has operated a business of making ice cubes for resale. Mwanasha's business has allowed her to get ahead, to expand her business, and to earn enough income to have some comforts.
