Her goal is to expand her business further so that her children can obtain a good quality education and be successful in whatever they endeavor. 

Mwanasha is currently planning to take out her first credit with Kiva, which will be her fifth funding through Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use it to buy flavours for making ice cubes for resale. She generates good profits when she buys in bulk, which is what she plans to do in this instance.

loans.use: to buy flavours for making ice cubes for resale.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from her business. She operates a cafe business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She cooks to each customer's request, according to what they have ordered from her. 

Fatuma started working as a merchant five months ago. As she wants to continually improve her businesses, her working capital is no longer sufficient, especially during times when her businesses' turnover increases. This is why she has sought out a Kiva loan through her first financing experience with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With the loan, she will buy bundles of food stuff, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and cooking fat oil.

loans.use: to buy bundles of food stuff, wheat flour, maize flour, rice and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Segundo

texts.en:
Segundo is 39 years old and is looking to take his second loan at Edpyme Alternativa with the support of Kiva. Indeed, he demonstrated responsibility and punctuality in the repayment of the first loan. He managed to put that capital to productive use, which allowed him to improve the prospects for his business and continue thinking about other opportunities. As a result, he is now looking to take a loan of 2000 soles (PEN) to now focus on his lemon crop and needed improvements to his house. 

Segundo lives in the rural area of Tambogrande, which does not have the basic water or electricity services. In his backyard he raises sheep and has the afore-mentioned lemon crop which, with the help of his mother, he has managed to make the main income source of income for them.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his lemon crop and re-build one of the rooms in his house.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
Ofrecer productos frescos y de calidad, dar una buena atención a sus clientes con un ambiente cómodo y familiar es la meta de Veronica, de 47 años de edad,  originaria  de Estelí, madre de 3 hijos, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace dos años, aunque su nivel académico es hasta el bachiller  eso no la detuvo para seguir aprendiendo también realizo  estudios de técnico en computación  ya que su deseo es superarse. Verónica inicio su   actividad por iniciativa propia, quería ser una persona independiente, su esposo la apoya en el negocio pues le envía remesas que invierte en la pulpería, ella en su negocio contrata trabajadores que ayudan a atender a los  clientes, se siente satisfecha en el lugar donde se encuentra pues la demanda es mucha, es un negocio rentable, cuenta con clientes fijos y genera ingresos diarios pero eso no satisface las expectativas de Veronica pues su deseo es ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes para que se sienta en un ambiente cómodo.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mesas, sillas y manteles para su negocio, sus planes futuros es diversificarse en productos, aumentar su clientela, obtener mas ingresos y llegar a ser una de las mejores comerciante de la comunidad, su meta es  darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
To offer fresh, quality products to her customers and provide good service in a comfortable, familiar environment are Veronica’s goals. She is 47 years old, a native of Estelí, and the mother of three children. She has earned her living selling food for two years. Even though she has a degree, that hasn’t stopped her continuing her education. She has also taken an accounting course as she wishes to keep bettering herself. 

Veronica started this job on her own initiative as she wanted to be independent. Her husband helps her with the business by giving her sums of money which she uses to buy merchandise for the store. She has assistants who help her look after the customers. 

Veronica is happy with her current setup: demand for her products is high, the business is profitable, and she has a stable customer base. The store generates a daily income but that’s not enough for Veronica. She wishes to offer still better service to her customers in a comfortable location.

She is seeking a loan to buy tables, chairs, and table cloths for her business. Her future plans include diversification into different products, increasing the number of customers, earning more money, and succeeding in becoming one of the best businesspeople in the community. Her goal is provide her children with a better education and help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and tablecloths

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 21-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He has been driving a bus, which has been a profitable endeavor. However, he needs more support to cover his costs.

Mohammed is requesting a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy spare parts for his bus. He hopes to open a spare parts store. This will enable him to work extra hours and improve his family's income.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his bus.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim, 62, is a married man who has two children, both of whom are adults. He resides at his own house with access to electricity and piped water. His monthly expenses include food and expenses for the family. 

For the past seven years, Kassim has operated a grocery selling business. Kassim has applied for a loan of 20,000 KES from Yehu Microfinance Trust to buy sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and green vegetables. Kassim sells to all categories of people and works six days a week. His major business challenges include seasonality and market prices fluctuation. 

Kassim hopes to see his business expand to a wholesale greengrocery in the future.

loans.use: to buy sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, and green vegetables.

loans.name: Nian's Group

texts.en:
Nian is a 29-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and has three children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Nian is one of the many Iraqi woman who works from home, using her sewing skills to generate income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family.

Nian has seven years of experience building her sewing/tailoring business. She constantly strives to improve her services and opportunities. 

In the past, Nian qualified for and successfully repaid a Relief International micro-finance loan, which she used to purchase a sewing machine and some small furniture items for her work area. She would now like to replace her sewing machine and buy some fabrics and raw materials. To make these purchases, she is requesting another loan from Relief International - Microfinance Iraq.

Relief International - Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor and apply for a loan as individuals. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to replace her sewing machine and buy fabrics and raw materials.

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en: Ameen is 30 years old; he lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is a hardworking and honest man who is married with two children. Recently, he purchased land, which enabled him to build part of his house. He aims to complete his house-building, so he has applied for a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to buy iron and cement so he will be able to build one room and a bathroom.

loans.use: to buy iron and cement for his house.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en: Carmen is 35 years old and lives in Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is married with five children. Carmen has had a coconut production business for five years and gets an income of 3,000 PHP per month. She requested a loan of 4,200 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Carmen has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to use her earnings from her business to provide her children with a decent home, food, and education.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise

loans.name: Floterlita

texts.en:
Floterlita is a 52-year-old married woman who lives in the Philippines. Floterlita is a farmer who operates a business selling coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. Every month, she earn 3,000 PHP from this work. 

Floterlita has requested a loan of 4,300 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Floterlita has been a member of GDMPC for five years. In the future, Floterlita hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Yahany Maribel

texts.es:
Yahany es una cliente recurrente, que ya ha podido adquirir los beneficios de la alianza Edpyme-Kiva para consolidar su negocio vendiendo ropa. Ella es madre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive con su pareja y sus 2 hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande en el norte del Peru.

Ella a demonstrado ser una verdadera joven emprendedora y ha podido desarrollar tiene dos clases de negocios. Sus padres le han otorgado una parte de su casa para que ella pueda instalar cabinas de Internet para su alquiler y en otro lado de dicha casa, Yahany ha instalado un pequeño negocio de venta de ropa y accesorios  para damas, cuenta con una año de experiencia en el negocio y ya ha  conseguido clientela fija.

En este momento Yahany esta solicitando un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 3000 para incrementar el stock de ropa en venta para lo cual viajará a la ciudad de Lima en busca de las mejores ofertas.

Yahany es una mujer bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Yahany is a repeat client who has previously acquired the benefits of the Edpyme-Kiva alliance to consolidate her clothing sales business. She is the mother of a family, 30 years old, and lives with her parents and her 2 children in northern Peru's Tambogrande district.

Yahany has proven to be a truly enterprising young person and has been able to develop 2 types of businesses. Her parents allowed her to use a part of their house to install internet cabins to rent, and on the other side of the house, Yahany has opened a small business selling clothing and accessories for women. She now has 1 year of experience in this business and has already acquired a fixed clientele.

At present, Yahany is requesting a loan through Edpyme Alternative for 3,000 new sols to expand her clothing stock for sale. For that purpose, she will travel to the city of Lima in search of better offers.

Yahany is a hard-working and enterprising woman. People who know her admire her urge to get ahead and progress.

loans.use: buy women's clothes to sell in her store.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is 23 years old. She is married and has one child, aged 4. 

In 2008, she established her cow milk selling business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy a young cow.  

In the future, Kalpana plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. 

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal.  Cows are never raised for beef, but for their milk from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made.  Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day.  In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about USD $0.50.  In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction, as fuel for fires, and for methane, which can be captured in storage tanks.  

The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will repay itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy a young milk-giving cow.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene is a married woman with eight children. Irene is 50 years old and resides at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Irene used her last loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. Her business has grown and has become successful. Now, she's taking out a new loan to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. She hopes to expand her business more.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, such as manure

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a 55-year-old, married woman who has two children. Bebelyn resides at Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Bebelyn owns and operates a farm, where she plants and harvests corn to earn a living. She's been in this business for 25 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,300 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2008, Bebelyn joined GDMPC. In the future, Bebelyn wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is a widow with three children. She is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Elsa is a farmer and manages coconut production to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years and every month she earns PHP 3,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

Elsa has been a member of GDMPC since 2008. In the future, she hopes her children can finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Babita

texts.en: Babita is 29 years old. She is married and has one child, who is 11 years old.  In 2006, she established her grocery store business.  Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent one to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Babita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, a small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping their inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase their profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: To buy grocery goods

loans.name: Indu Maya

texts.en:
Indu Maya is 29 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 11 and 7. 

 In 2006, she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid two loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizers.  

In the future, Indu Maya plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support. 

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. 

With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seeds and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of snacks, canned goods, shampoo, and beverages.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a hardworking man who lives in Msambweni, Kenya. He is married and has seven children, three of whom attend school.

For three years Ali has worked hard every day selling bread at the local market. His main clients are neighbors and passersby. Little by little he has gained his clients’ trust and affection. Through his business Ali is able to sustain his family. He has high expectations for growing it.

Ali is requesting a 50,000 KES loan from Yehu Microfinance Trust to expand his business. His investment plan is to continue selling bread but offering more items such as ice cream and yoghurt according to clients’ demands. By diversifying his merchandise he will improve his business.

Ali believes in the success of this plan due to a expected increase in customers. His qualities of determination and discipline will help his business flourish.

loans.use: to buy ice cream and yoghurt to sell along with his bread.

loans.name: Usha

texts.en:
Usha is 29 years old. She is married and has two children ages 12 and 8.

In 2000, Usha established her vegetable farming business. Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 3 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buys seeds and fertilizers for her business. 

In the future, Usha plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buys seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chynara

texts.ru: Чынаре 42 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей - школьников. Чынара в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи,  занимается полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммой в 15,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Чынара продуктивно обрабатывает 4,8 га орошаемой земли с помидорами, перцем, огурцами и арбузами. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чынара обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку рассады, удобрений и ГСМ.  Доходы от кредита Чынара планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, а в будущем мечтает построить фермерское хозяйство.
texts.en:
Chynara is 42 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. As the main source of income for her family, Chynara cultivates crops, having started her business with an initial investment of 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Chynara currently works 4.8 hectares of irrigated land with tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers and watermelons.

In order to continue expanding her business, Chynara has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase seedlings, fertilizers, and petroleum products. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, and dreams of building a large farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, fertilizers and petroleum products

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is married and has four children. She is 47 years old and resides at Locsoon, Tudela, Philippines. To earn a living, Susan owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products. She has been in this business for 10 years. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this work. She requested a loan of 9,300 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offerings. In 2011, Susan joined GDMPC. In the future, Susan wants to build a house and to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offerings.

loans.name: Turganbubu

texts.ru: Турганбубу 33 года, замужем, имеет 2 детей дошкольного возраста. Турганбубу в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи  занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Турганбубу имеет в своем хозяйстве 3 коровы с приплодом и 3 бычков.Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет 16,000 сом (KGS).  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Турганбубу обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 110,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма.  Доходы от кредита Турганбубу планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса, а в будущем мечтает построить дом для своей семьи.
texts.en:
Turganbubu is 33 years old, married, and has 2 preschool-aged children. As the main source of income for her family, Turganbubu raises livestock, having started her business with an initial investment of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Turganbubu's herd currently includes 3 cows with offspring and 3 calves. Her monthly income from sales of milk and dairy products amounts to 16,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her business, Turganbubu has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 110,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for fattening. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business, and dreams of building a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sarina

texts.ru: Сарине 50 лет, замужем, имеет 2 взрослых детей. Сарина в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи,  занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес 25 лет назад со стартовой суммой в 10,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Сарина имеет в хозяйстве 2 дойных коров с приплодом. Кроме того, на дому Сарина занимается пошивом пластиковых мешков для сахара, которые потом сдает местному сахзаводу.   В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса в животноводстве, Сарина обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку бычков для откорма и перепродажи.  Доходы от кредита Сарина планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса и постройку нового сарая для скота.
texts.en:
Sarina is 50 years old, married, and has 2 adult children. As the main source of income for her family, Sarina raises cattle, having started her business 25 years ago with an investment of 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Sarina's herd currently has 2 dairy cows with offspring. Additionally, Sarina sews plastic sugar bags at home and later sells them to the local sugar factory.

In order to continue developing her livestock business, Sarina has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves for fattening and resale. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business and into construction of a new barn for her animals.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 53 years old and lives in a rural are in North Peru, close to Lambeyeque, with her husband. The community she is part of is formed mainly of people who work in agriculture and the raising and commericalization of animals. The area as a whole is under 'subsistance' conditions and, hence, the access to capital is sometimes more difficult as result of location and lack of collateral. The role of Kiva and Edpyme Alternativa in this economy is particularly important.

Even though part of his time is also dedicated to agriculture, Rosario has, for the last 10 years, established a small shop, which allows her family to have some extra income. He is now looking to take a loan of 4000 soles (PEN) to buy goods to sell in her shop, as well as buying animal feed. She has previously taken credit with Edpyme Alternativa and has proven to be a reliable and punctual person.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell in her shop, as well as to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Janiya

texts.ru: Жание 42 года, замужем, имеет 4 детей, младшей дочери 5 лет. Жания в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи  занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес в 2000 году со стартовой суммой в 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Жания  имеет в хозяйстве 2 дойных коров с приплодом и 0,90 га земли, где она выращивает болгарский перец.  Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет 6,000-8,000 сом  (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса в животноводстве, Жания обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 115,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров.  Доходы от кредита Жания планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса за счет продажи молочных продуктов в соседний Казахстан, а прибыль она намерена вложить в оплату обучения старшего сына в ВУЗе.
texts.en:
Janiya is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children. Her youngest daughter is 5. As the main source of income for her family, Janiya raises livestock, having started her business in 2000 with an initial investment of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her persistence and hard work, Janiya's business currently includes 2 dairy cows with offspring as well as 0.90 hectares of land where she grows sweet peppers. Her monthly profits from sales of milk and dairy products amount to 6,000-8,000 som (KGS).

In order to continue developing her livestock business, Janiya has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 115,000 som (KGS) to purchase dairy cows. She plans to invest her income from sales of additional milk to the neighbouring Kazakhstan into further expansion of her business, and also into post-secondary education for her eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Sita

texts.en:
Sita is 41 years old. She is married and has two children ages 21 and 16.

In 2000, Sita established her vegetable farming business.  Working 7 days a week and 4 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buys seeds and fertilizers.

In the future, Sita plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer.  With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Rogelio Antonio

texts.es: Con su anterior credikiva, Rogelio compró mercancía como chancletas, gafas, ropa interior para damas y caballeros, telas, hilos, sandalias, entre otros artículos que vendió entre sus clientes logrando aumentar su margen de rentabilidad.  En la actualidad solicita su segundo crédito para comprar la mercancía por volumen, ofrecer en su miscelánea variedad de artículos con distintos precios accesibles para todos y tener un mejor inventario y surtido. Rogelio ha venido trabajando fuertemente en el crecimiento de su negocio, buscando siempre un mejor bienestar para el y su familia.  Quedó muy satisfecho con el crédito que le otorgaron por lo cual desea enviar un mensaje a sus fondeadores de Kiva así: “Sigan apoyando esta gran causa que es muy importante para los pequeños empresarios que están cumpliendo su meta de crecer como comerciantes”
texts.en:
With his last Kiva loan, Rogelio bought goods such as flip-flops, sunglasses, men’s and women’s underwear, fabric, thread, sandals etc. which he sold to his customers and increased his profit margin. Now he is seeking a second loan to buy stock in large quantities so he has a wide range of items to offer at good prices. 

Rogelio has worked very hard to grow his business in his efforts to achieve a decent life for himself and his family. He is very pleased with the loan system and wishes to send the following message to Kiva donors: “Keep on helping with this wonderful cause which is very important for small businesspeople who are working towards the goal of growing their businesses.”

loans.use: to buy stock such as clothing, footwear, glasses etc.

loans.name: Reyna Esmeralda

texts.es:
Reyna de 43 años de edad, es originaria de la ciudad de Managua, casada, de oficio comerciante, ella es una de las pocas mujeres de nuestro país que se dedican a la venta de insecticida y servicio de fumigacion, actividad que inicio  desde hace 10 años,  madre de 2 hijos, el hijo varón actualmente estudia su universidad y la hija estudia su quinto año de secundaria.  Reyna inicio su negocio por medio de su papa quien también se dedicaba a la misma actividad, ella le ayudaba a vender sus productos, con el tiempo fue obteniendo experiencia y total dominio en el negocio, luego decide independizarse, pone su puesto de venta de insecticida en su casa de habitación,  pero Reyna no se conformo con eso pues su deseo es salir adelante, hoy en día Reyna no solo vende insecticidas  también brinda  el servicio de fumigación desde hace tres años el cual realiza en la misma comunidad y en los departamentos de la ciudad de Managua, su propósito es eliminar las diferentes plagas que se conocen en la ciudad de Managua,  en su negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposo que le ayuda con la administración del negocio, su expectativa es crecer en productos y  comprar mas equipos de fumigación para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes es por ese motivo  que hoy requiere del préstamo para comprar insecticida y comprar mas equipos de fumigación.
Ella estima el crédito será de ayuda ya que podrá invertir en su inventario con productos mas solicitados por  sus clientes, el cual le generara mayores ingresos, sus planes futuros es crecer en su negocio de fumigación con el apoyo de Kiva para tener un negocio mas rentable, su meta próxima es hacer de su negocio una empresa de exterminación de insectos, llegar a tener trabajadores para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y llegar a ser la competencia de las empresas que se dedican a la misma actividad.
texts.en:
Reyna is 43 years old. She is from the city of Managua. She is married and a merchant by profession. She is one of the few women in our country who dedicates herself to selling insecticide and fumigation services, an activity which she began 10 years ago. She is the mother of 2 children -- her son is currently studying for a university degree, and her daughter is in the fourth year of secondary school. Reyna started her business through her father, who also worked in the same field. She helped him sell his products, and over time she gained experience and thorough knowledge of the business. Later, she decided to become independent, and she set up her sales area for insecticide in the house where she lives. However, Reyna was not satisfied with that, because her desire is to get ahead. Today, Reyna not only sells insecticides, but she also provides fumigation services, which she has done for the past three years. She works within her own community and in the departments of the city of Managua, Her aim is to eliminate the various pests which are known in the city of Managua. In her business she receives support from her husband, who helps her administer the business. Her expectation is to expand her product line and buy more fumigation equipment to satisfy the needs of her customers, and it is for this reason that she currently needs a loan to buy insecticide and more fumigation equipment. 

She believes that the loan will be helpful to her because she will be able to invest in her inventory, buying the products requested most often by her customers, and this will generate more income for her. Her future plans are to grow with her fumigation business with help from Kiva, so that she can have a more profitable business. Her next goal is to make her business into a pest control company, reach the point where she employs workers to satisfy customer demand, and become a competitor to the companies currently active in this field.

loans.use: to buy insecticide and more fumigation equipment.

loans.name: Yordania Esperanza

texts.es:
Con 12,720 pesos Yordania podrá comprar mercancía para aumentar el inventario de su negocio. Ella se dedica a vender juegos de cubrecamas (conforters/bed in a bag) a crédito y además tiene una heladería que opera desde su casa.
Yordania es casada, su esposo es albañil y tiene un ingreso promedio mensual de 12 mil pesos.Tienen un niño de 8 años que está en segundo de primaria.
El deseo de Yordania es tener un nivel de venta que le permita alquilar un local donde abrir la heladería y sacar un espacio de la heladería para vender los juegos de cubrecamas. Yordania es una mujer muy dinámica y trabajadora que quiere, junto a su esposo poder sacar su familia adelante y garantizar la educación de su hijo.
texts.en:
With 12,720 DOP Yordania would be able to buy merchandise to increase the inventory in her business.  She sells bedspread sets (comforters/bed in a bag) on credit.  She also has an ice cream business that she operates from her house.

Yordania is married, and her husband is a bricklayer.  He has an average monthly income of 12,000 DOB.  They have an eight year old son who is in second grade.

Yordania’s wish is to have a level of sales that allows her to rent a place where she can open an ice cream parlor.  She would like to make a space in the ice cream parlor to sell the bedspread sets.

Yordania is a very dynamic and hard-working woman, who together with her husband wants to be able to get her family ahead and guarantee an education for her son.

loans.use: to buy inventory for her business of selling comforters and ice cream.

loans.name: Shanti

texts.en:
Shanti is 31 years old.  She is married and has 2 children aged 11 and 2.  In 2000, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supoorts her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid 5 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods for her business.  In the future, Shanti plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She is thankful for your support. 

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margains.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy groceries for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy textiles for making gowns

loans.name: Cleofe

texts.en: Cleofe is a 43 years old and married with three children. She is from Santa Cruz, Tangub City. Cleofe owns and operates a business venture cooking and serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. She has been in this business for 30 years and earns 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Cleofe joined GDMPC. Cleofe is requesting a loan of PHP 7,800, which will be used to purchase food and drinks to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen, a 37-year-old married mother of six, lives in the Philippines where she is a farmer growing bananas and coconuts to earn a living. In business for seven years, she earns PHP 3,000 every month.

A member of GDMPC since 2010, Carmen is requesting a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In the future, she hopes to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Batsuuri

texts.en: Batsuuri, 37, lives with his wife and his two daughters in a ger (Mongolian yurt) in Suhbaatar province, Mongolia.  Soon his wife will give birth. His daughters are kindergarten students.  He just started his transportation business. He owns a car which is big and uses too much gas. Thus, he can't earn enough income to provide for his family. Therefore, he wants  to buy a baggage carry truck, which will use less gas. He is a hardworking and humble man. He said "I am responsible for my family. I need to operate my business successfully to make enough income."  He is requesting 1,700,000 MNT to buy a truck, which will be use less gas

loans.use: to buy a truck, which will use less gas

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Con 15,900 pesos Pedro podrá comprar mercancía para aumentar el inventario de su colmado (pulpería- neighborhood store). Así Pedro podrá tener un mayor volumen de ventas, por lo tanto mayores ingresos y mejor estabilidad comercial. Pedro tiene 38 años, es soltero y tiene una hija de 12 años que está en sexto curso de primaria.
Hace ya dos años que Pedro inició este negocio, el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Su deseo es que con el tiempo su negocio crezca hasta lograr tener un supermercado en el qe pueda ofrecer servicio a domicilio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
With 15,900 DOP Pedro would be able to buy merchandise to increase the inventory in his neighborhood store.  This way Pedro will be able to have a greater volume of sales, and he would therefore have greater income and improved commercial stability.

Pedro is 38 years old and single.  He has a 12 year old daughter who is in sixth grade.

Pedro started this business two years ago, and it has been growing little by little.  His wish is that, in time, his business will grow until he manages to have s supermarket where he can offer his customers home service.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his neighborhood store.

loans.name: Anunciacion

texts.en: Anunciacion is a widow who has four children. She is 61 years old and resides at Sebasi, Clarin, Philippines. Anunciacion owns and operates a farmland, planting and harvesting corn to sell to earn a living, and she's been in this business 30 years. Each month, she earns PHP 13,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. In 2008, Anunciacion joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Anunciacion wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, soap, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan, 50 years old, is married and comes from Kinuman, Ozamis City. Susan has been farming for 5 years, earning PHP 8,000 a month. In 2011, Susan joined GDMPC. Susan is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Rosalia

texts.en:
Rosalia is a widow with two children. She is 62 years old and lives in Santa Cruz, Tangub City, Philippines.

Rosalia owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns 7,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month. She requested a loan of 9,800 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. Rosalia has been a member of Kiva partner GDMPC since 2009. In the future, Rosalia's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a new house.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
This is Maria Teresa, 47, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Reynaldo, her business partner, and mother to her four children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She works hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Maria Teresa is a fish vendor. She buys different kinds of fish at wholesale prices and sells them by the kilo. She buys fish at the local fish port early in the morning. There are many patrons who prefer her products since they are assured of their freshness and cleanliness. Her store is located in a temporary fish market. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 1000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more fish to be sold every day. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria Teresa dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of fish needed in her business

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Kyrey se encuentra en el 14º ciclo con 16 integrantes, son señoras trabajadoras que se esmeran en salir adelante y por medio de su trabajo ayudar a sus familias.
Candida es la presidenta y también miembro del grupo, comenta que se dedica al macate, es decir a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos, como ser sabanas, frazadas, edredones y demás, gracias a lo cual puede salir adelante y darle a su familia lo que necesitan.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de sabanas, frazadas, edredones y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The communal bank Kuña Kyrey is currently in its 14th cycle. It comprises sixteen members, who are all hard-working women. They do their best to get ahead and to help their families with their work.
Candida is the president and also a member of the group. She says she works as a travelling merchant, that is, she sells all sorts of products on the street, such as sheets, blankets, comforters, etc. This allows her to get ahead and give her family what they need.
She is requesting the loan to purchase sheets, blankets, comforters, and other items, so that she can keep working and helping her family.

loans.use: to purchase sheets, blankets, comforters, and other items.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 36 years old and married with 5 children who are in school. Judith works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell. Judith has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as soap, noodles, canned goods, sugar, milk, etc.. 

In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell

loans.name: Baasankhuu

texts.en:
Mrs. Baasankhuu, 52, sells vegetables and some kinds of groceries. She lives with her husband and four children in the ger (Mongolian housing tents) district, an area of the city with no running water, minimal roads and spotty electricity, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been running her business for over a decade, and she has gained a lot of experience from her business. In the rural area, her family rents a 1-hectare plot of land, and they plant all kinds of vegetables there for her to sell to the customers. 

This year, Baasankhuu wants to plant cabbage in a large amount. First, she needs to buy the seeds of cabbage and organic fertilizer for it. As we know, cabbage is a very healthy and vitamin-containing vegetable. Most Mongolians prefer to use it every day, so she decided to sell cabbages to her customers. Also, she needs to renovate her equipment and tools of the irrigation system. She and her family hope that their customers will appreciate the cabbages they sell to them. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to covering the cost of cabbage seeds, organic fertilizer and new irrigation equipment.

loans.use: To cover the cost of cabbage seeds, organic fertilizer and new irrigation equipment.

loans.name: Sonia Maria

texts.en:
Sonia is a 52-year-old hard-working woman, who has, for the last 15 years, continuously strived to build a reputation as a very good baker. Her responsible use of credit and her determination have allowed her to set up a small bakery where she offers savory and sweet food. This has given her the chance to care for her family, who also support her in the business. 

She has identified an increase in the number of people who visit her bakety in this small town in northern Peru and is hence looking to borrow 3,000 with Edpyme Alternativa, which she will use to buy the raw materials needed to make her goods.

loans.use: to buy basic raw materials to make the goods she sells in her bakery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Dinh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Dinh was born in 1972. She has a son who is in the 11th grade and a daughter who is in the third grade. Her husband is a builder. He gets an income of 3,000,000 VND each month. Mrs Dinh is now raising pigs and chickens and growing rice. Her earning per month is 3,000,000 VND. She has taken part in the credit program of SEDA since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 6,758,000 VND and repaid this loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 8,502,000 VND to buy food for chickens and pigs.

The members of Dinh's group met each other to co-operate in raising and selling chickens in the market.

Mrs Minh is 57 years old. She has a child. She raises chickens for living. She wants to take out a loan of 6,322,000 VND to continue her business.

Mrs Hang is 30 years old. She has two little children. She sells chickens in the market. She wants to take out a loan of 8,066,000 VND to continue her business.

loans.use: to buy more feed for chickens and pigs

loans.name: Melania Susana

texts.es:
Melania es una mujer de 39 años nacida en la ciudad de “Los Bancos” pero actualmente vive con su hijo  en Santo Domingo de los Colorados. Santo Domingo de los Colorados es la cuarta ciudad más poblada del Ecuador y se ubica en la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas en la parte montañosa de la costa. En la ciudad hay abúndate movimiento comercial y el mercado ganadero es el más grande del país. La ciudad también se caracteriza por su biodiversidad, paisajes, y la comunidad indígena de los Tsáchilas. 
Melania trabaja largas horas vendiendo su producto de uso personal como cosméticos y bisutería  de casa en casa. Es madre soltera y quiere mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su hijo incrementando sus ingresos. Por lo tanto, ella solicita un préstamo a Kiva para poder invertir en más mercadería así tener un mejor surtido y con ello mejorar sus ingresos; su experiencia le ha mostrado que es más fácil vender los productos cuando el cliente los puede ver que únicamente mostrando un catálogo, además si realiza una inversión podrá tener mejores precios y artículos de promoción. Con esto  ella darle una mejor vida a su hijo y lograr comprar su casa propia en un futuro ya que ese es su gran sueño.
texts.en:
Melania is a 39-year-old woman who was born in the city of Los Bancos, but currently lives with her son in Santo Domingo de los Colorados. Santo Domingo de los Colorados is the fourth most populated city in Ecuador and is located in the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, in the mountainous part of the coast. In the city, there is abundant commercial traffic and the livestock market is the largest in the country. The city is also known for its biodiversity, scenery, and the Tsáchilas indigenous community.

Melania Lidia works long hours selling personal use products like cosmetics and costume jewelry door-to-door. She is a single mother and she wants to improve her and her son's quality of life by increasing her income. For that reason, she is requesting a loan from Kiva so she can invest in more merchandise; with a better selection, she can improve her profits. Her experience has shown her that it is easier to sell products when customers can see them, rather than just showing them a catalog. Plus, if she makes an investment, she will be able to have better prices and promotional items. With this, she can give her son a better life and buy her own house in the future, since that is her greatest dream.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 47 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from rice retailing. 

Josephine has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this. Josephine aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 52 years old. He has separated from his wife. He supports his four children who are all in school. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 5 years. He gets a monthly income of 20,000 KES from his business.

This is Joseph's first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides and also use part of it to pay laborers on the farm.

He hopes to expand and improve his farming skills so that he can manage to cater for his children.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs which include fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides

loans.name: Lanh

texts.en: Lanh was born in 1968.  She has two small sons. Her husband is a mechanic who can earn 4,000,000 VND per month. Mrs Lanh has a grocery store in which she can get about 3,000,000 VND per month. She has worked as a seller for two years.  Mrs Lanh joined the credit program of SEDA in 2008. In her previous loan cycle, she borrowed 6,322,000 VND and repaid on time. This time, she would like to borrow 8,938,000 VND in order to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: to buy more goods for her personal products and housing products store

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin is 36 years old. He is married to Zilpa and together they have three children aged 10, 7, and 5 years old. He operates a spare parts shop and has been in the business for the past 6 years. Edwin gets a monthly income of KES 14,500 from his business.

This is Edwin's first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to us by one of our field officers. He will use the loan amount to purchase more stock of spare parts for his shop.

Edwin hopes to open a garage in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of spare parts for his shop.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 35 years old and from Nakuru. He is married with three children who are aged between 4 years and 12 years old.

John has a business of selling potatoes. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more sacks of potatoes to add to his stock for sale. He is optimistic that his business will do well after the loan.

He hopes to improve the living standards of his children and give them a good education.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of potatoes for sale.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a 52-year old married man from Ndunyu Njeru.  He has four adult children between the ages of 26 and 32 years old.

James has been a farmer for the past 28 years.  He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds to add to his stock of supplies.  Joel hopes to boost his farming business and improve the standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides and seeds.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia de 50 años de edad, es una antigua prestataria de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo; ella primero formó parte del programa de grupos solidarios, donde recibió un gran apoyo financiero de la Fundación, pero cuando a su compañera  le empezó a no irle bien y a presentar atrasos al pagar, una vez cancelada su última cuota, decidió seguir vinculada a esta organización mediante un crédito individual; Antonia anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de refrescos y licores, pero gradualmente fue remplazando esta actividad por  la de ofrecer servicios de alquiler de lavadoras, en cuanto a que esta actividad le ofreciere mayor seguridad y sosiego. Siempre con espíritu emprendedor se ha ajustado a las circunstancias del mercado por eso ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos, hoy en las edades de 10 a 25 años. En su negocio aprovecha su punto comercial para vender jugos de frutas naturales, que representa para ella otros ingresos y por eso quiere seguir mejorando su estructura. En su oferta de servicios de alquiler de lavadoras, ha logrado incrementar su clientela y muchas veces no es capaz de responder a la demanda del mercado. Estas son las razones por las cuales  está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará 3 nuevas máquinas de lavar y 1 licuadora. Su autonomía financiera para el buen desempeño del crédito es total y maneja una rentabilidad para las ventas apropiadas a este tipo de negocio, lo cual hace prever que el negocio tiene un potencial de crecimiento y que con su inversión de credikiva logrará tener éxito,
texts.en:
Antonia is 50 years old, and used to be one of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo's borrowers. She first belonged to the group loan program, where she received great financial support from the foundation, but when things started not going well for her partner and she started to make late payments, once the last installment was paid, she decided to remain connected to the organization through an individual loan.
Antonia used to work selling soft drinks and spirits, but she gradually replaced this line of work with a service renting out washing machines, because this business offered her more security and peace of mind. Her entrepreneurship has always allowed her to adapt to the market circumstances. That is why she has been able to provide for her family, which comprises her husband and three children, who are now between the ages of ten and 25. 
She makes the most of her business location by also selling natural fruit juices, which represent extra income for her. That is why she wants to continue improving its structure. In offering washing machine rental services, she has managed to increase her customer base and she is often unable to meet the market's demand. These are the reasons why she is requesting a Kiva loan, which will be her first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use it to purchase three new washing machines and a blender.
She has total financial independence to pay back the loan appropriately, and she manages sales profitability according to her business type. This predicts potential for growth in her business, as well as success with her Kiva loan investment.

loans.use: to purchase three new washing machines and a blender.

loans.name: Edison Javier

texts.es:
Edison es un hombre soltero de 24 años que vive solo en "San Miguel de Los Bancos" que es un cantón rural de la Provincia de Pichincha, donde se encuentra la capital del Ecuador. Uno de los principales recursos "Los Bancos" es el hídrico ya que  en su territorio se originan un sin número de riachuelos y pequeñas vertientes que dan paso a ríos de considerable tamaño. Este cantón tiene un gran movimiento comercial que se desenvuelve en la calle principal, donde se encuentran hoteles, restaurantes y almacenes, sobre todo de productos agropecuarios, así como servicios veterinarios y tiendas para el consumo diario de la población.

Se dedica a la crianza de cerdos para luego venderlos a mayor precio desde hace 4 años. Su jornada laboral llega en promedio a las 12 horas al día, todo esto para poder tener una vida modesta ya que tiene dos cargas que sustentar porque a pesar de no estar casado pasa una pensión alimenticia a los dos hijos que tiene. Esta actividad la inició por su propia cuenta, es el único de su familia que se dedica a esto. El desea invertir en la compra de cerdos bebé y para ello se valdrá de un crédito. Con esto piensa incrementar su producción ya que su capacidad instalada lo permite.

Luis únicamente ha cursado la educación primaria y pese a ello éste no  ha sido un obstáculo para poder destacarse como un emprendedor y trabajador. Su sueño es poder algún día tener su auto propio y seguir en el mismo negocio.
texts.en:
Edison is a single, 24 year-old man who lives by himself in "San Miguel de Los Bancos," which is a rural canton of Pichincha province.  This province also contains the capital of Ecuador.  One of the principal resources of San Miguel de Los Bancos is its water, as there are countless rivulets and small waterfalls that originate in this territory and give rise to rivers of considerable size. This canton has a lot of commerce that is developing on the main street, where there are hotels, restaurants, and stores; above all there are agricultural products, and also veterinary services and shops for the daily needs of the population.  

For 4 years, Edison has had a business raising pigs to later sell at a better price.  His daily work takes about 12 hours a day, and he does all of this in able to have a quite modest life.  He has two dependents to support because, although he is not married, he must pay child support for his two children.  He started this activity on his own account; he is the only one in his family who does this kind of work.  He wants to invest in the purchase of baby pigs; this is how he will use the loan.  With this purchase, he plans to expand his production, because he has the space to do it.

Edison has only an elementary school education, but this has not kept him from becoming an outstanding entrepreneur and worker.  His dream is to someday have his own automobile and continue in this same business.

loans.use: to buy baby pigs to raise

loans.name: Luis Gustavo

texts.es:
Gustavo es un hombre de 39 años que junto a su esposa Ana de 34 años y sus dos hijos vive en la Parroquia Eloy Alfaro en Latacunga. Latacunga pertenece la provincia de Cotopaxi en Ecuador, esta ciudad se encuentra a unos 90 kilómetros de la capital Ecuatoriana y está habitada en su gran mayoría por población mestiza e indígena. Latacunga se eleva sobre el nivel del mar a 2760 metros de altura y esta peligrosamente cerca al volcán activo más alto del mundo el Cotopaxi. A lo largo de la historia la ciudad ha sido afectada una y otra vez por explosiones de este gigante. Las personas de esta ciudad en su gran mayoría dependen económicamente de la agricultura y la floricultura, en un segundo plano también la industria turística junto con los atractivos culinarios son bastantes influyentes en toda la provincia. 
De esta pequeña ciudad en el centro del Ecuador surge Gustavo, quien hace poco más de dos años se estableció cerca de una pequeña iglesia y monto su negocio de venta y producción de cerdos. Gustavo ha aprendido constantemente a través de los años las técnicas necesarias para todo lo relacionado a su trabajo y es por eso que le ha ido bien con su negocio y ya tiene varios clientes fieles. El trabaja un promedio de 6 horas al día, pero siente que desea crecer para poder abastecerse de más clientes. Por lo tanto, Gustavo está buscando ayuda para recaudar plata y expandir la infraestructura para su trabajo, en este caso busca construir chancheras para poder adquirir más chanchos y conservar ahí sus animales en óptimas condiciones. Para Gustavo ha resultado realmente difícil acceder a créditos que lo ayuden a crecer esto a pesar de que es una persona que no ha incurrido muchas deudas a lo largo de su vida. 
Así Gustavo, considera que si se le facilita el acceso a crédito él podrá seguir trabajando de la misma manera que lo ha venido haciendo por muchos años pero con mayor capacidad y volumen. Con esto Gustavo dice que no solo mejoraría su situación económica si no todos los aspectos de la vida de su familia entera.
texts.en:
Gustavo is 39 years old, and lives with Ana, his wife, who is 34 years old, and their two children. They live in the Eloy Alfaro Parish, which is in Latacunga. Latacunga belongs to the province of Cotopaxi in Ecuador, and the city is located about 90 kilometers from the capital city, and has a largely indigenous and mixed population. Latacunga is located at an elevation of 2,760 meters above sea level, and is dangerously close to Cotopaxi, the highest active volcano in the world. Throughout the course of history, the city has been affected time and time again by volcanic explosions. The majority of people in the city are economically dependent on the success of their agricultural and floricultural industries, and also make a living in the tourist and culinary industries present in the province. 

Gustavo is from this small city, and a little over two years ago, he started a business next to a church raising and selling pigs. Since he has made an effort to learn constantly through experience and through the tasks of his job, Gustavo is doing well in his business, and he has many faithful clients. He works an average of six hours per day, but he wants to grow and expand so that he can serve and accommodate more clients. He is presently looking for support to expand the infrastructure of his business, and he plans to purchase more pigs and build additional pig pens and corrals to accommodate more pigs in his operation and give his animals better living conditions. It has been very difficult for Gustavo to gain access to loans which would help him to grow his business, since he has had to incur debt over the course of his life. 

If he does gain access to credit and a loan, he plans to continue working as hard as he always has. Gustavo hopes that the support from this loan will help him improve his financial condition and provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.

loans.name: Clementina

texts.es:
La Sra. Clementina se dedica a la venta de joyas, ella gracias a uno de los prestamos que ha recibido de Kiva y de fundacion paraguaya ha podido ir creciendo y mejorando su trabajo. Comenta que le esta yendo muy bien en sus negocios por lo que le gustaría poder seguir creciendo.
Ella solicita el crédito nuevamente para la compra de joyas de plata para poder seguir trabajando, ya que tiene muchos pedidos con lo que quiere cumplir. Comenta que su meta es poder tener mas adelante una mercería donde poder tener mayor ganancias.
texts.en:
Clementina works selling jewelry. Thanks to one of the loans she received from Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya, she has been able to gradually expand and improve her work. She says her business is going very well,which is why she would like to be able to keep expanding.
Once again she is requesting a loan to purchase silver jewelry in order to continue working, because she has many orders she wants to fill. She says her goal is to have a notions store in the future, so she could earn higher profits.

loans.use: to purchase silver jewelry for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, soap, shampoo and beverages.

loans.name: Lily

texts.es:
Lily de 28 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, vive en unión libre con su pareja  y reside en  una aldea que pertenece al municipio de Omoa, Cortes.
Lily, tiene 10 años de haber establecido su propio negocio, ella tiene una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios de  primera necesidad, vende arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, manteca, embutidos, refrescos, churros,  etc.  El negocio lo ha mantenido estable  durante este tiempo y le ha ido bien, sus ventas se mantienen. Ha invertido dos préstamos anteriores los que le han ayudado a incrementar el inventario. Actualmente solicita el tercer préstamo por 11,000.00 Lempiras para surtir de productos que no tiene en inventario, con esta inversión siempre va tener productos que ofrecer a los clientes. Su meta es ampliar el negocio, piensa anexar la venta de ropa usada y cosméticos para tener más clientes e incrementar los ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Lily is 28 years old, and she has three children.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she lives with her life partner in a village in the Omoa municipality in Cortes.

Lily established her own business ten years ago.  She has a grocery store where she sells basic needs food products.  She sells rice, beans, corn, sugar, shortening, sausages, soft drinks, and churros, etc.  She has kept the business stable during this time, and it has gone well for her.  Her sales have been maintained.

She has invested two previous loans, and they have helped her to increase her inventory.  She is currently requesting her third loan for 11,000 lempiras to stock the products that she does not have in her inventory.  With this investment she will always have products to offer her customers.

Her goal is to expand the business.  She is thinking of adding the sale of used clothes and cosmetics in order to have more customers and increase the family income.

loans.use: to stock her business with basic needs food products.

loans.name: Mareth

texts.es: Diariamente en las horas de la tarde,  Mareth  sale de su casa con meriendas que prepara y se dirige a venderlas, entre empleados de empresas, de colegios y de otras organizaciones, que hoy en día la reconocen. Ella es madre cabeza de familia y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 20 y 21 años y siempre ha desarrollado diversas ideas de negocio, en la ciudad de Cartagena. Mareth también vende mercancía variada aprovechando que ha construido una clientela y a ellos hace una preventa, para saber que es lo que necesitan, así les lleva calzado, ropa, cosméticos a crédito que recupera en a plazos ajustados a cada cliente. Así mismo los fines de semana, aprovecha que las amas de casa quieren descansar un poco del oficio de cocina y para ellas vende deliciosas comidas preparadas; con sus ingresos ha logrado apoyar los estudios superiores de sus hijos y su meta es que terminen su carrera profesional. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos para elaborar comidas y una carpa para organizar su punto de atención de una manera más confortable y seguir posicionándose en su negocio de venta de almuerzos y comidas corrientes. La inversión de credikiva garantizará para los clientes, un ambiente protegido de la lluvia y del  candente sol del Caribe, y descuentos por compras en mayor volumen, que generan descuentos, ahorro en el transporte y esto es justamente el éxito de su crédito.
texts.en: Every day in the afternoon, Mareth leaves home with homemade snacks to sell. She sells to employees of various companies, schools, and other organizations who now know her. She is a mother, and the head of her family. Mareth has two children ages 20 and 21. She has always developed different business ideas in Cartagena. Mareth also sells varied merchandise; she has built a clientele does pre-sales in order to find out what they need. She brings them footwear, clothing, and cosmetics on credit and charges in installments tailored to every client. On the weekends, she takes advantage of the fact that housewives like to get a break from cooking; she sells delicious food. With her income, she has been able to support her children's higher education costs. Her goal is for them to finish their studies. She is currently applying for a new Kiva loan, her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With this loan, she will purchase basic materials and supplies for making food, as well as a tent for making her sales point more comfortable. This will allow her to continue selling lunches and food. Investing this loan will guarantee that she will be able to offer her clients a place protected from the rain and the blazing Caribbean sun. This will allow her to get a discount through buying higher volumes, which will allow her to give discounts. She will be able to save on transportation; her loan will be a success.

loans.use: to buy basic materials and supplies for making food, as well as a tent for her location.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El Comite Mujeres Trabajadoras es de chaco, están en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres de la fundación paraguaya. Ellas están aprendiendo a trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo desean poder ayudar a sus familias y darles lo que necesitan.
Marcelina es una de las miembros, ella se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, que ella misma hace. Cuenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día y que viene ya muy tarde. Es muy emprendedora y tiene muchos sueños que desea cumplir.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, condimentos, hortalizas, y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The "Mujeres Trabajadoras" ("Working Women") communal bank is from Chaco. They're on their first loan cycle of Fundación Paraguaya's program for women. They're learning to work together, and through this work they wish to support their families and provide them with what they need.
Marcelina is one of the members. She sells food of every kind, and she prepares it herself. She reports that she works everyday from the very early hours of the day and finishes very late. She's very enterprising and has a lot of dreams she wishes to fulfill.
She requests the loan in order to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables and other supplies, so that she can keep on working and supporting her family.

loans.use: to purchase meat, condiments, vegetables and other supplies.

loans.name: Saliya

texts.ru: Салие 52 года, вдова, имеет 6 детей. Салия в качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи  занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с покупки дойной коровы.  Благодаря настойчивости  и упорному труду,  Салия имеет в хозяйстве 4 дойных коров с приплодом и 0,43га земли, где она выращивает картофель.  Ежемесячный доход от продажи молока и молочных продуктов составляет 12,000 сом  (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса в животноводстве, Салия обратилась  в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойных коров.  Доходы от кредита Салия планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса за счет постройки большого сарая для скота.
texts.en: Saliya is 52 years old, she is a widow and has six children. Saliya does animal husbandry which is the main source of income for her family. She started this business with the purchase of a milk cow. Through her hard work and perseverance Saliya now has four milk cows with calves and 0,43 hectares of land where she cultivates potatoes. Her monthly source of income from the sale of milk and dairy products is 12,000 som (KGS). With a goal to further grow her animal husbandry business Saliya has come to Bai Tushum and Partners for a loan in the amount of 60,000 KGS to buy milk cows. She plans to invest the income from the loan into growing of her business by building a large shed for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Aroldo

texts.es: Aroldo de 45 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y sus 6 hijos en las edades de 9 a 19 años. Él es propietario de una panadería, donde elabora productos derivados de la harina de trigo, como panes, tortas y también productos fritos que distribuye en tiendas del barrio donde habita y en negocios pequeños del mismo sector. Los productos fritos los prepara en las horas de la mañana y el proceso productivo del pan, a partir de las 2 de la tarde, para que su clientela se ambiente con el delicioso olor a pan caliente y lo consuma a la hora de la cena.  Su negocio se mueve diariamente y de contado y su clientela crece cada vez mas, por eso tener un capital de trabajo adicional, para comprar en mayor volumen los insumos de panadería, los cuales aumentan permanentemente de precios, se convierte en un gran desafío, asì como también el modernizar su maquinaria. Estas son las razones por las cuales acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará materiales, como harina de trigo y una batidora semindustrial que mejorará sus tiempos productivos y hará mas efectiva su proceso de trabajo. Su meta mas adelante es tener su propia casa, por eso se esmera trabajando para lograrlo y aumentar así su bienestar familiar.
texts.en:
Aroldo is 45 years old and lives with his wife and their 6 children, ages 9 to 19. He owns a bakery, which makes products derived from wheat flour such as breads, cakes and fried products.  He distributes these products in stores in the neighborhood where he lives and small businesses in the same sector. Fried foods are prepared in the morning and the bread production process starts at 2 pm, so that the surrounding area is filled with the delicious smell of hot bread and his customers eat it for dinner time.  

Aroldo's business is growing daily with more and more customers, so having additional working capital to buy inputs in greater volume for the bakery has become a great challenge.  In addition, the inputs have increased in price permanently.  Aroldo would also like to modernize his machinery. These are the reasons why he goes to Kiva.  This is his first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, through which he will buy materials such as wheat flour and a semi-industrial mixer that will improve his productive time and make his work process more efficient. 

Aroldo's goal is to later have his own home, so he is striving toward it in order to improve his family's well-being.

loans.use: to buy materials such as wheat flour and a semi-industrial mixer.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.en: Sofia is 69 years old and lives in Dicoloc, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with seven children. Sofia has a dress and pillow case making business and earns approximately PHP2,000 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP6,000 to purchase additional cloth and thread for her business. Sofia has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Sofia hopes to expand into another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cloth and thread.

loans.name: Lida Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Lida es de la ciudad de Santaní, es soltera y tiene una hija, se dedica a la venta de mercería cuenta con local propio, donde vende todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, artículos de bazar, calzados y demás. Además de eso vende en forma ambulante todo tipo de productos.
Es un señora muy trabajadora, responsable y muy honesta, comento el cliente empezó a trabajar por Asunción en una casa comercial que se dedica a vender mercerías, su sueño de siempre era de trabajar en forma independiente así no depender más de otra persona, a través con su esfuerzo y dedicación consiguió la que tanto anhelaba y ya tiene su propio local.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás insumos para poder seguir dando a su cliente la variedad a la que están acostumbrados. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Lida is from the town of Santaní. She's single and has a daughter. She sells haberdashery and owns a store of her own where she sells all types of products, such as garments, household goods, shoes, etc. Aside from that, she makes traveling sales of all kinds of products.
She's a very hardworking, responsible and very honest lady, as her customers comment. She started working in Asunción, in a store that sells haberdashery. Her longtime dream was to work independently, so that she no longer depended on someone else. Through her hard work and dedication, she achieved what she so desired and already has her own store.
She requests the loan in order to purchase garments, shoes, household products and other supplies, so that she can continue to offer her customers the variety to which they are accustomed. She gives thanks for the opportunity she's being given.

loans.use: to purchase garments, shoes, household products and other supplies.

loans.name: Merline Francise

texts.fr:
Merline est une jeune de 34 ans mariée mère de 4 enfants,trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle s'occupe aussi de son petit frère qui vit avec elle. Elle est commerçante dans un marché de la capitale depuis 11 ans déjà où elle vend les vivres frais(légumes, piment, les fruits)
en fonction des saisons. Elle achète souvent en petite quantité pour détailler elle-même ce qui ne rapporte pas tout le temps. Elle aimerai pouvoir le faire en grande quantité dans les villages et venir revendre aux commerçantes qui détaille mais jusqu'à présent, son capital ne lui pas permis de le faire parce qu'il n'est pas assez consistant pour les voyages. Cette activité augmentera ses bénéfice et lui permettra d'économiser une partie pour aider son époux avec les rentrées scolaires de leurs  enfants qui approchent en achetant leurs fournitures et aussi de subvenir à leurs besoins quotidiens.Elle réinvestira le reste dans son activité pour l'agrandir
texts.en:
Merline is a young, 34-year-old married mother of four children, three of whom still go to school. She is also responsible for her younger brother, who lives with her. She works selling fresh seasonal foodstuffs (vegetables, peppers and fruit) in the market, and has done so for 11 years. 

Merline buys small quantities often which she sells on a retail basis, but this does not always bring in revenue. She would like to buy large quantities in the villages to resell to retail storekeepers.
