However, her capital has not allowed her to do this to date, as it is not consistent enough to cover her trips. If she can do this her profits will increase. This will allow her to save part of her money to help her husband with the children’s upcoming back-to-school expenses, to buy supplies and to meet their day-to-day needs. Merline plans to reinvest the rest in expanding her business.

loans.use: To increase her stock of merchandise.

loans.name: Amies De Jesus 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AMIES DE JESUS 1 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Marie Rose est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Marie Rose est âgée de 51 ans et vit au Bénin. Marie Rose n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Marie Rose est mariée à un militaire du nom de Constant. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Marie Rose vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les divers besoins de la maison. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Marie Rose vend divers articles, des pièces détachées et des bois de chauffage de façon secondaire, à son domicile. Marie Rose s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Marie Rose sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AMIES DE JESUS 1, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The AMIES DE JESUS 1 group has three female members, who are all friends and live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative is called Marie Rose, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. 

Marie Rose is 51 years of age and lives in Benin. She did not attend school. She is married to a soldier called Constant, and the couple has four children, all at school and all under their care. Marie Rose lives with her husband and children, and together the couple makes sure that the various household needs are met. 

To cover her family expenses, Marie Rose works selling miscellaneous articles, pieces of African cloth and, on a secondary level, firewood, from her home. She gets her supplies from a region of Benin. To satisfy her customers and increase her sales and income, Marie Rose has requested a third loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the AMIES DE JESUS 1 group. Their first two loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous articles, pieces of African cloth and firewood.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité San Antonio, nombre homenaje al barrio, ellas han decidido formar el grupo para poder ampliar sus posibilidades de salir adelante  y obtener un mejor ingresos y de esa forma poder ayudar a sus familias.
Jessica es una de estas mujeres, ella trabaja en su peluquería todos los días y allí atiende a todos sus clientes y gracias a este trabajo puede salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy emprendedora y con ganas de progresar y salir adelante.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos, tintes, shampoo, enjuagues, esmaltes y demás insumos para poder salir adelante y seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The San Antonio communal bank was named in homage to the neighborhood. They have decided to form the group in order to increase their opportunities to get ahead, improve their income and that way be able to support their families.
Jessica is one of these women. She works in her hairdresser's salon every day and there she tends to all her customers. Thanks to this work she's able to get ahead and support her family. She's a very enterprising person with the drive to make progress and get ahead.
She requests the loan in order to purchase cosmetics, dye, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish and other supplies, so that she can get ahead and continue to provide good service for her customers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics, dyes, shampoo, conditioner, nail polish and other supplies.

loans.name: Jules

texts.fr: Jules est un homme de 40 ans marié, père de 02 enfants dont l'âge est respectivement de 9 et 11 ans.Il fait dans l'échange et la vente de livres scolaires  dans un quartier de la capitale.cette activité n'étant rentable qu'en période scolaire, il voudrait ce crédit pour acheter une nouvelle photocopieuse ce qui lui permettra de continuer à faire tourner son activité même en périodes creuses, de gagner un nouveau marché afin d'avoir une clientèle diversifiée et surtout d'augmenter sa marge bénéficiaire. ce bénéfice lui permettra de réinvestir dans le but  d'ouvrir une  librairie moderne et de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jules is a 40-year-old married father of two children, who are aged 9 and 11. He works exchanging and selling school books in a neighborhood in the capital. 

As this business is only profitable during the school year, Jules would like this loan to buy a new photocopier. This will allow him to continue with his business, even during slow periods, to obtain a new market and have a diversified customer base and, above all, to increase his profit margin. This profit will allow him to reinvest, with the goal of opening a modern bookshop, as well as to meet his family’s needs.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Eloisa

texts.es:
La señora Eloísa es viuda tiene cuatro hijos mayores una de ellas está trabajando en otro país. Ella es costurera tiene un pequeño taller de costura, donde trabaja todos los días duramente.
Ella se inicio en este trabajo con una amiga que le enseño a trabajar como costurera. Su hijo mayor le ayudo con su trabajo a comprar sus maquinas, y su hija que está en el extranjero a construir para su taller, ella también trabajaba con una amiga y así junto un poco de dinero para ayudar a su hijo a juntar la plata. Hoy día ella es una profesional en su trabajo trabaja con confecciones de todo tipo de prendas de vestir.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, hilos, botones, agujas y demás insumos para poder seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes. Agradece a Kiva y a fundación paraguaya por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Eloisa is a widow who has 4 grown children, one of whom is working in another country. She is a dressmaker who has a small sewing workshop where she works hard every day.

She started in this line of work with a friend who taught her how to sew.  Her eldest son helped her with his work to buy her machines, and her daughter, who is now outside the country, helped her to build her workshop.  She also used to work with a friend, and in this way she saved some money to help her son gather the money.  Now she is a professional in her work.  She works making all types of garments.

She is requesting a loan to buy fabric, thread, buttons, sewing needles and other supplies so that she can continue to work and fill her customer's orders.  She thanks Kiva and the Fundacion Paraguaya for the opportunity she is receiving, because it will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, sewing needles and other supplies

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 36 years old and has 2 children. She is married and her 2 children are in school.

Mary is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Mary requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Mary has been farming vegetables for 15 years now, and has borrowed from NWTF 12 times in the past to sustain it.

In the future, Mary would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Yemanlin Group

texts.fr: Le groupe YEMANLIN est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies vivant dans un même quartier au Bénin et appartenant à un groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Mègnon Georgette est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Mègnon Georgette est âgée de 27 ans et vit au Bénin. Mègnon Georgette n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Mègnon Georgette est célibataire et vit seule. Afin d'assurer ses divers besoins, Mègnon Georgette vend depuis quatre ans, des poissons à son domicile. Mègnon Georgette s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Mègnon Georgette sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe YEMANLIN, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux crédits précédents ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The YEMANLIN group has three female members, who are all friends, live in the same neighborhood of Benin, and belong to a savings group. The group’s representative is called Mègnon Georgette, and is pictured with her hand raised in the photo. 

Mègnon Georgette is 27 years of age and lives in Benin. She did not go to school, is single, and lives alone. To ensure that she can meet her various needs, Mègnon Georgette has worked for four years selling fish from her home. She gets her supplies from a region in Benin. 

To satisfy her customers’ needs and to increase her sales and income, Mègnon Georgette has requested a third loan from Alidé, along with the other members of the YEMANLIN group. Their first two loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: To buy fish.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 46 años de edad, vive en el Municipio de San francisco de Yojoa, Peña Blanca, vive en unión libre y tiene 3 hijos.
Doña Margarita tiene un negocio de venta de verduras, leña, adicional vende productos por catalogo y joyas de enchape.  Lleva 3 años  y la venta de verdura la tiene establecido en su casa y las ventas por catalogo y el enchape las hace de manera ambulante. Doña Margarita manifiesta que se siente motivada en  seguirse superando y sacar adelante su negocio para apoyar siempre a su familia.
Ella esta solicitando su primer préstamo de 21,000 lempiras para comprar verduras como, repollo, tomate, papas, plátanos, cebolla etc. Y otra parte en compra de enchape, con esta inversión piensa aumentar sus ingresos y tener mas producto que ofrecer a los clientes.
Su sueño es trabajar en su negocio y tener una solvencia económica para no depender de nadie  y  mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita is 46 years old and lives in the municipality of San Francisco de Yojoa, Peña Blanca. She is in a civil union and has three children. 

Margarita has a business selling vegetables and firewood in addition to selling products via catalog and plated jewelry. She has been at this for three years and she has established the vegetable sales in her home. She makes her catalog and plated jewelry sales door-to-door. Margarita says that she feels motivated to continue progressing and getting her business ahead in order to always support her family. 

She is requesting her first loan of 21,000 lempiras to buy vegetables like cabbage, tomatoes, potatoes, plantains, onion, etc. She will use the other part to buy plated jewelry. With this investment she believes that she will increase her income and have more product to offer her customers. 

Her dream is to work in her business and be financially solvent so that she does not have to rely on anyone, as well as to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy vegetables like cabbage, tomatoes, onion, plantains, potatoes, as well as another to purchase plated jewelry to be able to offer more products to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora 2 Group

texts.es:
Este Comité Maria Auxiliadora 2 es un grupo integrado por 12 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas que se unieron con las ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Ellas desean poder dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener, es por ello que siempre se esfuerzan al máximo.
Josefina es parte de este grupo, ella es una persona muy sacrificada y luchadora, es el sostén de su familia y siempre se esfuerza por ellos, para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida digna y sin privaciones. Vende todo tipo de prendas, como ser remeras, camperas, jeans y demás con lo cual tiene los medios suficientes para cubrir los gastos del día a día.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, ya que se viene el frio y quiere tener bien abastecido su negocio. Agradece a Kiva y fundación paraguaya por la gran oportunidad que están recibiendo ella y sus amigas.
texts.en:
This communal bank named Maria Auxiliadora 2 is a group comprised of 12 women. All of them are friends and neighbors who came together with the drive to get ahead and support their families. They wish to provide their families with everything they weren't able to have, and that's why they always strive to the max.
Josefina is part of this group. She's a very self-sacrificing person and a fighter. She's the breadwinner in her family and she always works hard for them, so that she can give them everything they need in order to live with dignity and without deprivation. She sells all kinds of garments, such as shirts, jackets, jeans and other items. By doing this she has the necessary means to pay for her daily expenses.
She requests the loan in order to purchase winter clothing, since the cold season is coming and she wants to stock up her business.
She gives thanks to Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the great opportunity that she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to purchase winter clothing for selling.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Helen has been in this business for 3 years now.

In the future, Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Unidas De San Antonio Group

texts.es:
El comité "Unidas de San Antonio"se originó a traves de promociones  que se hicieron en el barrio.Todas las integrantes son de la misma zona, conocidas y vecinas del barrio.El objetivo de cada de una de ellas es trabajar, fomentar el espiritu solidario y llegar al nivel máximo del programa.
La sra. Ana es la Presidenta del grupo, ella  tiene un Cantina frente a su casa donde vende todo lo que han producido en la agricultura. Ella además vende todo tipo de productos, como ser gaseosas, golosinas y demás insumos. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Solicita  el crédito para surtir su cantina con golosinas, bebidas, galletitas y demás para poder seguir dando a su cliente todo a lo que están acostumbrados.
texts.en:
The "Unidas de San Antonio" group came about via promotions that were done [by Fundación Paraguay] in the neighborhood. All the members are acquaintances and neighbors from the same area. The objective of every one of them is to work, promote a spirit of solidarity, and reach the highest level of the program. 

Ana is the president of the group; she has a shop across from her house where she sells all the produce that they have grown. She also sells all kinds of products, such as sodas, sweets, and other snacks. She says that thanks to her work, she helps her family and gives them what they need in their day-to-day lives.

She is requesting the loan to stock her shop with sweets, drinks, cookies, and other foods to be able to continue providing her customers with what they are expecting.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, drinks, cookies, and more.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Larissa

texts.es:
Larissa es una persona joven, soltera sin hijos que estudia y trabaja. Comenta que tiene un salón de Belleza, donde todos los días trabaja atendiendo a una buena cantidad de clientes todos los días.
Está cursando actualmente el primer año de  la carrera de Ciencias Ambientales de la Facultad de Aplicada en la Universidad Nacional de Pilar. Su meta es poder terminar su carrera y poder aplicar todo ese conocimiento para ayudar a los demás.
Solicita el crédito para el pago de materiales y cuotas de sus estudios para poder rendir sus exámenes finales. Ella está muy agradecida por la ayuda que recibe, pues gracias a ellos estará más cerca de cumplir su sueño de ser una profesional.
texts.en:
Larissa is a young single woman with no children.  She is in school and she is working.  She tells us that she has a beauty salon where she takes care of a good number of customers every day.
She is currently studying in the first year of an Environmental Sciences program in the Department of Applied Sciences in the National University of Pilar.  Her goal is to finish the degree and to be able to use this knowledge to help others.
She is requesting a loan to pay for materials and fees for her studies so that she can sit for her final exams.  She is very grateful for the support that she receives because thanks to this, she will be close to fulfilling her dream of becoming a professional.

loans.use: to pay for materials and fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of canned goods, detergent, shampoo, toothpaste, bread and beverages

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Aty Group

texts.es:
Las 13 integrantes del grupo kuña Kyrey aty son mujeres muy trabajadoras y con un gran espíritu de superación, que se han unido con las ganas de salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Juana vende ropas de todo tipo, comenta que desde siempre ha trabajado y que no teme hacerlo. Gracias a este negocio ha logrado crecer mucho, y sumado a ello la ayuda de si grupo.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas abrigadas, como ser camperas, buzos, bufandas y demás tipos, pues ya se acerca el frio y quiere tener una buena variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes
texts.en:
The 13 members of the Kuña Kyrey Aty group are very hard-working women with a strong spirit of self-improvement.  They have come together with the desire to get ahead and help their families.

Juana sells clothes of all types.  She says that she has always worked and she is not afraid of working.  Thanks to this business she has grown a lot, and she has added to it with the help of the group.

She is requesting this loan to buy warm clothing such as jackets, sweatpants, scarves and other types, since the cold is coming and she wants to have a good variety of items to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy warm clothing to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 42 years old and married with two children.

Grace works hard to provide for her family. She runs a feed retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed to sell.

Grace has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her feed retail business for five years and also earns additional income from her welding shop.

Grace aspires to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of feed to sell

loans.name: Connie

texts.en:
Connie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 24000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her vegetable farming business.

NWTF is relisting Connie's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his corn crop and maintenance for his farm

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 48 years old, married and has 3 children.  

Annie is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Annie requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Annie has been farming vegetables for 5 years now, and she has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Annie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Aida works hard to support her family.

She has a local eatery in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from tailoring. Aida is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Aida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Amanda

texts.en:
Amanda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy tools and equipment to repair her tricycle.

NWTF is relisting Amanda's business profile in support of her efforts to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment to repair her tricycle.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 43 years old and married with 5 children. With 4 children in school, Jesusa works very hard to provide for them.

Jesusa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Jesusa has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as sardines, sugar, soap, eggs, noodles and soft drinks.

In the future, Jesusa would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, shampoo, breads , biscuits  and beverages

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is twenty-five years old. She is married with two children ages three and four. She and her family live in Cortes, Bohol. Mary Jane's husband works as a boat builder while she makes barbecued food to help in raising their family. This has been her business for three years now, earning her 3,000 PHP per month. 

Mary Jane is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like pork, chicken meat, soy sauce, vinegar, salt and spices. She will use her profit for the family's daily consumption and savings for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like pork, chicken meat, soy sauce, vinegar, salt and spices.

loans.name: Maria Reyna

texts.en:
Maria Reyna is 37 years old.  She is single and lives in the Philippines.  

Maria Reyna has a sari sari store that sells  canned goods, snacks, personal care products, household goods and beverages.  She has been in business for 11 years.  She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy more products to sell like additional canned goods, snacks like biscuits, breads, personal care products, some household goods ,beverages and healthy drinks.

Maria Reyna has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Maria Reyna hopes to improve her business and support her nephew’s education.

loans.use: to purchase dditional canned goods, snacks like biscuits, breads, personal care products, some household goods ,beverages and healthy drinks to sell.

loans.name: Felisa

texts.en:
Felisa is married and has three children.  She is 57 years old and lives in Romarate, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Felisa sells charcoal to earn a living and she has been in this business for four years. Felisa earns 7,000 PHP each month doing this type of work.  She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP in order to purchase additional coconut shells to make charcoal for charcoal trading.  Felisa has been a member of GDMPC for two years.  In the future, Felisa hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut shells to make charcoal.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
This is Violeta, 62, resident of Pasay, Philippines. She is married to Florante and is the mother of her children.   By the grace of God, Violeta has managed to support her children's basic needs.  At this time, she is working hard to be able to send all of them to school. 

Violeta maintains a general merchandising business. She sells ready to wear clothing, footwear/slippers and accessories. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer such as herself and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit.  The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing on as their income. Violeta's regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, Violeta is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy orders for her customers. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Violeta dreams of being able to give all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and married with 4 children. With all of her children in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth runs a sari-sari store, or variety store, in the Philippines and requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

Elizabeth has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent and other groceries. 

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of groceries to sell in her store.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
This time, for her seventh loan cycle, Guillerma is borrowing Php 14,000 to fund her food stall business. 

This business was previously funded through NWTF and KIVA partner to provide Guillerma with income that is improving her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more spices to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods to sell in her food stall.

She has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more goods to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ledita

texts.en:
Ledita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Ledita requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

She has been in this business for 25 years.

In the future, Ledita would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and other fishing equipment.

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en: This time, Roxanne is borrowing PHP 25000 to fund her home products retail business. This business was previously funded through a KIVA partner and NWTF to provide for Roxanne and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell

loans.name: Emalyn

texts.en:
Emalyn is 32 yeas old.  She has two children and lives in Tudela, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Emalyn used her previous loan to purchase additional fish to sell. Her fish and seafood selling business is successful and she is taking a new loan to purchase fertilizers like manure to support her planting of vegetables business.

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Sabrina

texts.en:
Sabrina has a clothing line business and earns approximately PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. Sabrina has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional Ready To Wear products. 

Sabrina has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional Ready To Wear products.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
As a married mother of 9 children, Tomasa works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Tomasa is borrowing PHP 13000 through NWTF to buy fishing nets, paints and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

Tomasa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, paints and other equipment to repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 49 years old and married, and has 3 children. 

Virginia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Virginia has been raising hogs for 4 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with 4 children who are currently going school. Josephine works very hard to provide for them.

Josephine runs a rice business in the Philippines and requested a loan of PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future Josephine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to buy computer supplies for her internet cafe business.

Teresita has been in this business for 12 years. Teresita earns more income from a coffee shop.

Teresita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy computer supplies.

loans.name: Leysium

texts.en:
Leysium (in the photo) is a silk weaver. She has been supplementing her business for two months by selling groceries. Her husband, Sim, is a motor taxi driver.

Leysium and her husband have been married since 1977, and they have five children (three sons and two daughters). Three of them are married and live outside of the family home, and two of them assist their mother in her weaving business.

Leysium hopes to expand her grocery store and buy additional grocery items for her inventory. Hence, she is requesting a loan of US $1,100.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store and buy additional grocery items for her inventory

loans.name: Dionecia

texts.en:
Dionecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of bananas to sell.

Dionecia has been in this business for 16 years. She earns more income from her general store and farming bananas.

Dionecia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy additional sacks of banana to sell

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 57 years old and married with 7 children.

Margarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like soft drinks, can goods, egg, noodles, spices, etc.. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from farming rice and sugarcane.

Margarita has borrowed and paid back 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Margarita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Helen

texts.en:
This is Maria Helen, 43, a resident of Taguig City, Philippines. She is married to Benjamin, an employee, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Maria Helen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria Helen hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of snacks and ladies' accessories

loans.name: Ponciana

texts.en: Ponciana is a woman from Panglao, Bohol. She has been engaged in a coconut wine business for 10 years now. Some coconut wines are stored and allowed to ferment to be sold as vinegar. She sells gallons of coconut wine to different Sari-sari stores in her community. She serves as a supplier to existing stores in her place for her income. Aside from this, she also raises hogs for additional profit. Ponciana is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine and hog feed. With her income she will be able to buy nutritious food for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine and hog feed

loans.name: Hilario

texts.es:
El Sr. Hilario tiene 63 años, vive en la ciudad de Itá con su esposa Ramona, quienes conforman una familia muy numerosa con siete hijos a cargo. Don Hilario día a día se esfuerza para sacar adelante a la familia, él tiene una hojalatería en su domicilio hace ya como 12 años, realiza variados trabajo como ser, brasero, bandejas para panaderías, hornitos, etc.
Hilario cuenta que su mini-empresa ha crecido gracias a los créditos que se les fueron aprobando en fundación paraguaya ya que eso les sirvió para su capital de trabajo, hoy en día la materia prima lo consigue de fábricas importantes del país.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de hojalatas, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes. El agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
Hilario, 63, lives in the city of Itá with his wife Ramona, with whom he has a large family - seven children in their care. Hilario works every day to make progress for his family. He has a tinsmith's shop in his home where he has worked for around 12 years, making various things like stoves, platters for bakeries, ovens, etc.

Hilario credits the loans from Fundacion Paraguaya for the growth of his small business, because they have given him business capital. Today he gets his prime materials from important factories in the country. 

He is asking for a loan to buy tin plate so that he can keep working and meeting his orders from his customers. He is grateful for the opportunity from Kiva and Fundacion Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy sheet metal to sell.

loans.name: Tekove Porá Rekavo Group

texts.es:
Tekove Pora rekavo significa en guaraní, segundo idioma del Paraguay, “En busca de un nuevo estilo de vida” es justamente por ello que se unieron estas mujeres, para poder luchar por ello.
Rosa es una de ellas, cuenta que es modista, y que gracias a su modesto trabajo ha salido adelante y día a día se esfuerza para seguir haciéndolo. Gracias a su arduo trabajo ha logrado dar a su familia lo que necesitan y que no tengan que pasar por privaciones.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas, cierres y gomas, ya que tiene pedidos, y le gustaría poder cumplir con ellos. Agradece por la gran ayuda que fundación paraguaya y Kiva le dan.
texts.en:
Tekove Pora Rekavo means "In search of a new lifestyle" in Guarani, the second language of Paraguay. That's exactly why all of these women got together, to be able to fight for a new way of life.

Rosa is one of them, and tells us that she is a seamstress. Thanks to her modest work she has gotten ahead, and day by day she works hard to keep doing so. Through her effort she has been able to give her family what they need and keep them from hardships.

She asks for a loan to buy fabric, zippers and elastics, because she has orders that she'd like to be able to complete. She is grateful for the help that Fundacian Paraguaya and Kiva give her.

loans.use: to buy fabric, zippers and elastics.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

For the past eight years Josephine has sold food in the Philippines. She is requesting a 25,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more food items for her business. She would like to save money in order to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Mujeres luchadoras está integrado por  15 mujeres de la ciudad de Luque, este grupo lleva ese nombre porque las miembros son mujeres luchadoras que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y progresar. El comite se encuentra en el decimo quinto  ciclo del programa y es gracias a su trabajo que salen adelante.
La Sra Myrian es Vendedora de Comestibles , tiene 46 años  de edad es integrante de comite, es separada , tiene 6 hijos. Comenta que gracias a su trabajo ha ayudado a sus hijos y los esta educando, ella es un ejemplo de lucha y sacrificio.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, verduras y demás insumos para poder seguir vendiendo sus alimentos, ya que es su unica forma para ayudar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mujeres Luchadores is made up of 15 women from the city of Luque. They got their name because the women are fighters [luchadores] who work hard to get ahead and make progress. The group is in its 15th lending cycle with the program and it's thanks to their work that they move forward.

One group member, Myrian, is a food seller. She is 46 years old, separated, and has 6 children. She says that thanks to her work she has helped her kids and is educating them. She is an example of struggle and sacrifice.

She asks for a loan to buy meats, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients to keep selling her food, because it's the only way she has to help her children.

loans.use: to buy meats, condiments, vegetables and other ingredients.

loans.name: Andres Avelino

texts.es:
El señor Andres de 62 años, es casado, tiene 2 hijos, es dueño de una Mueblería, carpintería y aserradero bastante conocida en la ciudad por la calidad y buen precio que ofrece.
Andres es una persona  muy trabajadora,  y cuenta que empezó con la actividad hace mas de 10 años, primeramente con una carpintería poco a poco con sacrificio pudo montar para su aserradero que en ese entonces era la única existente en la zona.
El acude a la fundación y a Kiva para pedir un préstamo, el cual quiere invertir en la compra de maderas, también de tornillos, clavos ya que de esa forma podrá seguir teniendo materia prima suficiente para fabricar muebles de buena calidad y a buen precio, de esa forma podrá mantener su clientela.
texts.en:
Sr. Andres is 62 years old, married and has two sons. He is the owner of a furniture store, a carpenter’s shop and a sawmill, which are very well known in the city for quality and good prices..

Andres is a very hardworking person and notes that he started his business more than 10 years ago, first as a carpenter’s workshop and then gradually through sacrifice he was able to open his sawmill, which at that time was the only one in the area.

He has come to  Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to request a loan to invest in buying lumber, screws and nails so that he will be able to continue having sufficient raw material to make good quality furniture at a good price. Thus he will be able to retain his customer base.

loans.use: to purchase lumber, screws, nails, etc.

loans.name: Ara Pyahu Group

texts.es:
El comité de mujeres de nombre Ara Pyahu se conformo en el año 2008,  gracias a que varias señoras de este grupo ya formaron parte de otro grupo anteriormente. Ellas vieron una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias a través del comité y actualmente ya están en el  12º ciclo, en forma conjunta y solidaria dentro del programa.
Elva es una de las miembros, y se define a si misma como una persona muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se sacrifica siempre por su familia, ya que quiere poder darles una vida digna y sin necesidades. Ella se dedica a la venta de leche, lo cual hace desde muy tempranas horas de la manana para que a la hora del desayuno ya este su producto en la mesa de sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de leche en cantidad, para que de esa forma pueda seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
The women's group Ara Pyahu formed in 2008 thanks to several women who were part of another group previously. They saw a great opportunity for themselves and their families through the lending group, and are currently in their 12th cycle together, united within the program. 

Elva is one of the members and she defines herself as hardworking and a fighter who always sacrifices for her family because she wants to give them a dignified life that doesn't lack the necessities. She sells milk, starting very early in the morning so that her product is already on her customers' tables in time for breakfast. 

She asks for a loan to buy milk in large quantities so that she can keep working and helping her family.

loans.use: to buy milk to sell.

loans.name: Luciano Felix

texts.es:
Luciano es tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tres hijos en casa propia  ubicada en la comunidad rural del distrito de Tambogrande- Piura. La casa de Luciano no cuenta con todos los servicios básicos.

Luciano tiene muchos deseos de sacar adelante a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida, es por ello que trabaja arduamente criando sus ganados (ovino y vacuno), dándoles el mejor cuidado para que estos produzcan leche de calidad que él pueda comercializar al mejor precio. A pesar de la gran competencia que Luciano tiene en la zona, este cuenta con clientes establecidos que prefieren su producto. Además ha empezado a vender su producto a la municipalidad de la zona, la que lo utiliza para brindar alimento a los niños pobres del lugar.

Luciano ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles para comprarle alimento balanceado a sus ganados. Estos necesitan con suma importancia este alimento porque de ello depende la buena calidad de su leche. Esta inversión le permitirá a Luciano seguir creciendo en su actividad y cumplir sus metas.

El ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y le ha ido muy bien, el agradece a las personas que le apoyaron en aquella oportunidad y agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyaran en este nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Luciano, 52, lives with his wife and three children in their own home in a rural community in the district of Tambogrande in Piura. Luciano's house doesn't have any of the basic services. 

Luciano has a great desire to get his family ahead and give them a better quality of life. For that reason he works hard raising his livestock (cows and sheep), giving them the best care so that the produce high quality milk that he can sell at the best price. In spite of the competition that Luciano has in the area, he has an established clientele that prefer his product. He also has started to sell his product to the town government, which uses it to feed the poor children in the area.

Luciano has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles to buy balanced feed for his cattle. It is of utmost importance that they get this food because the good quality of their milk depends on it. This investment will allow Luciano to continue growing his business and meeting his goals.

He has already had a loan with Kiva and it went very well. He is grateful to the people that supported him in that opportunity, and thanks in advance the people who will support him with this new loan.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Anjilyn

texts.en:
Anjilyn works hard to support two children. She is married and has a rice retailing business in the Philippines.

Anjilyn requested a 4,100 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have a backup light in case of emergency. Anjilyn is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, cereals, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Sharlene

texts.en:
Sharlene is 30 years old and lives in Paragayo, Poblacion, Sinacaban. She is married with three children. 

To earn a living, Sharlene has a business selling dried fish to the local community. She earns about 1,200 PHP each month doing this type of work. 

Sharlene has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional dried fish to sell. She has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Sharlene would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Welchita

texts.en:
Welchita works hard to support her five children. She is married and has a hog-raising venture in the Philippines.

Welchita is requesting a 4100 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a solar lamp. She wants the lamp so she can save money by minimizing her kerosene expenses. She knows that by using it she is not only saving money but is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Apolonia

texts.en:
Apolonia is 43 years old and lives in Dela Paz, Clarin. She is married with four children. 

Apolonia works in the fish industry and sells fish for a living. She has been doing this for eight years. Apolonia has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. 

Apolonia has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: María Betzabet

texts.es:
María es una madre de familia de 35 años, vive junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en la zona marginal del distrito de Morropón, un distrito de la región Piura.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en su domicilio desde hace mas de cuatro años, ella ofrece en su negocio todo tipo de productos de uso diario, los cuales siempre ofrece a sus vecinos brindándoles buen trato. Su esposo es albañil y además produce y vende adobe, juntos tratan de sacar adelante a su familia.

Se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles para invertir  en la compra de articulos de primera necesidad y mostradores. De esa forma sus ingresos mejorarán y en consecuencia obtendrá una mejor condicion de vida.

María es una mujer trabajadora y responsable. Uno de sus objetivos primordiales es captar mejores clientes y  surtir su negocio, y para lograr esto se esfuerza al maximo y trabaja de sol a sol.
texts.en:
María is a 35 year-old mother. She lives with her husband and her three children in the rural area of Morropón district, in Piura region.

She has been selling groceries from her home for four years. In her shop she offers all kinds of products for daily use. These she always sells to her neighbors, providing them good service. Her husband is a construction worker, and also produces and sells adobe bricks. Together they try to help their family move forward in life.

She is requesting a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa, in order to invest in the purchase of basic household items, as well as counters. In that way, her income will improve, and consequently she will secure a better quality of life.

María is a hard-working and responsible woman. One of her primary goals is to attract more customers and stock her business. To achieve this she does her very best and works from sunrise to sunset.

loans.use: To buy basic household necessities, as well as counters.

loans.name: Judith Alcides

texts.es:
Judith, vive en el municipio de Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Peña Blanca, tiene 38 años de edad, casado y tiene 2 hijos. 
Tiene muchos años de experiencia en agricultura en siembra de viveros, cultivo de yuca y de café., desde hace  8 años trabaja la tierra. La venta la hace en el mercado local por el cual le pagan muy bien, Con su duro trabajo quiere realizar su sueño de darle una mejor vida a su familia.
Ha solicitado un préstamo a ODEF. Este préstamo es para invertirlo en siembra de viveros, y compra de fertilizantes para los cultivos lo que le permitirá sacar buenas cosechas.
Su meta es seguir trabajando como hasta ahora lo ha hecho para seguir manteniendo la rentabilidad en sus cultivos y sobre todo seguir generando  buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Judith lives in the town of Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Peña Blanca. He is 38 years old, married, and has two children.

Judith has many years of experience in agriculture, creating nurseries for his cassava and coffee crops. He has been working the land for eight years. Judith sells what he produces at the local market and is paid very well. Through his hard work, he has been able to fulfill his dream of providing a better life for his family.

He is requesting a loan from ODEF so that he can invest in the planting of his nurseries. Judith will buy fertilizers for his crops so that he can achieve better yields. His goal is to continue working just as he has done up to this point. He hopes to maintain the profitability of his crops so that he can continue generating good earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his crops and supplies for planting his nurseries.

loans.name: Vida Group

texts.es:
Vida, es un grupo de mujeres del municipio de San Nicolás de los Garza. Es un grupo variado de mujeres emprendedoras en donde se combina la juventud y la experiencia.
Una de sus integrantes es Bertha. Mujer entusiasta, madre soltera de un hijo. El ser cabeza de familia la impulsa cada día para trabajar y sacar a su familia adelante. Ella prepara comidas en su domicilio y las distribuye a sus vecinos y empresas cercanas. También hace pedidos especiales, según se lo vayan solicitando.
Le ha ido muy bien, y esto a motivo a comprometerse con un crédito para poder invertir en equipo de cocina, es decir, ollas y electrodomésticos, para la elaboración de sus comidas.
Bertha esta segura, que esta inversión le redituara enormemente.
texts.en:
The group of women known as “Vida” (Life) is from the town of San Nicolás de Los Garza. They are one of many groups that have women entrepreneurs who combine both youth and experience.

One of the members is Bertha. She is an enthusiastic woman and a single mother with one child. Being the head of her family motivates her each day to work and help her family get ahead. Bertha prepares food from her home and delivers it to her neighbors and nearby businesses. She also prepares special requests according to whatever her customers ask of her. Bertha has done very well. For this reason, she is committing herself to a loan so that she can invest in kitchen equipment, specifically cookware and household appliances for preparing food. Bertha is confident that this investment will generate enormous returns.

loans.use: to purchase cookware and household appliances for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of products from UNO like spa products, lotions and multivitamins.

loans.name: Virgen Las Mercedes Group

texts.es:
El Comité " Virgen la Mercedes", es un comité con 12 integrantes se encuentran en el segundo  ciclo, donde todas ellas trabajan juntas y se ayudan para poder salir adelante y ofrecer lo mejor a sus familias.
Juana es miembro del grupo, comenta que gracias al trabajo que hace con su grupo ha podido salir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Juana tiene una despensa bien surtida donde trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano. Su sueño es poder seguir agrandando su local y de esa forma poder seguir adelante.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, lácteos, panificados, verduras, hortalizas y demás insumos para poder seguir brindando la variedad a la que está acostumbrada su clientela.
texts.en:
The committee known as “Virgen Las Mercedes” consists of 12 members who are participating in their second loan cycle. All of them work together and help one another so that they can get ahead and provide the best for their families.

Juana is a member of the group. She says that thanks to the work she has performed with her group, she has been able to get ahead and help her family. Juana has a well-stocked food pantry where she works every day beginning in the early morning hours. Her dream is to continue expanding her shop so that she can keep moving forward.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, greens, and other items so that she can continue offering the variety that her customers are accustomed to having.

loans.use: to buy beverages, dairy products, baked goods, vegetables, greens, and other items.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 29 years old and lives in Locsoon, Tudela. She is married with three children. 

Bernadeth has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for three years. 

Bernadeth has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents. She has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Bernadeth hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate has 15 years of experience in the food catering industry. She established Foodink Catering in 1997. Foodlink provides full-service catering as well as gourmet-to-go options from their retail grocery location. One of their most requested items is a packaged ready to reheat & left in the fridge dinner in a bag. 

Foodink has been located in the same building, on heavily travelled La Brea, for eight years. They have recently leased the unit adjacent to their kitchen which will allow them to expand refrigeration storage, and provide more prep and retail areas. Foodink is located near a number of entertainment companies who comprise the core of their current clientele, both for catering and for gourmet-to-go events.

loans.use: to pay for business operations, such as rent, inventory and to help with a new expansion

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for office supplies, web site development, working capital and marketing expenses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for a contractor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for equipment and rent

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Corlif is a social network site created by its owner, Joseph. The site's uniqueness is its target market--families and close family friends; personal journal, which can be shared with family members and others that are part of your approved group; and, opportunities to engage in video chats. The site was launched by Joseph in March 2011. He is in need of additional capital to promote the re-designed site. The site is already generating a good deal of Internet buzz, with a number of comparisons to Facebook and Twitter.

loans.use: To pay for marketing the re-designed social networking website

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for health department fees and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase equipment to offer for rent

loans.name: Lix Mario

texts.en: Lix is a sculptor who owns LixArt Studios.  His preferred medium is bronze.  His sculptures are priced in the $1,000-$3,000 range.  Funding is needed to create casting, and purchase materials for an additional six bronze sculptures.  This will increase the number of options available to prospective purchasers of the artist's products.  Lix is a good marketer, and effectively uses a range of mediums to raise awareness of his art pieces.

loans.use: to purchase materials and pay for a subcontractor

loans.name: Ilan

texts.en: There are not many other metropolitan areas in the world with a greater ethnic mix than Los Angeles. In fact, more than 30% of the small businesses in the region are owned by immigrants. Pages LA, a DBA owned by Ilan, is an Internet-based yellow pages of sorts, that provides ethnic businesses with a means to reach their target markets. Offered is an on-line guide to 12 (and growing) business directories, each targeting a different ethnicity. The company needs additional funding to hire two business development personnel.

loans.use: to pay for contractors

loans.name: Luciano

texts.es:
Luciano es un padre de familia de 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, en la región Piura. 

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza de cerdos, ovinos, ademas se dedica a la agricultura contando con una hectárea de terreno sembrado de limón que cosecha semanalmente, cuenta con mas de 10 años en su negocio, su esposa lo apoya en sus actividades. Juntos trabajan mucho para sacar adelante a su familia.

Luciano se encuentra solicitando un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de limón para así lograr una mejor producción, ademas comprará alimentos para el engorde de su animales lo cual le permitirá seguir creciendo en su negocio.
texts.en:
Luciano is a 30-year-old father. He lives with his wife and their three children in one of the settlements that make up the farming district of Tambogrande, in Piura region. 

The work he carries out is raising pigs and sheep. In addition, he farms and has one hectare of land planted in lemons that he harvests weekly. He has more than ten years in his business. His wife supports him in his work. Together they work hard to raise their family.

Luciano is applying for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles that he intends to invest in the purchase of fertilizer for his lemon crop, in order to in this way achieve better production. In addition, he will buy feed for fattening his animals which will allow him to keep his business growing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for his lemon crop, and feed for fattening his animals.

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en: California Investigative Services dba Ken Macdonell Investigations provides private investigator services, primarily to attorneys, but with a growing cross-sectional market that has been driven by Internet advertising using Google Adwords.  The company hires independent contractors to conduct the investigations, thus, the only paid employee is the current owner, Thomas.  Debt financing is being sought to expand the Google Adwords program.

loans.use: to pay for marketing using Google Adwords

loans.name: Purevdorj

texts.en:
Purevdorj is 22 years old, a young father who is trying to build a life. His wife is a student. 

He has been working in an auto service called “Sky” as a serviceman since this January. He works from 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. and has just one day off each week. When he accomplishes his work well, he is rewarded by 10 percent of his salary as an encouragement. 

Just a year ago he became a father, and now he should increase his income in order to rear their child. This time he is requesting a loan to cover the remaining cost of his purchased car. He will use his second-hand car as a taxi beyond his job.

loans.use: To cover the remaining cost of his purchased car.

loans.name: Luis

texts.en: Tutti Frutti Frozen Yogurt is a franchise, with 580 stores currently operating world wide.  Luis has been approved as a franchisee, and needs money to purchase the franchise license.  Frozen yogurt is making a comeback, after a 10-year slump.  Pinkberry started the trend, and today average annual growth in frozen yogurt sales worldwide is $200 million, nearly 10%.  More flavors are being offered, and soy-based products are becoming one of the most popular.  Tutti Frutti is one of the franchise leaders, and has recently made a commitment to donate 10% of their profits from “green” products to organizations in poor countries who are committed to job creation.

loans.use: to purchase a franchise license

loans.name: Bold

texts.en:
Mr. Bold, 56, works as a manager in a mining company. He has been working in that company for two years. He lives with his wife, a librarian, and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His son is a student and always wants to help his parents to increase their family earnings. Also he intends to cover his school tuition fees himself. Recently he decided to buy a car that uses natural gas for running a taxi. According to his plan, he will run his business on weekends and some nights when he has less homework. He believes that using a car which uses natural gas is a big contribution to decrease environmental and natural pollutions. His father, Bold, wants to help his son to start his business. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in the summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons Mongolia has hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on the natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of buying his car which uses natural gas.

loans.use: To cover the cost of buying a car which uses natural gas.

loans.name: Shinebayar

texts.en:
Mrs. Shinebayar, 37, is a gas-fitter and she has been working for five years. Sometimes she runs a taxi business for extra profit. Currently she lives with her family in the common apartment in Kherlen, an eastern boundary city in Mongolia. Her living apartment was built in the socialist era before the 1990’s. Since then it has never had any repairs or renovation done to it. It has too much heat loss and emissions through the walls, ceiling and windows. And it becomes too cold and uncomfortable to live in winter time. So that she decided to take a Green loan to make some repairs such as wall and window insulation. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in the summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons Mongolia has hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on the natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan she is taking will be used to cover the cost of the building and insulation materials for her home repair. She believes that her home will be warm and comfortable to live with her family after the repair.

loans.use: To cover the cost of the building and insulation materials for her home repair.

loans.name: Tserenkhand

texts.en:
Mrs. Tserenkhand, 51, lives with her husband and her son in the staff residence in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has worked as a librarian in the university for 26 years. Her husband works in the mining company. They own an apartment with 3 rooms in one of the districts of the city. One of 3 rooms is rented for running a grocery store and the remaining 2 rooms are rented for the residents. Lately her apartment has been bad and having a lot of breaks in it. Also there has been a too much heat loss and emissions through the walls. She had some complaints from her renters. Therefore she decided to make repair, especially wall insulation to her apartment. She thinks that her business will run normally after the repair and renovation. 

Although Mongolia has the lowest population density in the world, it is one of the most polluted countries in the world. This is due to the long and cold winters where temperatures frequently go below -40C (-40F) even in the cities. Also, in the summer, many parts of the country are extremely cold and are known to have snow storms. Both homes and nomadic tents burn a lot of fuel and emit huge amounts of pollution every night from families just trying to stay warm. As well, the extremely toxic smoke from the cars is one of main reasons Mongolia has hard air pollution. In response to this, Credit Mongol offers Green Loans to their clients to make home improvements that reduce heat loss, improve heating systems and buy cars that run on the natural gas.  We believe that together we can decrease pollution and the harmful effects it has on the environment and Mongolians' health. The loan she is taking will be used to cover the cost of the building and insulation materials for her apartment repair.

loans.use: to cover the cost of the building and insulation materials for her apartment repair.

loans.name: Kareem

texts.en: Kareem began HD-LV Apparel Resources in Los Angeles in 2007.  His business provides custom services and had crafted products using variations of paints, inks and dyes that are applied on hats, jeans, jackets and sneakers.  All of his creations mimic background textures of Van Gogh expressionistic paintings. HD-LV Apparel Resources currently occupies two kiosks on a month to month basis and is seeking financing to expand their presence across different market segments.  Over the past 5 years, the business has seen an increase in income which is expected to continue in 2012 with the planned expansion.

loans.use: To purchase equipment and inventory, and to pay for marketing

loans.name: Yoliani

texts.en: Yo-Fo Sales and Distribution was established in 2010 by owner Yoliani to provide wholesale dairy, produce, and paper goods to large and small businesses in the greater Los Angeles area. Their products are ordered 24 hours in advance and ready for pick up or delivery the next day.  With this simple system, their clients are guaranteed the freshest products every day of the week and avoid inventory waste in their warehouse.  Thanks to Yoliani’s efforts and enthusiasm he has managed to increase his client list from just a few clients to over 60 clients in the short 2 years he has been in business.  It is projected that Yo-Fo Sales will continue to grow this year having already added 5 new accounts on to the client list.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
Sara solicita el préstamo para la compra de materia prima ya que anteriormente elaboraba y vendía comida desde su cocina, para ella era muy incomodo vender de esa manera y ahora ya termino de remodelar un local que tiene al frente de su casa para atender mejor a sus clientes. En su negocio vende tacos, hamburguesas, burritos, menudo, etc. Ahora quiere tener mas variedad de comida y para eso quiere invertir en la compra de mas y diferentes ingredientes.
Sara se dedica a su negocio de venta de comida desde hace más de dos años. Su esposo es carpintero y realiza trabajos por su cuenta.  En el negocio la apoyan dos de sus hijas quienes ya no viven con ella pero se trasladan todos los días para trabajar en el negocio, ella aprecia mucho este acto ya que son sus hijas la que la apoyan en todo.
texts.en:
Sara is requesting a loan in order to buy supplies. She previously prepared and sold food out of her kitchen, but she felt very uncomfortable selling in this manner. Sara just finished remodeling a shop in front of her house where she can better serve her customers. In her business, she sells tacos, hamburgers, burritos, tripe soup, and other dishes. Now she wants to offer a wider variety of food, which is why she wants to invest in the purchase of more, but different, ingredients.

Sara has been selling food for more than two years. Her husband is a self-employed carpenter. Sara receives help in her business from her two daughters who no longer live with her, but they are willing to travel every day in order to work. She is very appreciative of the fact that her daughters are willing to help her with everything.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing a variety of dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah Group

texts.en:
Pangkung Lip-Lip Indah Group has continued borrowing loans. This loan will again be used to support the group's efforts in breeding pigs.

Ni Kadek will use her portion of the loan to buy three piglets. Currently, at 375,000 IDR per piglet, the price of piglets is lower than before. She and members of Pangkung Lip-Lip hope their loan can be increased in the next loan period so that their businesses can flourish. 

Ni Kadek and the other group members hope that they will advance in their efforts and become independent so that they will not have to borrow anymore.

loans.use: to buy three piglets.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 37-year-old married man and father of three children. He has more than twenty years of experience in the fields of carpentry, lighting and decorations. Currently, he works at two companies, providing them with furniture and interior décor. Ahmad also provides all types of carpentry work on a freelance basis, from doors to kitchens and bedrooms.

Ahmad is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, to repair his car's motor for $700 and pay his children's school fees for $300. Ahmad will again be able to drive his car to work and save the money he has been spending on taxi expenses. His future business goal is to start his own carpentry workshop, guaranteeing an independent and stable source of income.

loans.use: to repair his car's motor.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Librada se formó  en la colonia de Santa Librada de la ciudad  de Curuguaty, con 11 integrantes con la iniciativa de la señora Marilina. Todas mujeres trabajadoras y de escasos recursos, que luchan por ser mejores y superarse día a día.
Marilina se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser gallinas, cerdos, patos y demás. Ella es una mujer con ganas de salir adelante y es por ello que siempre se esfuerza.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de balanceados con lo cual podrá alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
The committee "Santa Librada" was established in the neighborhood of Santa Librada in the city of Curuguaty. The group has 11 members as a result of the initiative taken by Sra. Marilina. All of these women are hardworking and have limited resources, so they strive to improve and excel day after day.

Marilina raises and sells animals such as chickens, pigs, ducks, and other livestock. She is a woman who has the drive to succeed and is always willing to try her best. Marilina is requesting a loan in order to buy balanced feed that she can provide to her animals.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 36-year-old single man with 12 years of experience in décor design. Since 2004, he has been working at a company specialized in this field, providing gypsum, parquetry and dropped ceilings. 

Ayman is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua to buy new tools for his work and with the money left, he will do some repairs in his house. Ayman is always keen on ensuring the best quality for his loyal customers. 

As his name grows among the clients in this sector, Ayman aspires to start up his own décor company in the future.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his work

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of green mango, coconut, charcoal and cucumber

loans.name: Januaria

texts.en:
Januaria is 55 years old and lives in Estrella, Sinacaban. Januaria is married with six children.
 
Januaria has a store selling a variety of products. Januaria has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Januaria has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Januaria hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en: Anwar lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. He has earned an income by providing transportation services for three years in order to support the needs of his two children. He gets an income of 3,000 PHP a month for this business. For a 29-year-old father, there’s nothing more that can make him happy except to see his children successful in their studies. Without hesitation, Anwar is borrowing 5,000 PHP from GDMPC microcredit to repair the transport vehicle used in his business and provide his children a better education. He joined GDMPC in 2010. His plan in the future is to hopefully improve his business.

loans.use: to repair his transport vehicle used for business

loans.name: Nohemi Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Nohemí tiene 46 años, vive en una aldea de Cuyamel, Cortes,  es casada y tiene 5 hijos. 
Doña Nohemí  tienen un puesto donde vende comida como chuletas, pollo, tortillas con quesillo, tacos y carne azada. Empezó el negocio hace 2 años, decidió poner su propio negocio al verse en la necesidad de generar sus propios ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.  Ella trabaja 10 horas diarias en el comedor, el negocio ha crecido bastante y cuenta con sus propios clientes.
Solicitó este crédito de L15000, para invertirlo en la compra de insumos para el comedor como ser: carne, tortilla, quesillo, condimentos,bananos, verduras entre otras cosas para elaborar sus alimentos para la venta. 
Nohemí  espera surtir un poco más el negocio.
texts.en:
Sra. Nohemí is 46 years old and lives in a neighborhood in Cuyamel, Cortes. She is married and has five children.

Doña Nohemí has an establishment where she sells food such as pork chops, chicken, tortillas with cheese, tacos, and roasted meat. She decided to start this business two years ago because she needed to generate her own income and improve her children’s quality of life. Nohemí works 10 hours a day at her eatery. Her business has grown significantly and has attracted customers that she gained herself.

She is requesting this loan in the amount of 15,000 HNL so that she can invest in the purchase of supplies for her eatery such as meat, tortillas, cheese, condiments, bananas, vegetables, and other items for preparing the dishes that she sells. Nohemí hopes to stock up on a bit more inventory for her business.

loans.use: to buy meat, tortillas, cheese, condiments, bananas, vegetables, and other items for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 32-year-old married man. After 15 years of experience in the field of shoe making and trade, he decided to open up his own business last year. Today, Mohamad employs three men at his shop and another three, temporarily, in high seasons.

Mohamad has a deep knowledge in this sector but he lacks the capital necessary for expansion. For this purpose, he is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, which he will use to buy more supplies, enhance his manufacture and accommodate the increasing demands of his customers.

loans.use: to buy more supplies

loans.name: Evelyn's Group

texts.en:
Evelyn is 47 years old and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is single with no dependents.
 
Evelyn has a general store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to be used in purchasing additional groceries for sale.

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for almost one year.  In the future, Evelyn hopes to expand her business. Evelyn is the leader of a two-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando is from Solinog, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 33 years old and single. To make a living, Orlando owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a transportation service. Orlando been in his business for three years and earns 7,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Orlando joined GDMPC. Orlando is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used for business

loans.name: Ñepytyvora Group

texts.es:
El comité Ñepytytvora está integrado por 10 mujeres de la ciudad de Curuguaty, quienes se esfuerzan al máximo para poder salir adelante y cada día ser mejores.
