Eleuteria es una de las miembros, es la presidenta de este grupo, quien anima a sus compañeras a seguir luchando por sus ideales y metas. Ella se dedica a la venta de quesos, en lo que le va muy bien, ya que tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella su producto. Solicita el crédito para la compra de queso, con lo cual podrá estar abastecida y así cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Eleuteria agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
The committee known as “Ñepytytvora” consists of 10 women from the city of Curuguaty. They strive to do their best in order to get ahead and improve each day.

Eleuteria is one of the members and serves as the group president. She motivates her fellow group members to continue striving for their ideals and goals. Eleuteria sells cheeses and has done very well. She has a good customer base that always buys products from her. Eleuteria is requesting a loan in order to buy cheese so that she can be well-stocked and be able to fulfill the orders from her customers. She is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity she and the other members have received.

loans.use: to buy cheese to sell.

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey is from Calaran, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. He is 25 years old and single. To make a living, Rey owns and operates a transportation service. Rey has been in his business for three years and earns 10,000 PHP a month for these activities. In 2010, Rey joined GDMPC. Rey is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle for better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to repair his existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nazih

texts.en:
Nazih is a 55-year-old married man and father of four children. He has more than 35 years of unique experience in agriculture with a deep knowledge in the growing of various products and plant rooting. Currently, he focuses on tobacco, which he sells to companies, as well as wheat and potatoes, which he offers at wholesale. 

Nazih plans to further expand in his field and for this reason, he is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. He will invest the money from the loan in buying diesel for his water pump motor, an additional planetary for tobacco, and hiring temporary workers. 

Nazih is satisfied with this lending model, which grants him continuity in his work. In spite of his great capacity in this field, he has suffered a lot of difficulties due to costly labor and the government negligence of the agriculture in Lebanon.

loans.use: to buy diesel for his water pump motor

loans.name: Candida Norberta

texts.es: Candida de 72 años de edad, casada, con hijos adultos, totalmente independiente de ella, tiene por actividad economica la venta de mercaderia en general, negocio que lo tiene desde hace 18 años, de forma ambulante y en su casa, en la actualidad esta solicitando el financiamiento para la compra de mercaderia como: pantalones, short, camisetas, tuallas, calcetines, zapatos, ropa interior, blusas de vestir y sport de mujer entre otras.
texts.en:
Candida, 72, is married and has adult children who live totally independently from her.  She sells general merchandise for a living and has been in business for 18 years, as both a street vendor and working from home.  

She is currently requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as pants, shorts, t-shirts, towels, socks, shoes, underwear, blouses and women's sportwear, among other items.

loans.use: To buy pants, shorts, t-shirts, towels, socks, shoes, underwear, blouses and women's sportswear, among other things.

loans.name: Angela Sofia

texts.es:
Ángela Sofía tiene 48 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 5 hijos,  vive con el esposo y los hijos en Ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LUCHA Y PROGRESO, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Progreso prácticamente se han criado en esa zona.

Ángela Sofía se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz suave. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, fertilizantes, insecticidas, líquido mata maleza.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar los fertilizantes que tanta falta le hace  para los cultivos.

Las compras y las ventas lo hacen en Ventanas cada dos meses. El sueño es  invertir la ganancia en la siembra de maíz. Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta es comprar  una bomba de agua para riego.
En el tiempo libre le gusta viajar.
texts.en:
Ángela Sofía, 48, lives with her husband and five children in Ventanas in the province of Los Ríos.

She is a member of the communal bank LUCHA Y PROGRESO, whose members are involved in agriculture and live in the Progreso community where most of them grew up.

Ángels Sofía is a soft corn farmer and she is requesting a loan to buy urea, fertilizers, insecticides and weed-killer.  With the help of the loan she will be able to buy the fertilizers she so badly needs for her crops.

Every two months she buys and sells in Ventanas.  Her goal is to invest her profit in corn planting.  One of the challenges she faces is buying a water pump for irrigation.

In her free time she enjoys traveling.

loans.use: To buy urea, fertilizers, insecticides, and weed-killer.

loans.name: Hugo Francisco

texts.es:
Hugo Francisco tiene 50 años de edad de estado civil unión libre tiene 5 hijos , vive con la esposa y con los hijos en Ventanas en la Provincia de Bolívar.
Es integrante de la VRC LUCHA Y PROGRESO, sus miembros se dedican a la agricultura todos viven en el sector del recinto el Progreso prácticamente se han criado en esa zona.
Hugo Francisco se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar urea, abonos, insecticidas. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar lo que le hace falta para los cultivos.
Las compras de los insumos lo hace en Ventanas. El sueño es poder sembrar más hectáreas de terreno para obtener mejores utilidades.
El desafío al que se enfrenta es la falta de recursos económicos. En el tiempo libre le gusta descansar.
texts.en:
Hugo Francisco, 50, lives with his wife and five children in Ventanas in the province of Bolívar.  He is a member of the communal bank LUCHA Y PROGRESO, whose members are farmers and all live in the Progreso Community where most of them grew up.

Hugo Francisco farms corn for a living.  He is requesting a loan to buy urea, fertilizers, and insecticides.  With the help of the loan he can buy what he needs for the crops.

He purchases his supplies in Ventanas.  His goal is to be able to plant more hectares of land to obtain a better yield.  The challenge he is up against is the lack of economic resources.  In his free time he enjoys taking it easy.

loans.use: To buy urea, fertilizers and insecticides.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan Carlos, tiene la edad  de 28 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y un hijo de 5 años  actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar material como clavos, cuero, tachuelas, pegamentos y algunas herramientas para la reparación de los zapatos. El cuenta ya con un local de trabajo y lo que quiere es reforzar el negocio, el tiene pensado comprar  todos estos materiales para poder reparar los zapatos de una forma mas ágil  y poder hacer un trabajo de mejor calidad  y  así poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica para él y su familia. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos, 28, is married and lives with his wife and five-year-old son.  He wants to use the loan to buy materials such as nails, leather, tacks, glue and other tools to repair shoes.  He has a workshop and wants to strengthen his business.  His plan is to buy all of these materials so he can carry out his shoe repair quicker and do better quality work.  This will generate more income for a better lifestyle and give him and his family a more stable economy.

This is his first loan through FUDECOSUR.  He has never had a state bank loan, but FUDECOSUR is offering him better payment terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair shoes.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is married with 2 children. She is 47 years old and resides in Bañadero, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Venus owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She's been in this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns 10,000 PHP. 

She has requested a loan of 11,600 PHP to purchase new items to expand her product offering. 

In 2009, Venus joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Venus wants to build a house and enable her children to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Fuerza 2008 Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “FUERZA 2008”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Felicitas ella es soltera y tiene 43 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de ferretería, ella vende pinturas, clavos, martillos entre otros materiales para construccion, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia quiere salir adelante, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de ferretería. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar clavos, pinturas, martillos y herramientas al por mayor.
Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo. 
Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de refrigerios, negocio de venta de golosinas, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de servicio de taxi y negocio de internet.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the communal bank "FUERZA 2008", which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Felicitas, one of the members, is 43, has three children and runs a hardware business selling paints, nails, hammers and other construction materials.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. and through her work wants to make a good living.  Her goal is to expand and improve her hardware business.  She is requesting a loan to buy nails, paints, hammers and other tools, wholesale.

The other members are in businesses such as refreshment sales, sweets sales, grocery store, taxi service and Internet services.

The member is grateful to everyone who is involved in helping her meet her goal, and she is committed to paying back the loan on time.

The individual photographs are of members who could not get off work for the group picture.

loans.use: To buy nails, paint, hammers and tools, wholesale.

loans.name: Andresa

texts.en:
Andresa is married with 6 children. She is 51 years old and lives in Overview, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte.

Andresa is farmer and owns rubber cropland, from which she earns a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested additional working capital.

Andresa has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Andresa hopes to plant more rubber crops.

loans.use: to increase capital/finance for her rubber cropland.

loans.name: Vavel

texts.en:
Vavel is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children.

Vavel sells fruit salad in her local community. She has run this business for 5 years. 

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients to make fruit salad, such as milk, sugar and a variety of fruits.

Vavel has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Vavel hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make fruit salad.

loans.name: Haliun

texts.en:
Mrs. Haliun, age 25, lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband and only daughter in a one-bedroom apartment which she inherited from her parents. She is an accountant for a public organization and has been doing this for the last two years. Her daughter attends a local kindergarten and her husband works as a salesman in a retail shop.

Last year Mrs. Haliun suffered serious inflammation of her neck gland which put her out of a job for a few months. In May 2012 she underwent surgery to remove the gland. 

She is currently recovering but needs some money to cover her medical and recovery costs. She is asking for a loan to cover her medical and post-surgery recovery expenses.

loans.use: To cover her medical and post-surgery recovery expenses.

loans.name: Onolbat

texts.en:
Onolbat, 45, lives with his two children in a small old house he owns in Dornod province, Mongolia. He is a single dad. His children are secondary school students.

Onolbat works as a carpenter and started his business in 2006. He is a professional carpenter from Russia. His business is sustainable and has many regular suppliers and customers. He is well known to the locals. 

His house has no water supply or thermal systems. Therefore, he plans to repair his house this summer. He is a humble, hardworking and patient man. 

The loan he is asking for will be used to renovate his house. He is requesting 3,000,000 MNT to buy some necessary building materials and a heater to add a water supply and thermal systems.

loans.use: To buy necessary building materials and a heater to add a water supply and thermal systems to his house.

loans.name: Gabriel Enrique

texts.es:
Gabriel es un joven muy creativo, tiene 22 años de edad y vive en la ciudad e Nazca, la ciudad de Nazca se caracteriza por su clima muy cálido, por sus preciosos atractivos turísticos como las líneas de Nazca las cuales son jeroglifos dibujados en medio de un extenso campo de tierra árida, asimismo tenemos las pirámides de cahuachi, los acueductos de Changuillo entre otros lugares arqueológicos que reciben infinidad de turistas en todo el año, también se desarrolla la agricultura en especial el cultivo de maíz, tuna, cochinilla, algodón, pallares, frutales, entre otros. Cuando Gabriel tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho escuchar música sobre todo porque lo distrae mucho y le ayuda a relajarse, como buen peruano le gusta mucho los platillos típicos de nuestro país, es por ello que su plato favorito es el riquísimo “Arroz con Pollo”. Con la ayuda de sus padres Gabriel pudo estudiar la carrera Técnica de Computación e informática y por ello sus padres se sienten muy orgullosos.

Con mucho entusiasmo Gabriel trabaja día a día en su negocio de filmografía y fotografía, el trabaja alrededor de 5 horas al día pero cuando en su ciudad hay desfiles de colegios o aniversarios puede trabajar hasta 12 horas al día, el puede atender hasta 15 clientes en el día, siempre está atento a los clientes y es por ello que él cree que le va bien en su negocio, por su amabilidad, su buen trato y sobre todo su responsabilidad.

Gabriel está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a su gran apoyo el podrá instalar un estudio de fotografía y revelado de fotos, con esta mejora el podrá tener su propio estudio y ya no gastar en el alquiler o el revelado de sus fotografías en otros estudios, con ello mejorara sus ingresos y podrá seguir trabajando con muchas más ganas de seguir saliendo adelante y sobre todo seguir luchando para conseguir hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener su casa propia y seguir siendo el orgullo de sus padres”.
texts.en:
Gabriel is a creative young man who is 22 years of age and lives in the city of Nazca, which is known for its warm climate and cherished tourist attractions. One such attraction is the Nazca Lines, which are hieroglyphs that have been drawn across large tracts of arid land. There are also the pyramids of Cahuachi, the aqueducts of Changuillo, and other archaeological sites that lure hundreds of tourists throughout the year. This area has developed its agricultural sector, especially the production of corn, prickly pears, carmine dye, cotton, butter beans, fruits, and other commodities. Whenever Gabriel has a little bit of free time, he enjoys listening to music since it provides a distraction and allows him to relax. Being a good Peruvian, he enjoys traditional national dishes. One of his favorite foods is chicken with rice. With the help of his parents, Gabriel was able to earn a technical degree in Computer Science and Information Systems. For this reason, his parents are very proud of him.

With great enthusiasm, Gabriel works every day in his film and photography business. He works approximately five hours each day, but whenever there are school parades or anniversaries taking place in the city, he can work up to 12 hours in a day. Gabriel can serve up to 15 customers in a day and is always attentive to their wishes. The reason why he is doing well in his business is because he is likeable, provides good service, and above all, is a responsible individual.

Gabriel is extremely grateful to the Kiva lenders. Thanks to their support, he will be able to set up a photography studio and photo developing room. By having his own studio, he will no longer have to pay rent or develop his photos at other studios. Gabriel will be able to improve his income and continue working with the drive to get ahead. Most of all, he continues to strive to fulfill his greatest wish of having a house of his own and continuing to make his parents proud.

loans.use: to establish a photography studio and photo developing room.

loans.name: Justine

texts.fr: Justine est âgée de 46 ans et vit au Bénin. Justine a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Justine est mariée à un certain Joseph. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Justine et son mari subviennent ensemble aux divers besoins du ménage. Pour répondre à ses divers besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Justine exerce comme activité la vente de maïs et de farine de manioc depuis près de huit ans dans sa boutique au Bénin. Justine s’approvisionne dans le nord du Bénin. Grâce aux revenus que lui génère ses activités, Justine contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa maison. Pour satisfaire aux besoins de sa clientèle de plus en plus grandissante, Justine sollicite pour une cinquième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement par Justine ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
Justine is 46 years old and lives in Benin. She left school at the secondary level and is now married to a man named Joseph.  

Justine and her husband have three children, all in school and their dependents.  The couple jointly takes care of the various needs of the household.

To cover her various needs and those of her children, Justine has been selling maize and cassava flour for almost eight years, in her shop, in Benin.  She stocks up in northern Benin.

Thanks to the income she makes through this activity, she contributes to her family's various expenses.

In order to meet the needs of an increasing number of customers, she is requesting a fifth loan from ALIDé.  Her previous loans have been duly repaid.

loans.use: to buy some sacks of maize and cassava flour.

loans.name: Wend Waoga Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est la représentante du groupe WEND WAOGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. 03 vont à l’école et elle a 04 personnes en charge.

Mme vend des habits et bijoux depuis 02ans. Sur la photo, elle tient un panier avec ses marchandises. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de secteur 10 en ville. Ses clients sont les habitants de son  secteur.

Mme veut s’acheter 05 douzaines d’habits et 20 bijoux.

Avec les bénéfices du prêt, elle veut agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et s’acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Fatimata is the representative of the Wend Waoga group. She is married and mother to four children. The eldest of the children is 14 years old and the youngest three. Three of the children go to school and Fatimata has four dependents.

She has been selling clothing and jewelry for the past two years. In the picture, Fatimata is holding a basket with her merchandise. She get her supplies at the Sector 10 market in town. Her customers are the residents of her sector.

Fatimata wants to buy five dozen outfits and 20 pieces of jewelry. With the profits she makes from the loan, she wants to expand her business. Her ambition is to improve her family's living conditions and to buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy five dozen outfits and 20 pieces of jewelry.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 24 years old and married with one baby who is ten months old.

Ruth runs an M-PESA point, which is local mobile money transfer business that she has been doing for the past one year, with a good income. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her add business float (electronic cash) for running the mobile money business to keep her business and serve her customers well.

She hopes to earn more money and have enough capital that will help boost her business.

loans.use: to add more business float

loans.name: Ralo Group

texts.fr:
Mr Z.VINCENT  est le responsable du groupe  RALO. Il est marié et père de 03 enfants. Le plus  âgé a 07 ans et  le moins âgé a 10 mois. 02 vont à l’école .Il a 04 personnes en charge.

Mr est gérant d’une cave depuis 01 an. Il s’approvisionne  au secteur 17 en ville. Ses clients sont les hommes et femmes.

Il veut s’acheter  26 caisses de boisson. 

Mr utiliser ses économies  pour la scolarisation des enfants. Il ambitionne  agrandir son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Z. Vincent is the leader of the Ralo Group. He is married and the father of three children. The eldest is seven years old and the youngest is 10 months old. Two of them attend school. He is responsible for the care of four people.

Mr. Z. Vincent has been the manager of a [beverage] cellar for one year. He gets his supplies in the 17th sector in town. His customers are men and women.

He wants to purchase 26 crates of drinks.

Mr. Z. Vincent will use his savings to pay for his children's education. He hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase 26 crates of drinks.

loans.name: Utaratibu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Louise est une femme courageuse,âgée de 43 ans et trésorière de l’association d’affaire Utaratibu. Mère de 5 enfants tous scolarisés et mariée à un homme sans emploi. Elle est vendeuse des souliers depuis sa  jeunesse et est au 8 ième cycle de crédit chez Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir à l’approvisionnement de 25 paires des souliers. Elle souhaite voir son entreprise s'agrandir et ses enfants finir leurs études. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour ses actions.
texts.en:
Louise is a courageous, 43-year-old woman who is treasurer of the Utaratibu business association. She is a mother to five children, all of whom are at school, and her husband is unemployed. 

Louise has worked selling shoes since she was young, and this is her eighth loan with Hekima. This new loan will be used to buy a supply of 25 pairs of shoes. Louise would like to see her business grow, and would like her children to finish their studies. She also thanks Hekima for all they have done

loans.use: To buy 25 pairs of shoes.

loans.name: Aïssatou

texts.fr: Aïssatou est une femme mariée.Elle a en charge ses 5 enfants ainsi qu'un de ses frères.Depuis bientôt 5 ans, elle mène un commerce de vêtements, de parfum et d'encens.Cette activité lui rapporte des revenus non négligeables qui lui permettent de subvenir à ses propres besoins mais aussi de participer aux dépenses d'entretien de sa famille notamment ceux d'habillement, d'alimentation et de santé.Il sollicite en ce moment un pret de 200000f pour acheter des vêtement et du parfum.Son ambition est de construire une grande boutique dans sa localité.
texts.en: Aïssatou is a married woman who has her own five children in her care as well as one of her brothers' children. She has been selling clothes, perfume and incense for almost five years and this business procures a non-negligeable income for her, thus allowing her to provide for her own needs and also to contribute towards her family's clothing, food and health costs. She is currently requesting a loan of 200,000 francs to buy clothes and perfume. Her ambition is to set up a large shop in her town.

loans.use: to buy clothes and perfume.

loans.name: Warna Sari Group

texts.en:
Luh is lives in Pemuteran village, North Bali. She is married and her husband works as a farmer. Though Luh often helps her husband, she also raises pigs in her yard to supplement her family’s income. She has been raising pigs for five years.

Luh is the head of the Warna Sari group, which is made up of ten neighbors from the same village. This is the group’s first loan with MUK. With the 1M IDR that Luh receives, she will purchase three piglets and pig feed. She plans to sell the piglets after six months for use as pork. With her earnings, she plans to purchase more pigs. With the income from her pig raising, she hopes to be able to fullfill daily needs and get some savings.

loans.use: To purchase three piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Sajida's Group

texts.en:
Sajida has been running her boutique for the last eight years. She knows about the latest trends in fashion and clothes and also knows very well about the needs of her clients. Her husband operates a power-loom business.

Sajida has given birth to three daughters. Two of them are studying while her youngest daughter is only three years old. She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further expansion of her boutique business. With the loan investment she will buy cloth and embroidery material for preparing better quality clothes to sell through her boutique. She is very experienced and confident about her business success after investing the loan.

Note: In the photo, the lady holding a book called Asasah Passbook is Sajida.

loans.use: To buy cloth and embriodery material for her boutique business.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a divorced man and lives in Kwale with his child who attends school. Joseph's business is a restaurant business. He started his business three years ago, with a small amount of capital; he started cooking food from home and later on established his own shop at the market.

Joseph's business has gradually grown and now his main customers are not only neighbours but also town dwellers looking for special meals. This helps him grow his business as they always refer new buyers to him. Joseph's main challenge is having enough working capital to buy food stuffs of wheat flour, maize flour and rice to increase his income. For this reason, he is requesting a Kiva loan. This will help increase his income which his family depends upon.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs of wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Saada

texts.en:
Saada is a very enterprising woman who generates income for her family from her business. She operates a poultry business, selling to restaurant operators and café operators, delivering to each customer what they have ordered from her. She started working as a merchant a year ago. 

As she wants to continually improve her businesses, her working capital is no longer sufficient, especially during times when her business turnover increases, such as the middle of the year. This is why she has sought out a Kiva loan through her first financing experience with Yehu Microfinance Trust. With it, she will buy poultry chicks and chicken feed so that she can rear them and resell them at a profit.

loans.use: to buy poultry chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase piglets and pig feed.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 55 years old and lives in Tigdok, Tudela. Fe is married with two children. To earn a living, Fe has a business selling snacks in the community. Fe earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this type of work.

Fe has requested a loan of PHP 14,900 to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar, flour.etc. Fe has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Fe would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as sugar and flour.

loans.name: Hoda

texts.en:
Huda is a 55-year-old widowed woman with a house-based business. For 12 years now, she has been selling various products like foodstuffs and used clothes. 

Huda’s special offering is homemade malban, a starchy sweet with pistachio or walnuts that is popular in the Levant. Her tasteful and clean products as well as the stylish clothes she sells have built Huda a wide and loyal customer base.

To buy the necessary raw food materials and clothing supplies, Huda is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. As she increases her offerings, she would make more money, necessary to cover her living expenses as an independent woman.

loans.use: To buy the necessary raw food materials and clothing supplies.

loans.name: Maguy

texts.en:
Maguy is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of two children. Six years ago, she opened a hairdressing salon to contribute to her household’s expenses. Besides the styling, makeup and facial care services she offers, Maguy also sells accessories and perfumes. Throughout the years, she succeeded in building a sound reputation among hairdressers in her town. 

Maguy is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to buy new tools such as hairdryers, brushes and hair colorants. As demand for her services increase, Maguy needs to maintain the good quality she has been offering. With the money left from the loan, she will do some aluminum and plumbing repairs in her house.

loans.use: to buy new tools such as hairdryers, brushes and hair colorants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more firwood to sell.

loans.name: Wangninan Group

texts.fr: Le groupe WANGNINAN est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Médédodé Florentine, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la cinquième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Médédodé Florentine est âgée de 39 ans et est mariée à un certain Clément. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et trois restent à leur charge. Médédodé Florentine a peu fréquenté l’école. Depuis une dizaine d’année, Médédodé Florentine exerce comme activité, la vente de tissus et des ustensiles de cuisine (assiettes, bols) par le système de distribution. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Médédodé Florentine s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Médédodé Florentine désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Médédodé Florentine sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe WANGNINAN, un cinquième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les crédits antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The WANGNINAN group comprises three people who are friends, and who belong to the same cooperative group. The group representative, whose name is Médédodé Florentine, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the fifth time the group is seeking the financial assistance of ALIDé in order to grow their business.
Médédodé Florentine is 39 years old and is married to a man named Clément. They have four children, some of whom attend school; three of them are still living at home. Médédodé Florentine did not have much schooling. For about ten years now, Médédodé Florentine had sold fabrics and kitchen utensils (plates, bowls) via a system of distribution. This allows her to meet the family's needs without too much difficulty.
Médédodé Florentine purchases her stock in a town in Bénin. With the goal of better meeting the needs of her customers, Médédodé Florentine is seeking to increase her level of goods in stock, and to grow her business. In order to do this, Médédodé Florentine is requesting - together with the other members of the WANGNINAN group, a fifth loan with ALIDé. The previous loans have all been repaid.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Roel

texts.en:
Roel is married with 3 children and he is 27 years old, residing at Canibungan Daku, Clarin, Philippines.

Roel has cultivated coconuts for 5 years and earns an income of PHP10,000 monthly.

He requested a loan of PHP11,700 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  In 2011, Roel joined GDMPC.  In the future, Roel wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase additional farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Achela Group

texts.fr: Le groupe ACHELA est composé de trois personnes qui s’approvisionnent au même lieu et sont des amies résidant dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Soubédatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Soubédatou est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Soubédatou a arrêté l’école au niveau secondaire. Soubédatou est une veuve et mère de cinq enfants. Soubédatou vit ensemble avec ses enfants. Pour assurer ses divers besoins, Soubédatou vend depuis cinq ans, divers articles et des tissus à son domicile. Soubédatou  s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin et au Togo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Soubédatou sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ACHELA, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The ACHELA group is composed of three people who shop in the same place, and are friends living in the same area. The group representative, whose name is Soubédatou, has her hand raised in the photo. Soubédatou is 52 years old and lives in Bénin. Soubédatou left school at the secondary level. Soubédatou is a widow and the mother of five children. She lives together with her children. In order to cover their living expenses, Soubédatou has, for the last five years, sold various articles and fabrics from her home. Soubédatou buys her stock in a town in Bénin and also in Togo.
With the goal of increasing her customers' satisfaction and in order to grow her turnover and income, Soubédatou is seeking - together with the other members of the ACHELA group - a third loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and various items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, detergents, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Taghrid

texts.en:
Taghrid is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of one child. A year ago, she opened a lingerie store to assist her husband, a carpenter, with their household expenses.

She applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to increase the stock and variety of her products. In particular, she will use the money to buy lingerie, baby clothing and accessories. 

Diversifying her retail will help Taghrid move further towards her career goal of expanding her shop and boosting her income. The lack of capital has been her major obstacle, but with this first loan from Al Majmoua she is more optimistic about her business.

loans.use: to increase the stock and variety of her products.

loans.name: Mahoutin 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe MAHOUTIN 2 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Eugénie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Eugénie est âgée de 51 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Martin. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont deux restent à leur charge. Eugénie vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Eugénie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis vingt ans environs, Eugénie exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits (plastiques, chaussures) à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Eugénie vend du charbon de bois ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Eugénie s’approvisionne dans certaines villes du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Eugénie désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Eugénie sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe MAHOUTIN 2, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
The MAHOUTIN 2 group is made up of three people who are friends, and who belong to the same cooperative banking group. The representative of this grpup, by the name of Eugénie, has her hand raised in the photo. This is the first time this group is requesting ALIDé's financial help, with a view to growing their business. 

Eugénie is 51 years old and is married to a driver named Martin. They have four children, all in school - two of whom are still living at home. Eugénie lives with her husband and children. The couple cover the family's living expenses between them. Eugénie did not go to school.
For about twenty years now, Eugénie has sold various products (plastic goods, shoes) from her home. In parallel to this activity, she also sells charcoal; this allows her to meet the family's needs without too much difficulty. Eugénie buys her goods in various towns in Bénin.
With the goal of better meeting the needs of her customers, Eugénie is seeking to increase her level of goods in stock, and to grow her business. In order to do this, Eugénie is requesting - together with the other members of the MAHOUTIN 2 group, a first loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy plastic goods, shoes and various other items.

loans.name: Elgie

texts.en:
Elgie is 45 years old and lives in P-1 Gango, Ozamiz City. She is married with three school-age children. Elgie has a hog fattening business and earns approximately PHP 6,000 each month doing this type of business. 

She has a requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase piglets. She has been a member of PMPC for 6 mos. In the future, Elgie hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase piglets.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
Iman is a 36-year-old single woman who runs her family’s hairdressing salon. She started working in this field at the age of 14 as her parents were not able to support her education. Over the years, she succeeded in expanding her business scope; currently, Iman sells accessories and dresses at her shop besides offering hairdressing services. Women in her area are very content with her work and have become regular visitors.  

Iman applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, in order to purchase additional accessories and add wedding gowns to her range of offerings. This is Iman’s 11th cycle with Al Majmoua and she is very satisfied with the borrowing experience. In the future, she wants to focus more on retailing dresses which are in high demand and generate greater revenues.

loans.use: to purchase additional accessories and add wedding gowns to her range of offerings

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is married and a mother of 5 dependents. She is 46 years old and lives in Calabayan, Osamiz City. Adelaida owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the business as a way of generating extra income of about 8,000 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 8 years. 

Adelaida requested a loan of 9,400 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. She has been a good member of GDMPC for 4 years. In the future, Adelaida wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, soap, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Carmelito

texts.en:
Carmelito is married with 3 children. He is 66 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Carmelito is a farmer and grows coconut crops to earn a living. He has been doing this for 29 years.

He has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional coconut shells and charcoal to sell. He has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, Carmelito hopes to send his children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional coconut shells and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Dieu Est Grand 9 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DIEU EST GRAND 9 est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui habitent le même quartier. C'est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Annick Dohoué est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Annick Dohoué est âgée de 46 ans et a arrêté l'école au niveau secondaire. Annick Dohoué est mariée à un certain Pierre. Le couple a cinq enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Annick Dohoué vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d’assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Annick Dohoué vend depuis dix ans, divers articles (huile de palme, huile végétale, etc.) et des condiments à son domicile. Annick Dohoué s’approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Annick Dohoué sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DIEU EST GRAND 9, un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur permettra surement à hausser le niveau de leur activité et à se faire plus de profit
texts.en:
The DIEU EST GRAND 9 group is composed of three people who are friends and who live in the same area. This is the first time the group is seeking ALIDé's financial help in order to grow their business. The group representative, by the name of Annick Dohoué, has her hand raised in the photo. Annick Dohoué is 46 years old and left school at the secondary level. She is married to a man named Pierre. They have five children, some of whom attend school - they all live at home, in a family together. 
In order to cover the family's various living expenses, Annick Dohoué has for the last ten years sold various articles (palm oil, vegetable oil etc) and condiments from her home. Annick Dohoué buys her goods in an area of Bénin. With the goal of meeting the needs of her customers and increasing her turnover, Annick Dohoué is requesting - together with the other members of the DIEU EST GRAND 9 group - a first loan with ALIDé. This loan will certainly allow them to grow their business and to make a larger profit.

loans.use: to buy cans of palm oil, vegetable oil and various items.

loans.name: Eliezar

texts.en:
Eliezar has been a client of UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. for over five cycles. The customer started as a group client and later graduated to borrowing as an individual. He deals in assorted consumer goods and has operated the business for 5 years now. He started the business due to the increased demand for consumer goods in the area. People from his area used to travel for long distances to access these goods so he decided to bring services nearer to them. 

He started with a small capital of 300,000 UGX and has since grown to serve most of the needs of his customers. Eliezar attributes his success to the small, accessible and convenient loans from UGAFODE Microfinance Ltd. He has been able to care for his family's needs, construct a modest home and pay school fees for his children. (The photo shows Eliezar and his wife in their retail shop. She signed the waiver form for publishing.)

loans.use: to restock more consumer goods to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 39 years old and lives in Labo, Ozamiz City. She is single. She has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 8,000 each month doing this type of business. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase materials for a house extension. Nora has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, she hopes to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a house extension.

loans.name: Riza

texts.en: Riza is married with 11 children. She is 39 years old and lives in Panta-on, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Riza owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 10 years and earns PHP 4,000 each month. She requested a loan of PHP 5,100 to purchase farm chemicals. Riza has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for 3 years. In the future, Riza's plan is to save her returns in order to buy a house and lot.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Maria Hilaria

texts.es: Doña María tiene 71 años de edad, tiene dos hijos, vive solo con una hija en la comunidad de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Ella tiene su propio negocio, hace dos años estableció una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios de consumo diario, vende maíz, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, sal manteca, huevos, pan, carne, churros y otros. Anteriormente solo vendía granos básicos, ahora vende varios productos. Ha mantenido surtido el negocio mediante varios préstamos otorgados. El préstamo actual de 20,000.00 Lempiras es el quinto y lo va invertir en surtir mas el negocio comprara productos alimenticios de consumo diario. Ella espera que su negocio crezca mas para mejorar su calidad de vida  y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Doña María is 71 years old and has two children. She lives with one of her daughters in the community of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.

María has her own grocery business that she established two years ago. She sells everyday food products such as corn, beans, sugar, rice, salt, lard, eggs, bread, meat, donuts, and other items. María previously sold only basic grains, but now she sells different products. She has been able to keep her business stocked with the various loans she has received.

This current loan of 20,000 HNL is her fifth one. She will invest in more inventory for her business by purchasing everyday food products. María hopes that her business will grow more so that she can improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy everyday food products for her store.

loans.name: Mahudekon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe « MAHUDEKON » est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontines. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Célestine est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Célestine est âgée de 34 ans et vit au Bénin. Célestine est mariée à un menuisier du nom de Charles. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés, et à leur charge. Célestine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Célestine supporte ensemble avec son mari les diverses charges familiales. Pour y parvenir, Célestine vend des bijoux de façon ambulante. En plus de cette activité, Célestine vend des fournitures scolaires et du pâté (fait à base de farine de blé). Célestine mène cette activité depuis neuf ans. Célestine achète ses produits dans une ville du Bénin. Célestine désire satisfaire un plus grand nombre de clients par ses produits, mais Célestine ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pouvant lui permettre de rehausser le niveau de son activité. C’est pour ce faire que Célestine sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe « MAHUDEKON ». Les deux crédits reçus précédemment ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en: The "MAHUDEKON" group consists of three people who are friends and who all belong to the same tontine annuity scheme. Célestine is the leader of the group and is the one raising her hand on the photo. Célestine is 34 years old and lives in Benin. Célestine is married to a carpenter named Charles. The couple has three children, who are all in their care and who all attend school. Célestine lives with her children and husband. Together with her husband Célestine takes care of all the various family expenses. To achieve this, Célestine works as a street trader selling jewelry. In addition to this activity, Célestine also sells school supplies and pasta (made ​​from wheat flour). Célestine has been running this business for nine years. Célestine buys her goods in a city of Benin. Célestine would like to satisfy a greater number of customers with her products, but Célestine does not have sufficient financial resources to raise the level of her activity. This is why Célestine is requesting a third loan from the microfinance institution ALIDé, together with other members of the "MAHUDEKON" group. The two previous loans have been repaid.

loans.use: to buy jewelry, school supplies and wheat flour

loans.name: Achirobo 4 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe « ACHIROBO 4» est composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier et appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Élisabeth est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Élisabeth est âgée de 40 ans et vit au Bénin. Élisabeth n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Élisabeth est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de François. Le couple a deux enfants tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Élisabeth vit avec ses enfants. Les charges de la maison sont supportées à la fois par Élisabeth et son mari. Afin de subvenir aux besoins du couple, Élisabeth achète des tissus et des vêtements dans une ville du Bénin, et les revend de façon ambulante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Élisabeth sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe « ACHIROBO 4 » un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé
texts.en:
The ACHIROBO 4 group is made up of three people who live in the same area, and who belong to the same cooperative banking group. The representative of this group, by the name of Élisabeth, has her hand raised in the photo. 
Élisabeth is 40 years old and lives in Bénin. She did not go to school. She is married to a driver named François. They have two children, both in school and living at home. Élisabeth lives with her children. The household expenses are shared between Élisabeth and her husband.
In order to meet the couple's needs, Élisabeth buys fabrics and clothing in a town in Bénin, and resells them on a mobile basis. With the goal of meeting the needs of her customers and in order to grow her turnover, Élisabeth is seeking - together with the other members of the ACHIROBO 4 group, a first loan with ALIDé.

loans.use: to buy clothing and fabrics.

loans.name: Enagnon 4 Group

texts.fr: ENAGNON 4 est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres résident dans le même village et sont des amies. La représentante du groupe, Fifamè Marguerite (dont la main est levée sur la photo), est âgée de 43 ans. Fifamè Marguerite est mariée à un maçon du nom de Jérôme. Le couple a six enfants tous scolarisés, mais il y a deux des enfants qui ne vivent plus à leur charge. Fifamè Marguerite vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Fifamè Marguerite n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Pour faire face à ses différentes charges, Fifamè Marguerite vend des boules de pâte de maïs à son domicile. Fifamè Marguerite s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et en vue d’élargir son activité, Fifamè Marguerite sollicite un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe ENAGNON 4. Ce crédit leur servira à mieux répondre aux demandes de leur clientèle et à se faire plus de profits.
texts.en: The ENAGNON 4 group has three members who are all friends that live in the same village. The leader of the group, Fifamè Marguerite (whose hand is raised in the photo), is 43 years old. Fifamè Marguerite is married to a builder named Jérôme. The couple has six children who all attend school, however two of the children are no longer in their care. Fifamè Marguerite lives with her ​​husband and children. Together, the couple take care of all the various household expenses. Fifamè Marguerite never attended school. In order to cover the various expenses, Fifamè Marguerite sells balls of corn dough from her home. Fifamè Marguerite buys her supplies in a market in Benin. In order to better satisfy her customers and expand her business, Fifamè Marguerite is requesting her first loan from the microfinance institution ALIDé, together with the other members of the ENAGNON 4 group. This loan will help her better meet the demands of her clientèle and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy bags of corn

loans.name: Hamida

texts.en:
Hamida is a 26-year-old single woman, and she has been running a handicrafts and decorations business in her town for a year now. Despite her rough start, Hamida managed to build a good reputation among her customers.

In an effort to diversify her scope of work, Hamida is applying for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, which she will invest in a new service. She intends to start up an office to assist foreigners with their Lebanese residency applications. This offering will allow Hamida to generate more income and enhance her economic status as a financially independent woman.

loans.use: to invest in a new service.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 30-year-old man from Baqa'a, Jordan, who supports one other family member. He is requesting a loan of 125 JOD to buy mobile phone refill cards and mobile devices. He will be expanding his current business to increase his income and support his family. In the future he hopes to be able to have enough money to pay for wedding expenses. Since Mohammad is 30 years old, his loan is considered a youth loan.

loans.use: to pay for mobile phone refill cards and devices.

loans.name: Jesuwame 5 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe JESUWAME 5 est formé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Cécile, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la première fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Cécile est âgée de 42 ans et est mariée à un chauffeur du nom de Ababè. Le couple a quatre enfants, dont certains scolarisés, et un reste à leur charge. Cécile vit ensemble avec son mari et son enfant à charge. Le couple assure ensemble les différentes charges. Cécile n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Depuis dix huit ans environs, Cécile exerce comme activité, la vente de divers produits à son domicile. Parallèlement à cette activité, Cécile vend des boules de pâte de maïs. Ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille. Cécile s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Cécile désire renforcer ses stocks de produits et rehausser le niveau de son activité. Pour ce faire, Cécile sollicite, ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe JESUWAME 5, un premier crédit auprès de  ALIDé.
texts.en: The JESUWAME 5 group consists of three people who are all friends and who all belong to the same tontine savings group. The leader of the group is called Cècile and is the one raising her hand in the photo. This is the first time that the group is requesting financial support from ALIDé in order to raise the level of their business activities. Cécile is 42 years old and is married to a driver named Ababè. The couple has four children, some of whom are in school, and one of whom remains in their care. Cécile lives with her ​​husband and child. The couple take care of all the various expenses. Cécile did not go to school. For around eighteen years, Cécile has been running a business selling various products from her home. Besides this activity, Cécile also sells balls of corn dough. Thanks to these activities, she is able to support her family without too much difficulty. Cécile buys her supplies from a city in Benin. In order to better meet the needs of her customers, Cécile wants to increase her stock and raise the level of her business activity. To do this, Cécile is seeking her first loan from the microfinance institution ALIDé, together with other members of the JESUWAME 5 group.

loans.use: to buy corn and various other items.

loans.name: Marcial

texts.es:
Marcial tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y vive junto a su esposa y a sus cuatro hijos en el sector Muy Finca del distrito de Mochumí, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace mas de doce años a la confección de vestidos y blusas, confeccionando estas prendas para vendérselas a un comerciante mayorista que le hace pedidos por temporadas. Adicionalmente se dedica a actividades relacionadas con la agricultura, por un lado cría y vende animales como vacas, ovejas, aves de corral y cerdos en su domicilio, y por el otro cuenta un campo de cultivo en donde ha instalado maíz. Todas estas actividades las realiza con mucha responsabilidad y esfuerzo ya que de ellas depende el sustento de su familia. Su esposa le ayuda eventualmente. 

Marcial desea adquirir abonos para su cultivo y también adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 3000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

El ya ha tenido un préstamo financiado con el Fondo Kiva. Con el dinero de aquel préstamo pudo invertir en su negocio de sastrería el cual, gracias a la ayuda recibida va bastante bien. Marcial agradece a las personas que le ayudaron en aquella oportunidad y agradece de antemano a las personas que le apoyarán en esta oportunidad.
texts.en:
Marcial is 38 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and four children in the Muy Finca sector of the district of Mochumí, an agricultural area located in the Lambayeque province, an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For more than twelve years he has made dresses and blouses to sell to a wholesale merchant who makes orders from him seasonally. Additionally, he does farming activities. He raises and sells animals such as cows, sheep, poultry and pigs at his home. He also has a corn crop. He does all of these activities with responsibility and dedication, since his family depends on this support. His wife helps him sometimes.

Marcial wants to acquire fertilizer for his crop and also balanced feed for his animals. To do that he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of  3000 nuevos soles to help him meet his goals.

He has had a loan from the Kiva Fund before. With the money from that loan, he was able to invest in his sewing business and thanks to that help it is going well for him. Marcial is grateful to the people who helped him at that time and he thanks the people who will support him at this time in advance.

loans.use: to acquire fertilizers for his crops and also balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Jose Sebastian

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal QORI ORCCO;el socio es casado y tiene 04 hijos,el socio alterna sus actividades diarias manejando y alquilando su camioneta para los distintos proyectos que solicitan su servicio,el socio lleva buen tiempo en este su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada dia,a la vez el socio apoya a su esposa en su negocio de venta de celulares,siendo de esta manera que el socio sale adelante.
El socio solicita el credito para la compra de llantas para su camioneta.
El socio se siente agradecido por el credito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas estbalecidas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the Communal Bank “Quori Orcco”. He is married and has four children. The member divides his time between his daily activities and driving and renting out his truck for different projects that are in need of his services. He enjoys managing his business and has done well thanks to the effort he puts forth each day. His wife provides support by managing her business of selling mobile phones. The member feels that working in this manner enables him to stay ahead.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy tires for his truck. The member appreciates the loan that has been provided and promises to complete his payments according to the established terms.

loans.use: to buy tires for his truck.

loans.name: Brayan Andres

texts.es: Brayan de 30 años, fabrica calzado para damas y los  vende a una clientela, que poco a poco ha logrado construir. Últimamente como su negocio crece, el comprar materias primas en mayor cantidad, se ha convertido en un gran desafío, porque quiere ganar descuentos con las compras en volumen. Por eso se esmera trabajando para poder recuperar su inversión, obtener utilidades y  responder a su clientela oportunamente y sostenerse en el mercado con buenos precios. Brayan  se encuentra muy satisfecho, pues desde que creó su propia aventura de negocios, para generar ingresos que le permitieran sostener a su familia, ha logrado salir adelante; en un comienzo ofrecía solo el servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de calzado, en la actualidad sus diseños han impactado en su mercado, pues siempre está  atento a la moda y a la comodidad de sus compradoras. Brayan se a acercado ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante le cual comprará materiales como cuero, derivados del cuero, accesorios e insumos requeridos para fabricar nuevas modas de calzados para damas que sobre pedidos. Su meta mas adelante es mejorar la estructura de su taller e independizarlo de la vivienda. Él se propone trabajar fuertemente para lograr sacarle el mayor provecho a su credikiva, pues en la actualidad maneja una rentabilidad sobre las ventas de un 30% , muy apropiada para este tipo de negocios, pero quiere aumentarla con un mayor esfuerzo comercial.
texts.en: Brayan is 30 years old. He makes women's shoes and sells them to customers that he has been able to gain little by little. Lately, as his business has grown, he buys raw materials in greater quantities. This has become a big challenge, because he wants to gain bigger discounts by buying in bigger volumes. That is why he is working to recover his investment, make profit and respond quickly to his customers, staying in the market with good prices. Brayan is very satisfied, because since he started his own business venture to generate income to support his family, he has been able to get ahead. At first he started by only offering shoe repair and maintenance service, but he is always aware of fashion and of his buyers' comfort. Brayan has approached the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to access a Kiva loan, the first loan he has had with this organization. With it, he will buy materials such as leather, leather products, accesories and materials required to make new styles of shoes for women to order. His goal for the future is to improve the structure of his workshop and make it independent from his house. He intends to work hard to take full advantage of his Kiva loan. At present he has a profut margin of 30%, which is very appropriate for this type of business. He wants to increase it with more commercial effort.  .

loans.use: to buy materials such as leather, leather products, accesories and materials required to make new styles.

loans.name: Pioneras - 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PIONERAS - 26e está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Maria, ella tiene 26 años y dos hijos de las edades de 5 y 2 años,  La Sra. María  se dedica a la venta de regalos en los distintos salones de fiestas de la ciudad de El Alto  este préstamo es su segunda  secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. María  va a usar este préstamo para compra de regalos y papel de regalo por mayor para la venta de regalos y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Maria va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando regalos  y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de regalos, La Sra. María es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The 'PIONERAS - 26e' community bank has eight members: seven women and one man.  The bank's president, Maria, is 26 years old and has two children who are 5 and 2 years old.  Her business is selling gifts in different function rooms around the city of El Alto.  This loan is her second with the institution.  Maria will use her loan to buy gifts and gift wrap wholesale for her business and thereby increase her working capital.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  Maria will use her profits to continue buying gifts and thereby continue improving her income.  Her wish for her business is to have a store where she can sell a range of gifts.  Maria is a very hard-working person who feels happy with the opportunity that she is being given.  Her fellow group members feel the same way as some of them are supporting their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy gift wrap and gifts to sell

loans.name: 32-Villa Paraiso Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento 32-VILLA PARAISO está  compuesto por nueve integrantes siete mujeres y dos varones,  la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Giovanna, ella tiene 22 años ella es soltera, La Sra. Giovanna  se dedica a la venta de cereales  en una de las avenidas mas concurridas de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su sexta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Giovanna  va a usar este préstamo para compra de cereales por mayor  y así de esta manera incrementar su capital de trabajo,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la Sra. Giovanna va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercaderia  y así mejorando sus ingresos, su deseo para su negocio es tener una tienda donde pueda ofrecer variedad de cereales, La Sra. Giovanna es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad brindada a ella ya sus compañeras de grupo ya que en algunos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en: The '32-VILLA PARAISO' community bank has nine members: seven women and two men.  The bank's president, Giovanna, is 22 years old and single.  Her business is selling cereals on one of the busiest avenues in the city of Cochabamba.  This loan is her sixth with the institution.  Giovanna will use her loan to buy cereals wholesale and thereby increase her working capital.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to continue improving her business.  She will use the profits to continue buying merchandise and thereby improve her income.  Her wish for her business is to have a store where she can sell a variety of cereals.  Giovanna is a very hard-working person.  She feels happy with the opportunity that she and her fellow group members are being given as some of them are supporting their families on their own.

loans.use: to buy cereals wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making hollow blocks

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es: Nicolas, casado, de 52 años de edad, tiene por actividad economica la venta de productos lacteos como: leche, crema, queso,cuajada, lecheagra, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en la terminal de leon, el financiamiento lo quiere para comprar mas productos para sastifacer a su clientela,
texts.en: Nicolas is 52 years old and married.  His business is selling dairy products such as milk, cream, cheese, curds and 'leche agria' (a fermented milk product).  His business is located in Leon bus station.  He would like this loan to buy more products so that he can satisfy his customers.

loans.use: to buy dairy products to satisfy his customers

loans.name: Irenn

texts.en:
Irenn is 37 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Irenn is married with 4 children.

Irenn has a store that sells a variety of products. Irenn has had this business for 5 years. Irenn requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Irenn has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Irenn hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 33-year-old married woman and mother of four children. She has been working in cultivation for three years now, planting and selling a variety of vegetables, mainly tomatoes, cucumbers and zucchini. Though Mariam suffered in the beginning due to lack of experience, she succeeded in learning the business and creating a position for herself in the market.

To improve and expand her production, Mariam is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua. She will invest the money in buying a nylon cover for her agricultural tent, a modest version of the greenhouse model. Accordingly, she will be able to plant vegetables all year long, thus generating stable revenues.

loans.use: to invest in buying a nylon cover for her agricultural tent

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is 62 years old and lives in Cabol-anonan, Tudela. Fely is widowed and has three children.
 
Fely has a store that sells a variety of products. Fely has had this business for five years.

Fely requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

Fely has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Fely hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is married with 2 children. Lilibeth is 39 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Lilibeth sells longganisa, chorizo and hotdogs to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional longganisa, chorizo and hotdogs for sale.

Lilibeth has been a member of PMPC for almost 6 years. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to engage in other type of business.

loans.use: to be used in purchasing additional longganisa, chorizo and hotdogs

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles has been a client at Ugafode MFI Ltd for 3 loan cycles now. He deals in the goat trade as a source of income and has been engaged in that business for the last 6 years. He normally sells the goats in the daily and weekly markets around Ibanda.

Charles obtained his first loan and bought 10 goats. He paid back the loan well, processed another loan and purchased 30 goats. He paid back the second loan and now has capital of over 50 goats.

Through the income and profit generated from the loans, he has been able to construct a permanent house and take his children to good schools.

loans.use: to purchase more goats for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a married woman who has three children. Amelita is 44 years old and resides at Cabunga-an, Ozamis City, Philippines. 

Amelita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living, and she's been 20 years in this business. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this. 

She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. 

In 2011, Amelita joined GDMPC. In the future, Amelita wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 31-year-old married woman and mother of three children. 

For three years now, she has been selling used clothes at her shop. Customers from her town and the nearby villages seek her store for the variety and quality it offers.

Najah is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to purchase more dresses and outfits. With this expansion, she will be able to make more money and contribute further to her household expenses, providing a better living standard for her children. Najah is very confident of her capacity and is positive about her business future.

loans.use: to purchase more dresses and outfits.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Evaline is 28 years old, married, and blessed with two children, age 10 and 8 years old. She sells charcoal, a business she ventured into two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 5,000. 

She has requested a first loan of KES 5,000 to purchase two sacks of charcoal for sale. The profit she earns from this business will help her repay her loan as well as expand her business. 

Her dream is to see herself managing multiple businesses of her own.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Teresito

texts.en:
Teresito is 49 years old and lives in Gango, Ozamiz City. He is married and has one child.
 
Teresito grows rice and corn, and he earns approximately PHP 25,000 each month doing this. 

He has a requested a loan of PHP 35,000 to purchase fertilizer for his corn.
 
Teresito has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, Teresito hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for his corn.

loans.name: Nasser

texts.en:
Nasser is a 20-year-old single man with five years of experience in agriculture. He plants and sells various fruits and vegetables, namely, grapes, strawberries, watermelons, eggplants, olives and bell peppers. Many people, whether neighbors or tourists, like Nasser’s tasty and natural crops.

Nasser is applying for a youth loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, with which he will buy a water pump to ensure continuous irrigation for some of his plantations. 

Once he can guarantee the constant availability of water in his land, Nasser can then expand the range of his produce and enlarge his business and revenues.

loans.use: to buy a water pump to ensure continuous irrigation for some of his plantations.

loans.name: Qwmry

texts.en:
Qwmry is a 36-year-old married woman from Iraq. She is a mother of four children. With limited career options due to cultural restrictions and domestic constraints, Qwmry is one of the many Iraqi woman who is working from home, using her sewing skills to generate some income and participate in meeting the financial needs of her family. 

Qwmry has six years experience in sewing and tailoring and she would like to improve her business by replacing the old sewing machine and over (finishing) machine she has been using and buying an iron. To be able to make these purchases she took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $1000.

loans.use: to replace her old sewing machine and over machine

loans.name: Daniel Antonio

texts.es:
Daniel tiene 23 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Desde hace seis años se dedica a la crianza de ganado de repasto. También a comprar y a vender leche junto con su papá. Él se levanta a las 4:30 a.m. de la mañana a recoger la leche en la casa de los vecinos de la comunidad. Luego se desplaza a la ciudad en su vehiculo durante veinte minutos a vender la leche a un comprador mayorista. Posteriormente se va a pastar sus novillos de engorde al terreno. 

Los novillos para engordarlos en repasto los compra en el tiangue. Para llegar ahí viaja durante cuarenta y cinco minutos en un camión, junto con todas las personas que van a comprar y a vender ganado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar tres novillos. Con el objetivo de asegurar su proyecto obteniendo un margen de ganancia cuando los venda. Daniel vive en una casa que esta alquilando, debido a eso su sueño es construir su propia casa, para ofrecer a su familia un techo seguro.
texts.en:
Daniel is 23 years old, married and has one child.  He has been raising cattle for six years.  He also buys and sells milk together with his dad.  Daniel gets up at 4.30am to collect milk from the neighbors in his community.  He then makes a 20 minute trip to the city in his vehicle to sell the milk to a wholesaler.  After this he goes out to pasture his young bulls.

Daniel buys the young bulls that he fattens in the cattle market.  It takes him 45 minutes to travel there in a truck together with all the other people who are going to buy and sell cattle.

Daniel is requesting this loan from Fundación Campo to buy three young bulls.  His aim is to make a profit when he sells them.  Daniel lives in a rental house and his dream is to build his own home so that he can offer his family a secure roof over their heads.

loans.use: to buy three young bulls

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a 41-year-old married woman. She is living in Nailon, Tudela, Philippines, where her wide array of rice production is located. She has been cultivating this land since she was 33 years of age until the present time. She doesn't mind the scratches and itches brought by this kind of plant, for as long as she can earn income, Jocelyn goes for it. 

She normally receives 6,814 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month. In 2011, Jocelyn joined GDMPC. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure to increase production. When the crop gets harvested, the revenue from it will be allotted to expanding the business area to earn more income and to sustain her daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 53 and is separated. She lives in the Philippines. 

Jane used her last loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. This increased her income from the farm and made it successful.

Now she's taking a new loan for her general store, to purchase new items such as candies, Milo, shampoo, soaps, etc. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase new items such as candies, milo, shampoo, soaps, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of firewood, soft brooms and bananas

loans.name: Safiya

texts.en:
Safiya is a 46-year-old single independent woman with more than 15 years of experience in sewing and stitching. Working from home, she provides tailoring and repairing services for clothes and curtains.

Safiya is quite happy with her business and its support for her life. People in her village like her designing, patching and fine-finishing skills. She is confident of her products and trusts her continuity in this field. 

Safiya is applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Al Majmoua, to buy some tools and fabrics necessary for her business. As she generates more income, she wants to assist her sister in covering some of her living expenses.

loans.use: to buy some tools and fabrics necessary for her business.

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is married, 39 years of age, and lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, together with her two children. 

Ian is operating a sari-sari (general) store to earn a living. She has been in this business for more than three years and she earns 6,000 PHP every month.
