She is requesting a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. 

She joined GDMPC in 2008. In the future, Ian will use her income to support her two children in their studies until they finish college and also in their daily needs. Ian hopes to see her business progress.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary goods for her general store.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
Girlie, aged 29, is married with three children and lives in the Philippines. She is a farmer and cultivates coconuts for a living. She has been doing this for five years and every month she earns 3,000 PHP from this work. 

Girlie has requested a loan of 3,600 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She is a new member of GDMPC. In the future, Girlie hopes to support her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town and he used his previous loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm. The loan was profitable and he was able to pay it all back.

He now operates a retail shop and a timber yard business and he plans to use this loan amount to buy more stock of goods to sell. These include rice, sugar and boxes of bar soap. With the anticipated profits, he plans to add more timber for sale in his timber yard.

In the future, Daniel hopes to grow his retail shop business, make more income and hence be able to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To buy more stock such as rice, sugar and soap.

loans.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario, aged 41, is a married entrepreneur with five children who lives in Tinacla-an, Clarin.  He earns his income from banana production. Mario started this business almost five years ago and earns 6,000  PHP a month. 

To improve his business, Mario is borrowing 8,000 PHP from GDMPC micro-credit which he recently joined. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Before long, he’s hopeful of the possibility of expanding his business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is taking out another Kiva loan to boost his motorcycle taxi business. With the previous loan, he purchased a motorcycle for his transport business. 

Juma is asking for another loan to buy another motorcycle for use as a taxi. He is happy with the opportunity that he is receiving.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle for his transport business.

loans.name: Francisco Ramon

texts.es: Don Francisco de 56 años de edad, es originario de Managua, actualmente vive en  Estelí, es comerciante se dedica a la elaboración de fajas y billeteras para caballeros desde hace 30 años, padre de 3 hijos  de los cuales dos están a su cargo. Francisco inicio su negocio con dinero propio a la edad de 27 años porque quería ser alguien independiente, siendo este su primer negocio el cual saca adelante por si solo pues no tiene apoyo de nadie, Francisco dice que se siente bien en su  negocio pues cuenta con clientes fijos además que es un negocio muy rentable, genera ingresos diarios. Solicita el crédito para comprar cuero, hebillas, pegamento y broches, toda la materia prima necesaria para realizar su trabajo, el estima este préstamo será de ayuda pues podrá aumentar su producción y entregar su trabajo en tiempo y forma, ademas podra surtir su negocio con nuevos productos que genere la  atracción de más clientes, sus planes futuros es establecer su pequeña empresa de industrias, sus metas próximas es independizarse  económicamente para darle una mejor educación a sus hijos y lograr tener  su casa propia con el objetivo de poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Francisco is 56 years old and originally from Managua.  He currently lives in Estelí.  Francisco has been making men's belts and wallets for 30 years.  He is the father of three children, two of whom are still in his care.  Francisco started his business with his own money at the age of 27 because he wanted to work for himself.  This was the first business he ran on his own without support from anybody.  He says that he feels happy in his business because he has regular customers and it is a profitable business which makes daily income.  He is requesting this loan to buy leather, buckles, adhesive and clasps.  These are the raw materials he needs to carry out his work.  He believes that this loan will be helpful as he will be able to increase his production and deliver his work done well and on time.  He will also be able to stock his business with new products which will attract more customers.  Francisco's future plans are to stabilize his small business.  His immediate aim is to become financially independent so that he can provide his children with a better education and own his own home so that he can get ahead in life together with his family.

loans.use: to buy leather, buckles, adhesive and clasps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married with nine children. She is 50 years old and lives in Gata Daku, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Merlyn owns and operates a plot of farmland, planting bananas to earn a living. She has been in this business for 30 years and earns 4,000 PHP each month. 

Merlyn has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase farm chemicals. She has been a member of Kiva's partner, GDMPC, for a year. In the future, Merlyn's plan is to save her profits in order to buy a car.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is divorced with one child. She is 59 years old and lives in Camanse, Sinacaban. Benedicta is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years.

Benedicta has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, Benedicta hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is from Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 34 years old, is married and has two children. To make a living, Alexander has owned and operated a transportation service business for the past eight years and earns 8,000 PHP a month from this activity. 

In 2004, Alexander joined GDMPC. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the expansion to further improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Marisol

texts.en:
Marisol, aged 40, is a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Domingo, a driver, and is the mother of their children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marisol operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. Aside from the store, she also sells fish for additional income. Marisol earns her income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her to continue operating her business, Marisol is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marisol hopes to be able to expand her business soon, just as she hopes to support her children's schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is 49 years of age, married, and has one child to care for. As her way of getting a monthly income, she offers computer services, such as encoding and printing. She usually earns 3,000 pesos this way and has been doing this work for two years. She requested a loan of 4,000 pesos to purchase printing materials, such as bond papers, inks, etc. In 2010, she joined GDMPC. She's hoping for her business to progress.

loans.use: to purchase printing materials, such as bond papers, inks, etc.

loans.name: Tambopata De Tipon Group

texts.es:
(La señora Ana Elena está levantando la mano en la fotografía). La socia Ana Elena vive en la ciudad del Cusco y su actividad económica principal de la socia Ana Elena es la venta de comestibles y tiene una pequeña tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad Ana Elena requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, tarros de leche y otras cosas más.  

Este grupo está conformado por vecinos y amigos que formaron el banco comunal “Tambopata de Tipon” en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco. Este banco comunal está conformado por personas que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos. La mayoría de las actividades económicas de los socios son por ejemplo crianza de animales menores, ganadería, agricultura, venta de verduras, venta de comida, preparación de comida tipica como por ejemplo cuy al horno y otros. 

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos. 

Cusco está ubicado en el distrito y provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco en pleno corazón de la antigua ciudad de los Incas y se caracteriza por ser una zona turística, por sus centros arqueológicos, por su centro histórico, por sus paisajes, por su historia y por ser una ciudad encantadora de la Región del Sur del país. Cusco es conocido también por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
(Ana Elena is raising her hand in the photo.)  Ana Elena lives in the city of Cusco and she sells food from her small grocery store in her home.  She has had this business for many years and it is going well.  Ana Elena is seeking a loan so that she can buy merchandise such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, bottles of milk, and other items.

This group is comprised of neighbors and friends and it is called “Tambopata de Tipon."  It is located in the province of Cusco, in the city of Cusco.  This group is comprised of people that are always searching for opportunities to get ahead.  Every day they strive to make a better future for their children.  They do various jobs such as raising animals, running granaries, working in agriculture, selling vegetables, selling food, and preparing typical dishes (such as grilled guinea pig), and more.

The group members are thankful for the opportunities given to them and promise to comply with the payment terms as their contracts state.

Cusco is located in the district and province of Cusco in the heart of the ancient city of the Incas.  It is characterized as a tourist zone because of its archeological center, its historic center, its people, and because of its history.  It's an enchanting city in the southern region of the country.  Cusco is also known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and Machu Picchu is known as one of the Seven Wonders of the World.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as bags of rice, bags of sugar, bottles of milk, and other items.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is married with three kids. She is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. Grace is a farmer, and she operates a coconut plantation to earn a living. She has been doing this for 14 years, and every month she earns 4,500 pesos from this work. She has requested a loan of 5,200 pesos to purchase farm chemicals. Grace has been a member of GDMPC since 2011. In the future, Grace hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase farm chemicals

loans.name: Santos German

texts.es:
Don Santos tiene 38 años de edad, es soltero. Él ya tiene 15 años de prestar sus servicios de seguridad en una gasolinera. Los servicios de seguridad los presta en horarios de 24 horas en turnos intercalados en la gasolinera y un restaurante.  

Él solicita un préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar: 1000 tejas, 30 cuartones de madera, 12 polines de hierro, 3 bolsas de cemento, entre otros. El financiamiento será invertido en el mejoramiento de su vivienda, específicamente en el cambio del techo, debido a que en esta época de invierno se moja mucho las paredes y se están dañando. Él desea continuar mejorando su vivienda, repellar las paredes, cambiar el piso y construir una habitación más.
texts.en:
Don Santos is 38 years old and he is single.  For 15 years he has been working as a security guard at a gas station.  He works in 24-hours shifts that are interspersed between the gas station and the adjoining restaurant.

He is seeking a loan from Fundación Campo so that he can buy 1000 tiles, 30 cuts of wood, 12 iron poles, 3 bags of cement, and other supplies.  The loan money will be invested in his home, specifically in replacing the roof which should have been done before as now it is winter and the walls are getting wet and causing him to suffer.  He hopes to continue improving his home by plastering his walls, changing the floor, and building an additional room.

loans.use: to buy 1000 tiles, 30 cuts of wood, 12 iron poles, 3 bags of cement, and other supplies.

loans.name: Verania Isabel

texts.es: Verania de 23 años de edad, es originaria de León,  casada, madre de 1 hijo que esta a su cargo, ella además de tener su titulo de contabilidad, también es comerciante brinda el servicio de barbería en su comunidad. Verania inicio su actividad después de haber terminado su carrera, decide independizarse, pone su propio negocio de barbería a la edad de 22 años en su casa de habitación, donde recibe el apoyo de su esposo y su mama que le ayudan a atender a los clientes, ella cuenta con otros ingresos pues también trabaja   de cajera en un súper de la comunidad, se siente bien en el negocio pues cuenta con clientes fijos además es un negocio rentable, genera ingresos diarios, su expectativa es tener su segundo negocio para obtener mas ingresos para el hogar. Solicita el crédito para remodelar su barbería que permita la atracción de más clientes, sus planes futuros es mantener su negocio activo para poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Verania is 23 years old, she is from León, she is married, and she is the mother of one child that she cares for.  She has a degree in Accounting and she owns a hair salon in her neighborhood.  She began this business after finishing her studies.  When she was only 22 years old she decided to be independent and to begin her own business.  She has the support of her husband and her mother and they help her attend to her customers.  She also earns additional income by working as a cashier in the supermarket in her neighborhood.

She is happy with her business because she has regular customers and because it is profitable.  She generates income every day and expects to open a second business in order to earn more income for her household.  She is seeking a loan so that she can remodel her salon and attract more customers.  Her future plans are to continue running this business so that she can be able to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to remodel her hair salon.

loans.name: Ndoumbé

texts.fr:
Madame Ndoumbé est couturière de profession  depuis plus de 10 ans déjà .Elle est âgée de 44 ans et vit avec ses enfants car, Ndoumbé est mariée mais son époux se trouve actuellement en Suisse. Cela ne l’empêche pas d’être active  et de gérer le foyer en attendant que le mari lui envoie de l’argent pour la dépense quotidienne. Elle loue une cantine, ou elle a installé 2 machines à coudre. Elle est présentement à son 4ème crédit   à l’IMCEC et sollicite un montant de 150000FCFA pour l’achat d’une machine à coudre piqueuse pour le renforcement de sa production. La clientèle est présente, mais à défaut d’avoir le nécessaire, elle peut aller voir ailleurs.
Comme charges, elle ne s’occupe que de la location de sa cantine ; toutes les autres charges sont prises par  son mari.
Dans l’avenir, elle aimerait diversifier son activité et vendre des produits  cosmétiques.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndoumbé has been a seamstress for over ten years already. She is 44 years old and lives with her children. Ndoumbé is married, but her husband is currently in Switzerland. This does not stop her from being active and from managing her household while waiting for her husband to send her money for everyday expenses.
She rents a shop, in which she set up two sewing machines. She is currently on her fourth loan with IMCEC and is requesting an amount of 150,000 XOF to purchase a serger to strengthen her production. She has customers, but if she does not have the necessary equipment, customers might go elsewhere.
Her expenses are limited to the rental of her shop ; her husband takes care of all other expenses.
In the future, she would like to diversify her business and to sell beauty products.

loans.use: to buy a serger sewing machine for her business.

loans.name: Lira Jane

texts.en: Lira Jane is 27 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Dela Paz, Panaon, Misamis Occidental, where she has earned a living for the last two years by selling barbecued items. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to buy additional meat and ingredients for her barbecue business. Lira Jane has been a member of PMPC for one year and hopes to engage in other types of business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional meat and ingredients for her barbecue business.

loans.name: Jerito

texts.en: Jerito is 45 years old and the father of five children who lives in RS Tan Village, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. For the last two years, he has earned a living by providing transportation services. His main goal in life is to earn enough money to support his children and help them live well. He is requesting a loan for PHP 30,000 from GDMPC to repair his vehicle and provide his children with the best possible education. He joined GDMPC last year and is committed to improve his business.

loans.use: to repair the vehicles he uses in his business.

loans.name: Carolina Gabriela

texts.es: La joven carolina de 31 años de edad, clienta Kiva, es originaria de León, casada, madre de 1 hijo que esta a su cargo, ella de oficio comerciante se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general desde los 28 años de edad siendo este su primer negocio, Carolina dice que su primer préstamo fue de gran ayuda ya que pudo invertir en el inventario de su negocio  en la compra de mercadería como ropa y joyas de plata,  que permitió el incremento de sus ventas, generando a la vez mas ingresos, pero ella desea diversificarse aun  mas con variedad de productos especialmente los que están de moda en esta temporada es por ese motivo que requiere del crédito para comprar  mercadería en general como ropa, joyas de plata, sandalias, cosméticos, etc. Con el objetivo de invertir aun mas en su inventario para mayor atracción de clientes, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su esposo,  Ella estima que esta nueva inversión será  de  ayuda porque podrá mantener su negocio activo con productos mas solicitados por sus clientes, su planes futuros es llegar a tener su propia tienda de mercadería en general, espera seguir contando con el apoyo de Kiva para  lograr sus sueños y poder salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Young Carolina, 31 years old, a Kiva client, is a native of Leon, married, and the mother of a son whom she cares for. Carolina is a merchant who has sold merchandise in general since she was 28 years old, this being her 1st business. Carolina says her 1st loan was a great help, allowing her to invest in inventory for her business, buying merchandise such as clothing and silver jewelry, that permitted her to increase sales, generating at the same time, more income.

Now she would like to diversity even more with a variety of products, especially items that are in style this season. That's why she needs a loan, to buy general merchandise such as clothing, silver jewelry, sandals, cosmetics, etc. Her objective is to invest more in her inventory to attract more customers. Carolina's husband helps in her business.

She believes this investment will be helpful because she can maintain activity in her business with more products requested by her customers. Carolina's future plan is to acquire her own general store. She hopes she can continue counting on Kiva's help to realize her dreams and be able to get ahead with her family.

loans.use: purchase clothing, silver jewelry, sandals, cosmetics, etc., to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres La Bendicion De Patzun Group

texts.en:
In the East village of Patzun Chimaltenango, Guatemala lives Sandy, an ambitious 22-year old woman who is working tirelessly to achieve her goals. 
Sandy’s mother and father, farmers, worked hard to support her and her five siblings, but Sandy knew she had to find her own way to succeed. 

Two years ago Sandy graduated from high school. However, due to the high unemployment in the country, she has been unable to get a job where she could fully use the education she received. This does not discourage Sandy, who believes that every effort is rewarded and the hardest challenges bring the best rewards. 

As a child, Sandy learned to weave and embroider. With these skills and her drive to succeed, Sandy and her family decided to start a business selling handicrafts five years ago. Over time, they expanded their business to include the sale of different types of vegetables, and they also raise ducks. 

Sandy currently travels to the market three times a week to sell her product. She usually leaves home at 6:30 a.m. and returns at 2 p.m. As her business grew, Sandy saw how she could benefit from a loan and eventually decided to join the Friendship Bridge.

Sandy explains that as she has diversified the types of products she sells, her customer base has increased. Sandy is about to begin her second loan cycle, and she is planning to use the loan to purchase thread in order to make more embroidered fabrics. In addition, she hopes to buy more food for her ducks. 

Sandy is very excited to receive this loan because it gets her one step closer to achieving her dream of running a stable business with consistent revenues, thus giving her the opportunity to pursue her dream of going to college. 

Sandy is part of the Mujeres la Bendición de Patzun Trust Bank, with 11 other women who are also working to improve their lives and the lives of their families (among all of them, they have 31 children). During their monthly loan repayment meetings, Sandy and her fellow Trust Bank members participate in educational lessons on business, money management, self-esteem, women’s rights, health and how to support their children’s education. These lessons not only provide the women with valuable information regarding their businesses and their family’s health, but also foster a community of support among the women. Sandy smiles as she says: "We are thankful for the opportunity of microloans as it helps us to promote our small businesses and improve our quality of life."

loans.use: To purchase thread.

loans.name: Nonvignon 8 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGNON 8 est composé de trente deux personnes qui vivent dans un même quartier. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupement sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de leur activité. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Pélagie est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Pélagie est âgée de 24 ans et est mariée à un maçon du nom de Victor. Pélagie est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés et à la charge du couple. Pélagie vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Les diverses charges de la maison sont assurées par le couple. Pour y parvenir, Pélagie mène comme activité, la vente des fruits (pommes) et des ustensiles de cuisine (bols) de façon ambulante. Pélagie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Pélagie sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupement NONVIGNON 8, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le premier prêt a été bien remboursé.
texts.en:
NONVIGNON 8 Group is made up of 32 persons who live in the same neighborhood. This is the second time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Pélagie, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 24 years old and married to a mason named Victor. Pélagie is the mother of two children whom the couple has to support. Both children attend school.

Pélagie lives together with her children and her husband. The couple ensures together that the various household expenses are covered. To be able to do so, Pélagie sells fruits (apples) and kitchenware (bowls) as a traveling saleswoman.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's market. Eager to satisfy her clientele and in order to bolster her revenue and income, Pélagie, together with the other members of NONVIGNON 8 Group, is seeking a second loan from ALIDé. The first loan was repaid without problems.

loans.use: To buy a large quantity of bowls and apples

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en: Juvy is 34 years old, married and the mother of two children. She lives in Viray Molicay, Ozamis City, Philippines, where she earns a living by farming. She used her last loan to buy seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. Her business has grown and become more successful, and she is requesting a new loan to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her next crop. Her goal is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her next crop.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie is 40 years old and lives in Gata, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental with her husband. For the last five years, she has earned a living by running a grocery store where she sells many food items. She is requesting a loan for PHP 14,900 to buy additional groceries to sell. Rosie has been a member of PMPC for almost four years and hopes to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more items to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Fabian

texts.en:
Fabian is married and has two children. He is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. To earn a living, Fabian is operating a business providing transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for five years. Every month he earns 7,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 7,500 PHP to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories.

Fabian has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Fabian hopes to see his children finish their studies. He also hopes to double his income from his business.

loans.use: to purchase vehicle spare parts and accessories

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more firewood used for making charcoal

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en:
Mr. Adiya, 30, runs a taxi business around the districts of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running his business for over two years. Before, he used to work as a driver in a company and he is very skilful driver. Lately his car has been bad to use for a taxi service. Some parts are broken completely and some are old. This is serious problem for him and his customers. As a result he wants to change his car and buy a better one, which is still second hand. He hopes that after the change, the number of his customers will increase. 

So he needs 2,300,000 MNT to cover the remaining cost of purchasing a car to improve his business.

loans.use: To cover the remaining cost of purchasing a car to improve his business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw ingredients

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en:
Belinda is 46 years old and lives in Balon, Tudela. Belinda is married with four children. Belinda has a dress shop business and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. Belinda has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to purchase additional ready to wear for her clothing business. 

Belinda has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Belinda hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ready to wear for her clothing business.

loans.name: Ariunbold

texts.en:
Mr. Ariunbold, 30, works as a specialist in the power plant in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. He has been doing his job since 2006 and is one of the skilful workers. Ariunbold is a father of a young family. He lives with his wife and his son in a rented house with just one room. It is difficult and uncomfortable to live with his family in a small and bad rental room. 

In 2009 he bought a small plot of the land in a rural area which is near the city using all his family’s money. But still he could not build a house there due to the lack of money. Now he decided to take a loan to dedicate to building his family’s dream house. As he said it will be a small sized and beautiful house. Now he needs about 2,500,000 MNT to buy some necessary building materials to build his house. Let’s help this young family dear Lenders!

loans.use: To purchase building materials to build a house.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is widowed with seven children. Nena is 59 years old and lives in Lutao, Panaon, Misamis Occidental. Nena is a pensioner which is where she gets money for her living. She has been receiving this pension for 10 years. 

She has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to pay the tuition fees of her child. Nena has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, Nena hopes to engage in business.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee of her child.

loans.name: Claudia Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Claudia continuamente le ha estado realizando mejoras a su domicilio y en esta ocasión solicita un préstamo para colocar vitropiso en lo que es la sala-comedor, baño y recamara,  también para pintar por dentro y por fuera de su vivienda. La Sra. Claudia tiene 4 hijos, trabaja en la comisión de agua de esta ciudad desde hace más de 10 años y además cuenta con una pensión por viudez en estados unidos.  Con estos ingresos solventa los gastos de manutención y vivienda de sus hijos, todos en edad escolar. Desea seguir realizando las mejoras necesarias para darle a su familia una mayor comodidad.
texts.en: Claudia is continuously improving her home with renovations and on this occasion is requesting a loan to add ceramic tile to the diningroom-livingroom, bathroom and bedroom, as well, as to paint the interior and exterior of her home. Claudia has 4 children. She has worked at this city’s water commission for over 10 years and receives a widower’s pension from the US. With this income, she covers the expenses and maintenance of her children, who are all school aged. She’d like to continue making the necessary improvements to her home in order to offer her family more comfort.

loans.use: buy material to finish the insides of her home (paint and ceramic tile).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, detergents, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Jurinda

texts.en:
This is Jurinda, 37, a resident of GMA, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Jaime, a driver, and is a mother to their children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jurinda operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jurinda hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she hopes to support her children's schooling. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Petronila's Group

texts.en:
Petronila is married with seven children. She is 67 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

To earn a living, Petronila has a business buying and selling unhulled rice.  She has had this business for five years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 3,000. 

Petronila has been a member of PMPC for almost 4 years. In the future, Petronila hopes to expand her business.  Petronila is the leader of a 2-person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase additional unhulled rice for sale

loans.name: Hidaya

texts.en:
Hidaya is 40 years old and is married with three children, all of whom attend school. For ten years, Hidaya has had an itinerant clothing business where she sells all types of products, and in her house she has a convenience store that her husband tends to. She is a very hard-working and entrepreneurial person who does not fear work or challenges.

She is applying for the loan to buy all kinds of clothing, so that she will have a good variety to offer her customers. She comments that in the future she wants to expand her store until it becomes a self-service store.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes

loans.name: Maximina

texts.en:
This is Maximina, 45, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Ricardo, her business partner, and she is mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 
 
Maximina operates a food stall. She sells fresh cooked noodles and other street food staples in their community. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 19,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of raw products and supplies she use in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Maximina dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwajumaa

texts.en:
Mwanajuma lives with her husband, Hamadi, and has been a member of Yehu Microfinance since 2000. She buys and sells charcoal and fuel for a living.

She started her business with a wooden wheelbarrow, which she still owns. But over time she bought other work tools, eventually acquiring an open motorcar for her sales activity and product delivery to customers. The problem was that rainy days posed an inconvenience. She now has bought another motorcar, covered this time, so she can deliver products, come rain or shine.

She is requesting a loan to buy charcoal and fuel to fill customer orders.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and fuel.

loans.name: Lourdesita

texts.en:
Lourdesita is 65 years old and lives in Buenavista, Tudela. Lourdesita is widowed with four children. 

Lourdesita has a general store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 3 years. Lourdesita requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc. 

Lourdesita has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, Lourdesita hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergents, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 29 years old married to Evans. They are blessed with three children aged 12, eight and nine months. She sells fruits, a business she started four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 10,400. 

She has requested a first loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase more mango fruits for sale. The anticipated profit will aid her to buy additional stock for her business. Her dream is to see her business expand.

loans.use: To purchase more mangoes for sale.

loans.name: Georgine

texts.en:
Georgine is married with 4 children. She is 38 years old and lives in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Georgine sells cosmetics to earn a living and has had this business for 15 years. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional cosmetics for sale.

Georgine has just joined PMPC this year. In the future, Georgine hopes to engage in another type of business.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Lila Gualdina

texts.es:
Lila Gualdina tiene 39 años de edad, vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 11 y 13 años de edad en una colonia del Sector López Arellano, del municipio de Choloma Cortes.
La señora Lila Gualdina, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, como ser ropa, cosméticos, cremas, lociones, ropa interior, y además eventualmente vende comida y golosinas desde hace 10 años. De este negocio está obteniendo los ingresos necesarios para el hogar. Ella vende de manera ambulante y entrega a domicilio actualmente tiene muchos pedidos y por eso está solicitando un préstamo de 10,000.00 Lempiras para  comprar la mercadería, ya ha tenido varios prestamos con ODEF este es el numero 10 y espera cumplirle a sus clientes con los pedidos hechos. Su meta es en un futuro arreglar la casa, construir un cerco enfrente y ampliar el área para el negocio.
texts.en:
Lila Gualdina, age 39, lives with her husband and their two children, ages 11 and 13.  They live in a neighborhood in the Sector López Arellano in the Choloma municipality in Cortes.

For ten years Lila Gualdina has been selling general merchandise like clothes, cosmetics, creams, lotions, and underwear.  She has also been occasionally selling food and sweets.  It is from this business that she gets the income she needs for her household.  She sells in an itinerant manner, and she delivers to the customers’ homes.  

She currently has a lot of orders, and that is why she is requesting a loan for 10,000 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy the merchandise.  She has had various loans with ODEF, and this is loan number ten.  She hopes to fill the orders her customers have made.

Her goal for the future is to fix the house, to build a fence in front, and to expand the area for her business.

loans.use: to buy underwear and merchandise to sell.

loans.name: 05.01.03 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hồng Thái is 56 years old and she is married with three children. Her children are grown up, so she lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Mrs. Hồng Thái operates a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp sauce. Hồng Thái has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main harship that Hồng Thái faces in her business is the lack of capital.

She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 03 Chợ Điện Biên solidarity group. In 2009, Hồng Thái joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hồng Thái has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make the processed food to sell. With her business profit, Hồng Thái hopes for her children to find a good job, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 31 years old, married to Lucy, and blessed with a three-month-old baby. He owns a shop where he sells mobile phone accessories. He started this business four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 48,000. 

He is requesting a first loan of KES 30,000 to purchase mobile phone accessories to stock in his shop. Any profit he earns from his business will contribute toward him buying land and building his own home as well as living a comfortable life which is also his dream.

loans.use: To purchase mobile phone accessories to stock in his shop.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en:
Raquel is 31 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin. Raquel is single and is without children. To earn a living, Raquel has a business selling snacks in the community. Raquel earns about PHP 2,000 each month doing this type of work. 

Raquel has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar, oil etc. Raquel has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Raquel would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients such as flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: 05.01.13 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hồng Thu has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents.

Hồng Thu is 39 years old. She is married and has 2 children. Hồng Thu is the group leader of the 13 Chợ Điện Biên solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. In 2009, Hồng Thu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hồng Thu has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hồng Thu hopes to build a new house, for her children to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Alejo

texts.es:
Don Alejo un humilde agricultor, de 67 años de edad, es originario de Teustepe. El a pesar de no haber realizados estudios es una persona muy trabajadora, se dedica a la siembra de maíz, frijol y trigo desde hace 52 años, padre de 8 hijos mayores de edad, viven independientes. Alejo inicio su actividad a los 15 años de edad ayudándoles a sus padres en las tierras, luego decide independizarse, el papa le hereda parte de las tierras para que se ayude, después de haber obtenido experiencia y dominio en el negocio empieza a trabajar por si solo en la siembra, hoy en día con esfuerzo propio no solo siembra granos básicos también tiene sus vacas propias y tierras que ha comprado de las ganancias del trabajo,  en su negocio  paga mano de obra debido a que la carga del trabajo es mucha no puede hacerlo por si solo, sus productos los comercializa en la misma comunidad y en los alrededores de la zona. La esposa vende cuajadas de la leche que producen las vacas como otros ingresos para el hogar, Alejo tiene como expectativa realizar todas las labores de la siembra como limpiar el grano de frijol para que la producción sea mejor que la de años pasados.
Solicita el crédito para pagar mano de obra, comprar insumos, refrescantes y abono, el cual será de ayuda porque podrá realizar sus labores de cosecha en tiempo y forma, no tendrá que vender sus animales para cubrir los costos de producción, sus planes futuros es cancelar el crédito de las ganancias que saque de la cosecha y lo que sobre invertirlo en la compra de animales (vacas), su expectativa es mantener su negocio activo para poder salir adelante, tener un mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Don Alejo is a humble, 67 year old farmer from Teustepe.  He is a hard worker, despite the fact that he did not complete his education.  He has been planting corn, beans, and wheat for 52 years.  He is the father of eight adult children who live on their own.  Don Alejo began farming at fifteen years old, helping his parents on their lands.  The he decided to become independent.  His father left him part of the land in order to help him.  After he had gained experience and mastered the business, he began working for himself in planting.  Today, with his own effort, he not only plants basic grains but also has his own cows and land that he purchased with the profits from his farm work.  In his business, he pays laborers because the workload is too much for him to handle by himself.  He markets his products in his community and in the surrounding area. His wife contributes additional income to the household selling curdled milk (used to make cheese and yogurt) produced by the cows.  Don Alejo expects to do all the planting tasks, such as cleaning the bean grains, so that production will be better than in years past.

He is requesting the loan to pay labor costs and purchase inputs, refreshers and compost, which will help him harvest his crops in a timely manner so that he does not have to sell his animals to cover productions costs.  He plans to pay off the loan with the profits from the harvest and invest in the purchase of animals (cows).  He expects to keep his business going on order to get ahead and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay labor costs, and purchase inputs, refreshers, and compost.

loans.name: 05.01 64 Điện Biên Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Quý has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Quý is 42 years old, married and has 2 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 64 Chợ Điện Biên solidarity group. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her 2 dependents

In 2012, Quý joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Quý has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that Quý faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Quý hopes for her children to do well in school, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 52 years old and has been a farmer in Nakuru town for the past seven years. He is married to Margaret and they have five children. He plants cash crops such as maize and potatoes and it has been very profitable.

This will be his fifth loan from KADET LTD and he plans to use it to buy more seedling for planting in his farm. He also plans to use part of it to pay workers. This being the rainy, planting season he anticipates to make more profits with which he will pay school fees for his children.

In the future, Francis hopes to grow his farming business and be able to improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: To buy more seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 35 years old, married to Pauline and they have four children. He has been in the motorcycle transport business in Olkalau town for the last four years. Besides this transport business, he also has a retail shop business which is operated by his wife.

This will be Joseph's third loan from KADET LTD. and he plans to buy more stock of sugar, rice, both maize and wheat flour as well as cooking oil to sell in his shop.This will enable him meet his customers' demands and also to make more profits. With the anticipated income, he plans to buy another motorcycle.

In the future, Joseph would like buy more farm land and invest in zero grazing. This will increase his income and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, both maize and wheat flour as well as cooking oil to sell in his shop.

loans.name: Kassim

texts.en:
Kassim, 29, lives with his partner Rukia, in the the village of Msambweni. They both work in retail trade and do farming. Kassim has a well-stocked store. In his store he sells vegetables, fruit, such as mangoes. Kassim is a self-sacrificing person who works hard each day to get ahead and improve his quality of life.

Kassim will use this loan to buy vegetables, fruit etc. He thanks Yehu and Kiva for the assistance that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit.

loans.name: Vevencio

texts.en:
Vevencio is 56 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte, Clarin. Vevencio is married and has 9 children. 

To earn a living, Vevencio has a restaurant business. He earns about PHP 2900 each month doing this type of work. Vevencio has requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase additional ingredients for his restaurant business.

Vevencio has been a member of PMPC for a month.  In the future, he would like to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients for his restaurant business.

loans.name: Ian Jed

texts.en:
Ian Jed is 24 years old and lives in Basirang,Tudela. He is single without children. 

Ian Jed is a teacher and earns approximately PHP 5000 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional personal needs such as chalk, a blackboard and books. 

Ian Jed has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, he hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase additional personal needs such as chalk, a blackboard and books.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is 30, and he is a very hardworking man. He's been with Mariam for 8 years, they have four children. They live in Msambweni village. 

Bakari has been a motorbike taxi driver for eight years. He used to live in a rural area with his parents but he decided to move to the city thinking about his and his family's future progress. He indicates that his job is hard because during winter he has to overcome obstacles due to having less passengers because it's very cold. His dream is to buy more motorbikes to work and make more progress. He requests a loan to purchase another motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase another motorbike.

loans.name: Lucinda

texts.es:
Doña Lucinda tiene 49 años de edad, casada, tiene 6 hijos, vive con su esposo, dos hijos y un nieto en aldea el Negrito, Morazan, Yoro.
Hace 1 año que doña Lucinda estableció una pequeña pulpería en la aldea donde vive y vende productos básicos como arroz, azúcar, espaguetis, harina, productos de limpieza, sal, embutidos, carne de pollo, jugos, refrescos, pan, huevos etc.  Este negocio se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos para cubrir algunos gastos de alimentación y educación de sus hijos. Anteriormente vendía animales como cerdos y aves. Ella solicita un préstamo por 5,000.00 Lempiras, con el cual va surtir de algunos productos que no tiene en el negocio, como ser: azúcar, fósforos, refrescos, espaguetis, manteca y churros. Espera obtener ingresos para la alimentación y educación de sus hijos y hacer crecer el negocio.
texts.en:
Lucinda, 49, is married and has six children.  She lives with her husband, two children and a grandson in the village of El Negrito  in Morazán, Yoro.

Lucinda opened a small grocery store a year ago in the village where she lives.  She sells basic staple items like rice, sugar, spaghetti, flour, cleaning supplies, salt, cured meats, chicken, juices, soft-drinks, bread, eggs, etc.  This business has become her source of income to cover some of her children’s food and education expenses.  She used to sell animals like pigs and barnyard fowl.  

She’s asking for a 5,000 lempira loan to stock up on some products she doesn’t have for her store like sugar, matches, soft-drinks, spaghetti, lard and snacks.  She hopes to earn income for her children’s food and education and to make the business grow.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Don Santiago tiene 61 años de edad, soltero, tiene un hijos de 14 años de edad, vive en la Colonia López Arellano, del municipio de Choloma Cortes.
 Don Santiago, se gana la vida comprando y vendiendo zapatos de manera ambulante y por pedidos, siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, tiene 16 años de experiencia. el vende zapato para damas, caballeros y zapato escolar para niños, los fines de semana aprovecha a vender más, se coloca  afuera de la maquila y espera a los empleados para ofrecer su producto. Su negocio ha crecido mediante préstamos, el que está solicitando es el quinto préstamo y es por 24,000.00 lempiras, con el cual comprara zapatíllas de varios estilos para damas ya que tiene pedidos que entregar. Con esta inversión va incrementar sus ventas y sus ingresos.
Su meta a futuro es tener un local frente a su casa para establecer el negocio y tenerlo fijo.
texts.en:
Santiago, 61, is single and has a 14-year-old son; he lives in the municipality of Choloma’s López Arellano neighborhood in Cortes.

Santiago earns his living buying and selling shoes from place to place and on order; he’s always been a merchant.  He has 16 years’ experience.  He sells shoes for women, men and school shoes for children.  He takes advantage of weekends to sell more.  He sets himself up across from an assembly plant and waits for the employees to offer them his products.  

His business has grown thanks to loans and the one he’s requesting now is his 5th and is for 24,000 lempiras that he’ll use to buy sandals in assorted styles for women since he has pending orders to fill.  With this investment he will increase sales and income.  His future goal is to have a locale in front of his house to set up the business and have a fixed locale for it.

loans.use: to buy women's sandals to sell.

loans.name: 05- Phú Thọ 3 - Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh is 44 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has one dependent child, the other is grown up. Oanh operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. Oanh has been involved in this business for three years. The main harship that Oanh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

This is Oanh first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase fruit to resell. She is the leader of a 8-member group, the 05 Phú sơn 2 solidarity group. With her business profit, Oanh hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase fruit to resell.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is married with five children. She is 44 years old and lives in Tabo-o, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Jennifer sells fish to earn a living and has been in this business for ten years. She has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional fish to sell. Jennifer has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to engage in other type of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: 03.1.85 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling bread. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make bread to sell.

Hạnh is 22 years old and she is married with one child. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 85 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. Hạnh lives with one dependent in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hanh has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hạnh hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make bread to sell.

loans.name: Coritza Aracely

texts.es:
Doña Coritza, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en una aldea del Municipio de Omoa, Cortes, es madre soltera y  tiene 4 hijos.
La mayor parte de Sus ingresos dependen de la venta de productos de primera necesidad para el consumo diario, como el arroz, sal, manteca, azúcar, frijoles, y golosinas, lácteo, embutidos, refrescos, jugos,  etc. Esta pulpería la estableció hace 8 años aproximadamente debido a la necesidad de ingresos económicos, poco a poco ha ido surtiendo su negocio de donde saca los ingresos que necesita para la manutención de su familia.
Ha solicitado 2 préstamos con ODEF y este tercer préstamo ha sido invertido a su pulpería en compra de productos de consumo diario como (lácteos, embutidos, carnes, granos etc.). Con sus ganancias mantendrá una mejorar calidad de vida.
Su meta es mantener su negocio estable, y seguir beneficiándose con la ayuda que odef le ha brindado.
texts.en:
Coritza, age 36, lives in a village in the Omoa municipality in Cortes.  She is a single mother, and she has four children.

The greatest part of her income is dependent upon the sale of basic needs products for daily consumption like rice, salt, lard, sugar, beans, sweets, dairy products, sausages, soft drinks, and juices, etc.  She established this grocery store approximately eight years ago out of the need for income.  Little by little she has been stocking her business.  That is where she gets the income she needs to support her family.

She has requested two loans from ODEF, and this third loan has been invested in her grocery store.  She bought daily consumption products like dairy products, sausages, meat, and grains, etc.  With her income she will maintain a better quality of life.

Her goal is to keep her business stable and to continue benefitting from the help that ODEF has given her.

loans.use: to buy food products like dairy products, meat, sausages, and basic grains in order to stock her business.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en:
Tabitha is married, and she lives in her own house in the city of Mombasa. She lives with her four children, two boys and two girls. She raises hens. 

Tabitha tells us that she has been doing this work for some time, so she has a well-formed client base. She is a woman who is hardworking and enterprising, a fighter. She has always worked, and she is not afraid to take on a challenge. She says that thanks to her work, she is getting ahead with a lot of effort and sacrifice.

Tabitha is seeking a loan to invest in the purchase of hens to raise in her coop so that she can increase her income and attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase hens to raise

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila is married and has 2 children. She is 58 years old and lives in Nacional, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

Leonila sells viand (tasty cooked dishes) to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan of 14,900 to be used in purchasing additional meat and ingredients for viand cooking and selling.

Leonila has been a member of PMPC for 8 years. In the future, Leonila hopes to engage in other type of business.

loans.use: To be used in purchasing additional meat and ingredients for viand cooking and selling.

loans.name: Deonila

texts.en:
This is Deonila, 61, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Henaro, her business partner. She is a mother to her five children, all of whom are working. She, together with her husband and children, manages her own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their daily expenses.

Deonila operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Deonila earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30, 000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Deonila hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Nanette

texts.en:
This is Nanette, 47, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Florendo and mother to their child. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Nanette operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Nanette earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nanette hopes to be able to expand soon. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 31 years old, married and has two children. She operates a beauty salon to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has one employee. She operates her business in a demanding environment that is readily available customers. 

Through Faulu Kenya, Patricia has become knowledgeable on saving because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to operate another shop in a different location and to own land in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy hair braids and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy hair braids and cosmetics.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is 39 years old, married and has five children. She does tailoring in a competitive environment and has one employee. She has been in the business for ten years. Previously, she had received a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to improve her business. She has also been trained in business management, which has helped her boost her business. Rose has requested for a loan of 40, 000 Kenya shillings to buy fabric for making clothes.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is a 32 year old married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 13 years. She describes herself to be jovial and diligent. 

Teresia operates a retail store where she sells items such as sugar, maize, cooking fat, etc. She has been involved in this business for 6 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within a market  and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy maize. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will educate her children with profits generated from her business.

loans.use: to buy maize for her retail business.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma, age 27, is married to Aisha, who is a businesswoman. The couple has one child. They live in Msambweni, Kenya.

Juma has been a “moto-taxi” (three-wheeled motorized vehicle) driver for seven years. He has his stop at Msambweni. He says that there are several others in this zone, and that the business activity is very competitive. He cannot miss his shift for even one day, not even with rain or cold.

He also says there is a lot of insecurity in his line of work. At times, the places where he takes his passengers are far away, dark and uninhabited.

Juma's greatest desire is that his children become good people. That way, he will fulfill his obligation as a father. Then he will be able to devote himself to another, safer business activity.

He greatly values the opportunity offered by Yehu Microfinance and Kiva. He is requesting the loan to buy a new moto-taxi.

loans.use: to buy a new moto-taxi (three-wheeled motorized vehicle).

loans.name: 02.01.12 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng has an agricultural business farming food. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale.

Phượng is 50 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 02.01.12 Đông Hải solidarity group. She lives in Dong Hai commune, an urban area of Thanh Hoa City. She has no dependents since her children are adults.  

This is Phượng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Phượng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is a lack of capital.

Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy and for her children to do well in school. With her business profit, she plans to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase rice seedlings to raise for future sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase farm inputs; fertilizers and pestcides.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer. She previously availed an PHP8,000 loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, house hold and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for a PHP20,000 loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Jennifer hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Angel Marino

texts.es:
Don  Ángel, tiene 45 años de edad, está casado ya tiene 1 hijo, vive en la ciudad de Puerto Cortes,
El tiene un negocio de venta de mercadería, hace aproximadamente 12 años que estableció el negocio de venta de camisas deportivas de equipos locales, banderines de los quipos locales y de la selección, y ligueros, adicional también vende frutas.  Este negocio lo hace de manera ambulante, el es muy conocido en el Puerto y ya tiene sus propios clientes. Le dedica 8 horas diarias, todos los días, siendo este su fuente de ingresos para su familia. 
Es su primer préstamo y lo invertirá en compra de mercadería como banderines, camisas deportivas, ligeros  y compra de frutas, para mantener surtido el negocio. 
Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, para obtener más ganancias y establecer un local estable  y poder ayudarle siempre con los estudios a su hijo.
texts.en:
Ángel, 45, is married and has a son; he lives in the city of Puerto Cortes.  He has had a business selling merchandise.  He set up this business selling shirts from the local sports teams, local and national team flags and headbands; he also sells fruit.  He sells from place to place and is very well known in the Port; he already has regular customers.  He spends 8 hours daily every day and this is his source of income for his family.

This is his first loan and he will use it to buy merchandise like flags, sport shirts, suspenders and will also buy fruit to keep his business well-stocked.  His goal is to grow in the business to obtain more profits and to establish a fixed locale and to be able to always help with his son’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy sporting goods to stock his business.

loans.name: Mahoulolo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement MAHOULOLO est composé de vingt et une personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Euphrasie est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Euphrasie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Euphrasie est âgée de 44 ans et est mariée à un électricien du nom de Janvier. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont trois restent à leur charge. Euphrasie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs enfants et assurent ensemble les diverses de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Euphrasie vend depuis une vingtaine d’année, des produits vivriers et de l’huile de palme par le système de livraison et dans un marché du Bénin. Euphrasie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Euphrasie et les autres membres du groupement MAHOULOLO sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en:
MAHOULOLO Group is made up of 21 persons who live in the same neighborhood. The group's representative, named Euphrasie, is the one raising her hand in the photograph.

In order to bolster their businesses and better meet customer demand, the members of this group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, for the first time.

Euphrasie, age 44, never attended school. She's married to an electrician named Janvier. The couple has four children who all go to school. Three of them are still in the care of the couple.

Euphrasie and her husband live together with their children, and the couple ensures together that the various family expenses are covered.

In order to provide for her family, Euphrasie sells food products and palm oil through the delivery system and in one of Benin's markets. She's been doing this job for about twenty years.

She gets her supplies in one of Benin's markets. In order to bolster their businesses and better satisfy their clientele, Euphrasie and the other members of MAHOULOLO Group are seeking their first loan from ALIDé. They ambition to increase the turnover of their businesses.

loans.use: to buy food products and palm oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sodas to sell.

loans.name: 020304-Thôn9- Hoằng Đông-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Dân has an agricultural business farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

Dân is 54 years old and married with three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 020304-Thôn9- Hoằng Đông-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 

Dân supports one dependent with her business in Hoang Hoa, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her other two children are adults.

In 2005, Dân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Dân has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Dân has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Dân faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In the future, Dân hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, to buy land of her own and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell.

loans.name: 3.14.164.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Bích works in agriculture farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

Mrs. Bích is 49 years old and she is married. She has 2 children. She is the group leader of the 3.14.164.Thiệu Khánh  solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. Mrs. Bích supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province, her children are grown up.

This is Mrs. Bích's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Mrs. Bich hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is 42 years old, married and has four children. He does horticultural farming to earn a living. He has been in the business for eight years and has three employees. Besides farming, he also operates a retail shop. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped him to improve his business. He has also learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: 03.01.84 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hạnh is 61 years old, and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent. Her other two other children are grown up. Hạnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship she faces in her business is the lack of capital. 

Hanh is the leader of a three-member group, the 03.01.84 Quảng Hưng solidarity group. In 2011, Hạnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hạnh has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make processed food to sell. With her business profit, Hạnh would like to buy a motorbike, and she hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make processed food to sell.

loans.name: 020101-Thôn3- Hoằng Đông-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tấn has an agricultural business farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

Tấn is 47 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 020101-Thôn3- Hoằng Đông-Hoằng Trường-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. 

Tấn supports two dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, Tấn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tấn has successfully repaid six loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Tấn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Tấn faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In the future, Tấn hopes for her business to do well and to travel for vacation within the country.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and cattle to raise and resell in the future.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi used her previous loan amount to buy more stock of potatoes and carrots to sell and it has been profitable.She now runs a retail business in Nakuru town where she sells several items like caps, mirrors, electrical goods, among others.

This being her second loan, she plans to buy more stock of caps, sweaters, belts and electrical appliances to sell in her business. With the anticipated profits she plans to open up a wholesale shop.

In the future, Naomi would like to invest in the transport industry business by buying a passenger vehicle. This will allow her to make more income and provide a good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 48 years old and lives in Malibacsan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children. 

Herminia has a general store where she sells groceries and other consumable products. She has had this business for five years. Herminia requested a loan of 3000 PHP to be used in purchasing additional groceries to sell.

Herminia has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she hopes to engage in other types of business.

loans.use: To purchase additional groceries to sell

loans.name: Dilcia Ibeth

texts.es:
Dilcia  tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, tiene 1 hijos, vive en una colonia de la Lopez Arellano, Choloma, Cortes. 
Dilcia  se dedica vender mercadería. Hace 7 meses inicio su negocio el cual tiene establecido en las afueras de los parques industriales ofreciendo ropa interior, blusas, faldas y venta de achinería.
