Su negocio lo comenzó con sus propios medios, luego tuvo la oportunidad de aplicar a financiamiento con ODEF,  que le han ayudado mucho y se siente muy motivada a seguir trabajando.
Actualmente lleva 3 préstamos solicitados y este de 10,000 es para invertir en compra de mercadería nueva como ropa interior, blusas, camisas, faldas etc. Con esta inversión piensa aprovechar el pago del decimo tercer mes  y vender  variedad de mercadería para que  sus ventas pueda aumentar favorablemente.
Su sueño en el futuro es tener su propio local estable y bien surtido de mercadería con la que aun no cuenta.
texts.en:
Dilcia, age 34, is married and has one child.  She lives in a neighborhood in the Lopez Arellano section of Choloma, Cortes. 

Dilcia sells merchandise.  She started her business seven months ago, and the business is set up on the outskirts of the industrial parks.  She sells underwear, blouses, skirts, and knickknacks.  

She started her business by her own means.  Then, she had the opportunity to apply to ODEF for a loan.  They have helped a great deal, and she is motivated to continue working.

She currently has had three requested loans.  She will use this one for 10,000 lempiras to buy new merchandise like underwear, blouses, shirts, and skirts, etc.  With this investment she plans to take advantage of the workers’ year-end bonuses and sell a variety of merchandise.  She will do this so that her sales will favorably increase.

Her dream for the future is to have her own stable location.  She also dreams of being well-stocked with merchandise that she still does not have.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise like underwear, blouses, shirts, and skirts, etc. to stock her business.

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha is a 44 year old business woman in Kongowea, Mombasa. She is married. She sells bananas to her customers, a business she has been doing for the past twelve years with success.
 
This is marks Martha's first borrowing from KADET LTD. to finance her business. She plans to purchase more bananas to resell. With the proceeds, she will repay her loan and expand her business further. 

Martha hopes to have a well established business.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: 03-1-91 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thực has a retail business selling plastic goods. She is requesting a loan to purchase glasses to resell.

Mrs. Thực is 50 years old and she is married. She has 2 children. She is the group leader of the 03.1.91.Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her 2 dependents.

This is Mrs. Thực's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Mrs. Thực faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mrs. Thực hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase glasses to resell .

loans.name: Olegario

texts.es: El Sr. Olegario  tiene 54 años y es casado con 3 hijos que son de las edades de 30,27 y 17 años, el Sr. Olegario se dedica al servicio de plomería, el trabaja en las distintas construcciones de la localidad de Sacaba este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Olegario va a usar este préstamo para  la mejora de vivienda, comprando material de construcción, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es quiere mejorar los cuartos de su casa, el Sr. Olegario enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la dependencia de cada trabajo ya que tiene que cumplir con el contrato por cada casa a la que va  a trabajar de plomería y va seguir utilizando los beneficios en mejorar su vivienda, comprando losa alivianada y carpeta de hormigón, su deseo con el tiempo es ver terminada su casita.
texts.en:
Olegario, 54, is married with three children, ages 30, 27, and 17.  He works as a plumber on various buildings in the town of Sacaba.

This loan is his first sequence with the institution.  Olegario is going to use this loan to buy construction material to improve his house because he wants to improve the rooms.

Olegario faces challenges in his business, such as depending on each job because he has to fulfill the contract for each house where he does the plumbing.

He is going to continue using his profits to improve his home, buying light flagstone and a layer of concrete.  His desire for the future is to finish his little house.

loans.use: to improve his house.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 27 years old, married and has one child. She operates a butcher shop and has two employees. She has been in the business for two years. Previously, she used to do catering. 

Through Faulu Kenya, Nancy has learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to operate a wholesale business and become rich in the future. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy meat.

loans.use: to buy meat.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 33 year old married man. He has 4 children, ages ranging from 2 years to 14 years. He describes himself to be social. 

Jacob operates a retail business where he sells ground nuts. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located within a market  and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more groundnuts to sell. His business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. He hopes that, in the future, he will educate his children up to university level.

loans.use: to buy ground nuts for selling.

loans.name: 3.14.165.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thêu, a 59-year-old married mother of two grown children, is the group leader of the 3.14.165.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of four members. For more than 10 years, she has been raising poultry and cattle in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

One of the critical business difficulties that concerns Thêu is a lack of capital. She is therefore requesting her first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Thêu hopes for her business to do well and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her enterprise in the future.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe, 22 years old and hardworking, earns his living as a tailor. He has been in the business for more than three years and has three employees. A previous loan from Faulu Kenya helped Wycliffe to grow his business, and he has also improved his saving skills through training in financial management.

Now requesting a loan of 40,000 KES to buy a sewing machine, he dreams of developing his enterprise in the future by opening many outlets in various locations.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Arnaldo Alejandro

texts.es:
Arnaldo tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero. Él tiene seis años de administrar su propio microbús, realizando todo tipo de viajes personales a cualquier lugar que le soliciten sus clientes. Arnaldo aprendió este oficio de motorista, debido a que por los escasos recursos económicos de su mamá de 70 años de edad, no pudo terminar una carrera universitaria. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para comprar cuatro llantas que cuestan $100 dólares cada una y para la compra de otros repuestos. Al comprar las llantas nuevas para su microbús, Arnaldo podrá viajar más seguro junto con sus pasajeros, evitando inconvenientes e incluso algún accidente. También, podrá viajar todos los días y así tener ingresos diarios. Él desea trabajar muy fuerte para ahorrar y comprar un microbús más nuevo.
texts.en:
Arnaldo, 24, is single.  He has been operating his own microbus for six years, offering all types of personal trips to anywhere his customers request.  Arnaldo learned his trade as a driver when he had to give up his university studies because of his 70-year-old mother's scarce financial resources.

The loan he is requesting of Fundación Campo is to buy four tires, which cost $100 each, and to buy other spare parts.  When he buys the new tires for his microbus, Arnaldo and his customers will be able to travel more safely, avoiding problems and even some accident.  He also will be able to travel every day and so have a daily income.

He wants to work very hard to save and buy a newer microbus.

loans.use: to buy four tires and other spare parts.

loans.name: Villa Rayanniyoc Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VILLA RAYANNIYOC”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Taray, perteneciente a la provincia de Calca y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Vanessa ella es conviviente y tiene 20 años y tiene 1 hijo; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, leche y aceite, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a su hijo, el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas al por mayor.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes, negocio de crianza de cuyes y negocio de venta de cereales y negocio de venta de verduras.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Villa Rayanniyoc Communal Bank, located in the district of Taray in the province of Calca and department of Cusco.

The member, Vanessa, 20, lives with her partner and has one child.  She works in her grocery store business selling household necessities such as rice, sugar, milk, and oil.  She works from 8 a.m. until 10 p.m.  With this business she gets her son ahead.  Her dream is to expand and improve her grocery store business.

She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale grocery items such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

The other members work in businesses selling animals, selling groceries, raising guinea pigs, selling grains, and selling vegetables.

She is grateful to everyone who is part of this dream and she promises to make her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rice, sugar, milk, and cookies.

loans.name: Santos Elena

texts.es:
Elena tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos dependientes. Vive en casa propia, con esposo que es peón agrícola en una comunidad rural en el distrito de Tambogrande en el norte del Peru. Ya cuentan con algunos servicios básicos como luz electrica. Es su segundo credito con el apoyo de Edpyme Alternativa y Kiva y fue muy responsable y puntual en el pago del primero. 
La actividad que desarrolla Elena es la crianza de ovinos, porcinos y aves de corral como actividad principal ya que cuenta con 10 cabezas de ganado ovino, 12 pavos, 5 cerdos, 10 gallinas. La actividad se la reparten entre esposos los cuales se apoyan mutuamente. Se dedica a la crianza hace aproximadamente mas de 5 años. Los dos estan determinados a salir adelante y solicitan un crédito para la compra de alimento balanceado para animales y mejoras en el corral de los mismos. Para eso cliente cuenta con los conocimientos para la adecuada alimentación de los animales. Dada la localidad del sector la labor de Edpyme y Kiva es particularmente importante para que personas como Elena tengan accesso formal a credito.
texts.en:
Elena, 40, is married and has three dependent children.  She lives in her own house with her husband who is an agricultural day laborer in a rural community in Tambogrande District in northern Peru.  They already have some basic utilities like electricity.  This is her second loan with help from Edpyme Alternativa and Kiva and she was very responsible and punctual with her payment of the first one.

The activity Elena carries out is raising sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl as her main activity since she already has 10 head of sheep, 12 turkeys, 5 pigs and 10 chickens.  She and her husband share the work; they support each other mutually.  She’s been raising animals for more than five years.  

Both of them are determined to get ahead and request a loan to buy nutritionally balanced feed and to do some improvements to the corrals.  The client has the necessary skills to adequately feed the animals.  Given the location of the sector, in order for people like Elena to have access to formal credit Edpyme Alternativa believes that its and Kiva’s work is particularly important.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and to repair corrals.

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es:
El grupo está constituido por 16 integrantes muy activas y muy trabajadoras quienes han sobresalido siempre en todos los ciclos por su dinamismo y unidad de todas ellas.
La Sra. Lizandra junto con otras compañeras ha guiado a las demás integrantes en los sucesivos ciclos, ya que la mismas trabajan incansables con el fin de darle una vida mejor a su familia. Lizandra es comerciante, y se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de todo tipo, con lo cual ayuda a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos de todo tipo, con lo cual tendrá cumplir con la demanda y pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The group is made up of 16 very active and hardworking members who have always excelled in all their loans through their dynamism and the unity among all of them.

Lizandra, together with other partners, have guided the other members in their successive loan cycles, and they work tirelessly with the aim of giving their families a better life. 

Lizandra is a business owner and sells cosmetics of all kinds. In this way she helps her family. She is requesting the loan in order to buy cosmetics of all kinds, enabling her to meet demand and orders from her customers.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Maria Anita

texts.es: María Anita es una madre de familia de 33 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en un caserío del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande en el Norte del Peru. Ella se dedica a la venta de bebidas cervezas y gaseosas en un local acondicionado en su vivienda, sus principales clientes son las personas que viven en su caserío. Ademas cuenta  con aves de corral las cuales una vez alcanzado el peso ideal, los comercializa. Los ingresos que recibe de estas actividades los utiliza para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia. Ella desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más bebidas y ademas cree que hay gran potencial en consolidar su negocio commercializando aves. Por lo tanto, Maria Anita solicita un credito con Edpyme Alternativa con el apoyo de Kiva para comprar mas bebidas y alimento para sus animales. Anteriormente Maria Anita ya hizo un credito con esta institution y demonstro ser muy puntual, ademas de ayudarle a su negocio enormemente.
texts.en:
María Anita, 33, is a mother living with her husband and three children in a settlement in the agricultural district of Tambogrande in northern Peru.  She sells beer and soft-drinks in a locale she set up at home.  Her main customers are people who live in her settlement.  She also has barnyard fowl she sells once they reach ideal weight.  Income from these activities is used to support her family’s economy.

She wants to expand the business acquiring more beverages and she also believes that there is great potential in consolidating her barnyard fowl business.  Therefore, María Anita is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan with Kiva’s help to buy more beverages and animal feed.  María Anita took out a previous loan with this institution and was very punctual in addition to its helping her business enormously.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, soft-drinks and animal feed.

loans.name: Isabellah

texts.en:
Isabellah is 30 years old, married to Stephen, and blessed with two children aged 13 and six years respectively. She sells fruits, a business she started 12 years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested a first loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase more fruits for sale. The anticipated profit will aid her to buy additional stock for her business. 

Her dream is to see her business expand and to lead a comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits for sale.

loans.name: Vitaliana

texts.en:
Vitaliana is 71 years old and lives in Colupan Alto, Sinacaban in the Philippines.  Vitaliana is widowed and without children.  She has a store that sells a variety of products, and has been in business for three years.  

Vitaliana has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products for her store, such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.  Vitaliana has been a member of PMPC for ten years.  In the future, Vitaliana hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Luis Ignacio

texts.es:
El  Sr. Luis es de la ciudad de Santaní, tiene 49 años, está casado con la Sra. Nidia de  32 años. La pareja tiene 2 hijos, quienes son la mayor alegría que tienen y el motivo de lucha de ambos.
Luis se  dedica como vendedor ambulante de artículos de mercerías y Bijouteries, con lo cual ayuda a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para una buena vida, sin privaciones. Luis cuenta que desde joven trabajo y que no teme al trabajo, ya que todo lo que hace es por su familia.
Comenta que su sueño es poder tener un negocio y no tener que recorrer más por las calles. Solicita el crédito para la compra de ropas nuevas, las cuales venderá de forma ambulante y tendrá más que poder ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Luis is from the city of Santaní. He is 49, and married to Nidia, 32. The couple has two children, who are the source of their greatest joy, and the reason why they both strive.

Luis is a street vendor who sells notions and costume jewelry. This is how he helps his family and provides them what they need for a good life without hardships.

Luis tells us that he has worked since he was young, and is not afraid to work, as everything he does is for his family.

He says that his dream is to have a store, and not have to travel through the streets any more. He requesting the loan in order to buy new clothing, which he will sell in the street, and have more to be able to offer his customers.

loans.use: To buy articles of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Lázaro

texts.es:
Lázaro es un padre de familia de 50  años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en casa propia. La zona en donde reside es uno de los caseríos que conforman la parte rural del distrito agrícola de Pacora, la zona es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100 familias y cuentan con servicios de luz.

La actividad que desarrolla es la crianza y venta de animales menores por toda la zona de Pacora ,su esposa lo ayuda en esta actividad, ademas cliente se dedica a la agricultura y percibe ingresos como jornalero, ya que trabaja en los campos de cultivo vecinos. Gracias a estas actividades el puede hacerse cargo de su familia y sacarlos adelante.

Lázaro se encuentra solicitando a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado para los mismos, su inversion tiene buenas perpectivas ya que hay bastante demanda de animales por toda la zona.

El es una persona bastante responsable y trabajadora. Su mayor anhelo es ver a sus hijos convertidos el profesionales y hombres de bien. Lázaro agradece de antemano a las personas que colaborarán con el a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Lázaro, 50, is a father living with his wife and children in his own house.  The zone where he resides is one of the settlements that comprises agricultural Pacora District’s rural part.  It is a very small community with approximately 100 families; they have electricity.

The activity he carries out is raising small farm animals that he sells throughout his zone in Pacora.  His wife helps him with this activity.  He also works in agriculture and earns income as a day laborer since he works in neighboring fields.  Thanks to these activities he’s able to care for his family and move them forward.

Lázaro is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a 100 new sol loan that he intends to use to buy more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.  His investment has good potential because there is high demand for animals throughout the zone.

He is quite a responsible, hardworking person.  His greatest wish is to see his children become professionals and upstanding citizens.  Lázaro thanks in advance people who collaborate with him through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cellular accessories such as headphones, memory cards and other items.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Alberto es pensionado al igual que su esposa trabajan todos los días para solventar los gastos diarios de su familia, al igual que mantener los pequeños detalles que hacen de su domicilio un lugar cómodo para ellos ya que son grandes de edad y sus necesidades son diferentes que las de una persona de edad media. En esta ocasión Alberto siente la responsabilidad de construir una barda y portón frente a su hogar, actualmente ellos trabajan como empacadores de un centro comercial de la localidad. Esto habla muy bien de ellos ya expresa su deseo por seguirse superando diariamente.
El  crédito que le proporcionemos al  Sr. Alberto será no solamente será para construir una barda  si no para brindarle protección a su familia y a el mismo.
texts.en:
Alberto is retired, as is his wife.  They work every day to pay his family's daily expenses as well as to keep up the little things that make his home a comfortable place for them.  They are older and their needs are different than those of a middle-aged person.

On this occasion Alberto feels the responsibility to build a wall and gate in front of his home.  Currently they work as packers in a shopping center in the town.  This speaks very well of them because it expresses their desire to continue improving themselves every day.

The loan we will give to Alberto will be not only for constructing a wall but also to offer him and his family protection.

loans.use: to build a wall and gate.

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QORI ORCCO”; La  socia vive en el distrito de Urcos en la provincia de Quispicanchis y  departamento de Cusco.
	
La socia es la Sra. Esther; la socia continua dedicandose a la elaboracion de panes,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que mas le solicitan,la socia es una persona alegre y responsable con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de insumos para la elaboracion de panes como harina y manteca.
texts.en:
She is a member of the communal bank, “QORI ORCCO”. She lives in the Urcos district, in the province of Quispicanchis and the department of Cusco.
	
The communal bank member is Esther, she continues to make a living making bread. She sells her breads by walking to the customers who usually buy from her. She is a very happy and responsible person, with a strong desire to continue working to help her family. 

The bank member has requested a loan to buy ingredients to make bread, like flour and lard.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread, like lard and flour.

loans.name: Marco Antonio

texts.es:
Don Marco tiene 46 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su esposa e hijos en una colonia suburbana de la ciudad de Choloma, Cortes.
El tiene 14 años de dedicarse a la elaboración de productos de uso domestico como ser desinfectantes, desodorante ambiental, cloro, jabón liquido, champú, cera liquida y perfumes. El prepara y los vende por galones, vende a domicilio a empresas y a particulares. Es un negocio rentable se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos, ha  invertido varios prestamos para mantenerlo estable. Este préstamo que solicita es el séptimo y lo necesita para comprar los químicos e insumos y los envases de plástico para elaborar sus productos y venderlos, esperando que cada día su negocio tenga más demanda, también le ayudara a cumplir con la entrega de pedidos que tiene de sus clientes. Su meta es tener su propio local fijo y exhibir los productos al público.
texts.en:
Don Marco is 46 years old and has two children. He lives with his wife and children in a suburban neighborhood of the city of Choloma, Cortes.

For the past 14 years, Marco has been making household products such as disinfectants, air fresheners, bleach, liquid soap, shampoo, furniture polish, and perfumes. He prepares and sells his products by the gallon to homes, businesses, and individuals. Marco’s business is profitable and has become a source of income. He has invested several loans in order to keep it stable.

The loan he is requesting is his seventh one. Marco needs to buy chemicals, supplies, and plastic containers for making his products to sell. He hopes that his business will experience more demand each day. The loan will also help him fulfill and deliver the orders that his customers have given him. His goal is to have an established location of his own where he can display his products to the public.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, supplies, and plastic containers for making household cleaning products.

loans.name: 0603022-Đại Giang- Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Láng works in agriculture raising marine aquaculture. She is requesting a loan to purchase shrimp and crab to raise and resell.

Láng is 38 years old and she is married with 3 children. She is the leader of a 3-member group, the 0603022-Đại Giang- Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group. Láng supports 3 dependents with her business in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Láng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Láng has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Láng hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: To purchase shrimp and crab to raise and resell

loans.name: Maria Santos

texts.es: Maria de 57  años de edad, vive  junto a su esposo ya no tienen carga familiar. Viven en casa propia.en la zona de Tucume en una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias. Esta s encuentra en el norte del Peru y cuenta con servicion de luz. Maria se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, por toda la zona de Tucume , su esposo se dedica a la agricultura. Entre los dos estan determinados a salir adelante y ella en particular quiere aportar a los ingresos de su familia. Por lo tanto, esta buscando sacar un credito sera para la compra de animales como de alimento para estos mismos. Ella piensa que su inversion tiene buenas perpectivas ya que hay bastante demanda de animales por toda la zona. Dado que la zona es relativamente remota, la labor de Edpyme y Kive es particularmente importante.
texts.en: María, aged 57, lives with her husband. They have no family to provide for. They live in their own house in the area of Tucume in a small neighborhood consisting of around 100 families. It is located in northern Peru and is connected to the public electricity grid. María rears animals and sells them anywhere in Tucume, while her husband is a farmer. Both are determined to strive for progress; María, in particular, wants to contribute to the household income. Therefore, she applies for a loan to buy animals and feed for them. She thinks that her investment has a good chance to be profitable, since there is a high demand for cattle throughout the area. Since the area is quite remote, the work done by the microfinance institution Edpyme Alternativa and Kiva is particularly important.

loans.use: to buy animals and feed for them.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 66-year-old married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 15 years to 34 years. He describes himself as social and customer friendly. 

He operates a welding business where he sells windows and doors. He has been involved in this business for 10 years and employs one staff member. His business is located within a market and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be frequent power blackouts. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more welding materials. His business goal is to run a hardware store within 5 years. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children.

loans.use: to buy welding materials.

loans.name: Jesus Abel

texts.es: Jesus Abel tiene 34  años de edad, vive  junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en casa propia. Cliente vive en  el lugar es una comunidad pequeña con un aproximado de 100  familias en el norte del Peru y cuenta con servicio de Luz. Jesus se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales, por toda la zona donde trabaja y tiene un puesto como operario en Gandulez. Su esposa lo ayuda en lo ques la crianza de animales, ademas de contar con una pequeña tienda. Entre los dos se apoyan mutuamente y siempre buscan mejorar sus condiciones de vida. En este momento Jesus Abel busca sacar un credito que sera para la compra de animales, asi como de alimento para estos mismos; su inversion tiene buenas perpectivas ya que hay bastante demanda de animales por toda la zona. Dado que la zona es un poco alejada, el accesso a credito formal puede ser un poco mas dificil y por ende la labor de Edpyme Alternativa y Kiva es particularmente importante.
texts.en:
Jesús Abel, 34, lives with his wife and children in his own house.  He lives in a place that’s a small community with approximately 100 families in the north of Peru; he has electricity.

Jesús raises and sells animals throughout the zone where he works and he also has a job as a laborer with Gandulez.  His wife helps him with raising the animals and also has a small store.  The two of them help each other out and are always seeking ways to improve their living conditions.

At present, Jesús Abel is looking to take out a loan to buy animals as well as animal feed.  His investment has good potential in that demand for animals is high throughout the zone.  Because the zone is a bit far away, access to formal credit can be a bit difficult which is why Edpyme Alternativa’s and Kiva’s work is particularly important.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
La Sra. Lourdes tiene 26 años, tiene 1 hijo de 5 años y está embarazada. Anteriormente trabajaba en casa de familia y de a poco fue juntando su plata para abrir un pequeño negocio para estar cerca de su hijo y así se independizó, y gracias a su estrategia en las ventas fue creciendo.
Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y lo muestra todos los días trabajando en su pequeña despensa, gracias a la cual da a su hijo todo lo que necesita. Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas en Gral. y azúcar y harina, y agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que le da, ya que para ella es un apoyo importantísimo porque con el crédito es la única oportunidad de crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Lourdes, 26, has a five-year-old child and is pregnant.  Previously she worked in the home of a family and gradually she got together the money to open a small business, to be near her son.  This way she became independent and, thanks to her sales strategy, she grew.

She is a very hardworking person and she shows it every day working in her small store, thanks to which she gives her son everything he needs.

She is requesting the loan to buy a variety of beverages, and sugar and flour.  She is grateful to the foundation for the opportunity it is giving her; it is very important support for her because the loan is the only opportunity to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy beverages, sugar, flour, etc.

loans.name: 3.6.168.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Lịch works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Lịch has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Lịch is 38 years old and she is married with 2 children. Lịch is the group leader of the 3.6.168.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Lịch supports no dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa District, a rural town in Thanh Hoa Province. Her children are grown.

In 2009, Lịch joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Lịch has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Lịch hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is 38 years old and married with two children. He is a cobbler in a busy environment with reliable customers. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He hopes to expand his business in five years and become successful. He needs a loan of 30,000 KES to buy leather and shoe soles.

loans.use: to buy leather and shoe soles.

loans.name: 3.6.169.thiệu Nguyên Group

texts.en:
Nhân works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Nhân has been involved in this business for 6 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Nhân is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 3.6.169.Thiệu Nguyên solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Nhân supports 2 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Nhân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nhân has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Nhân hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, to maintain  a successful business, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Girlie

texts.en:
This is Girlie, 34, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Alfredo, her business partner. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Girlie operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Girlie hopes to grow her business and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Azzam

texts.en:
Azzam is 61 years old, married, and lives in Tulkarem. He has a food stall to sell vegetables and fruits. 

Azzam asked Ryada for funds to buy more varieties of food (fruits and vegetables) for his stall in order to sell more and improve his income. He hopes that he will be able to improve his income and enlarge his stall.

loans.use: to buy more varieties of food (fruits and vegetables) for his stall

loans.name: Carlos Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Carlos es de la ciudad de Concepción, vive con su hermana, no esta casado, tiene  una pequeña pollería, y  también hace flete hace más de un año.  Trabaja en su propio camión.
El es una persona muy trabajadora, que siempre se esfuerza por darle a su familia y siempre poder apoyarle en todo lo que necesitan. Su sueño es poder tener su propia familia y también hijos.
Solicita el crédito para equipar su pollería con insumos, y también para hacer mejoras, ya que su local necesita un pequeño arreglo. Agradece a Kiva y fundación paraguaya por la oportunidad que están recibiendo.
texts.en:
Carlos is from the city of Concepción.  He lives with his sister; he’s unmarried.  He has a small chicken shop and for more than a year has also been doing cargo deliveries.  He works with his own truck.

He is a very hardworking person who always strives to give to his family supporting them in everything they need.  His dream is to have a family of his own and also children.

He’s asking for the loan to stock his chicken shop and also to do some improvements because his locale needs some fixing up.  He thanks Kiva and Fundación Paraguaya for the opportunity he’s getting.

loans.use: to buy supplies and to make improvements to his chicken shop.

loans.name: Martha Elizabeth

texts.es:
Martha es una madre de familia que tiene 23 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. No cuenta con todos los servicios básicos en su vivienda.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino, porcino y aves de corral. Realiza esta actividad en algunos corrales ubicados fuera de su domicilio desde hace más de cuatro años. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Es muy conocida en su zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Su esposo la ayuda eventualmente en este negocio.

Ella ya ha tenido un crédito financiado a través de Kiva y le ha ido bastante bien, con esa ayuda pudo ampliar sus ingresos y actualmente su negocio cuenta con mayor demanda. Por ello ha creído conveniente acudir nuevamente a solicitar un crédito que le permita seguir creciendo como empresaria, adquiriendo más animales y alimento balanceado para la crianza de los mismos. El monto de su préstamo es de 2500 nuevos soles.

Martha se encuentra bastante agradecida con las personas que le apoyaron a través de Kiva en aquella oportunidad, del mismo modo agradece de antemano a quienes le ayuden ahora.
texts.en:
Martha, 23, is a mother living with her husband and minor son in one of the hamlets that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a zone located in Piura Region four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.  Her house does not have all basic utilities.

She raises sheep, pigs and barnyard fowl.  She carries out this activity in some corrals located outside her house; she’s been in business more than four years.  When they reach a good level of development she sells them to merchants who tend to visit the zone where she lives.  She’s very well known in her zone and she has a regular clientele.  Her husband helps her occasionally with her business.

She has already had a loan financed through Kiva and she’s done quite well.  With that help she was able to increase her income and her business currently has higher demand.  Because of this she’s deemed it advisable to once again request a loan that will allow her to continue growing as a businesswoman acquiring more animals and nutritionally balanced feed for them.  The amount of her loan is 2500 new soles.

Martha is quite grateful to people who supported her through Kiva on that occasion and gives thanks in advance to those who will help her now.

loans.use: to buy small farm animals and animal feed.

loans.name: 3.6.170.thiệu Nguyên Group

texts.en:
Thoa has a retail business selling medication. She is requesting a loan to purchase medicine to re-sell. Thoa has been involved in this business for 3 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital

Thoa is 25 years old and married with 1 child. She is the group leader of the 3.6.170.Thiệu Nguyên solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Thoa supports 1 dependent with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

With her business profit, Thoa hopes to maintain a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase medicine to re-sell.

loans.name: 3.5.166.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Trang works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Trang has been involved in this business for 3 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Trang is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. Trang is the group leader of the 3.5.166.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. Trang supports 2 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Trang joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Trang has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Trang hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en: Mwanasha is applying for a Kiva loan (her second loan with Yehu Microfinance) to buy merchandise from her catalogs which is currently being offered with good discounts such as food, beverages, and sacks of fruit for making juices. In this way, she hopes to impress her buyers with her prices and expand her customer coverage. Her loan will enable her to have a good amount of stock available and she will not have to wait to collect money on her outstanding accounts and also pay school fees for her children who attend school. This will enable her to respond to her customers and, as always, make them happy so that they become loyal customers. This will guarantee her investment is successful.

loans.use: to add stock to her business and pay school fees.

loans.name: Felista

texts.en:
Felista is 39 years old, married to John, and blessed with two children aged 18 and 12. She owns a retail shop where she sells a variety of goods. She started this business four years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 12,000. 

She is requesting her first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase 10 kgs of cooking fat, sachets of royco, washing detergents, and tea leaves. 


Profit she earns from her business will contribute toward her buying land and building her own home. She hopes to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase 10 kgs of cooking fat, sachets of royco, washing detergents, and tea leaves.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is 24 years old and a hardworking business lady. She runs a motorcycle transport business and has one employee. She has been in the business for five years. On the side, she operates a grocery store to generate extra income. She dreams of expanding her business and improving her financial status in the future. She needs a loan of 15,000 KES to repair the motorcycle.

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Gladis Lili

texts.es:
La señora Gladis, tiene 38 años de edad, es soltera, tiene 1 hijo, ellos  viven en una aldea del Municipio de Cuyamel, Cortes.
La actividad económica a que se dedica Doña Gladis  es una pulpería donde vende productos alimenticios (arroz, frijoles, manteca, harina, maseca azúcar, refrescos, pan, medicinas) y productos de abarrotería. Inicio su negocio con dinero propio, posteriormente con las ganancias logro aumentar su inventario. Ella cuenta en la actualidad con una clientela fija, lo que le permite un aumento en sus ventas y además la demanda de mayor oferta de productos. 
Actualmente ha solicitado su primer  préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos alimenticios, medicinas, productos de abarrotería.  
 Su sueño es aumentar las ventas y con las ganancias crecer económicamente para apoyar a su hijo en la educación y lograr un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Sra. Gladis is 38 years old, single, and has one child. They live in a neighborhood in the town of Cuyamel, Cortes.

Doña Gladis has a store where she sells food products (rice, beans, lard, flour, cornmeal, sugar, soft drinks, and bread), as well as medicines and other grocery products. She started this business with her own money and later used the profits to increase her inventory. Gladis currently has an established customer base, which allows her to increase her sales and experience more demand for the products she offers.

At the moment, she is requesting her first loan so that she can invest in the purchase of food products, medicines, and grocery products. Her dream is to increase her sales and her earnings so that she can grow financially, support her child’s education, and achieve a stable business.

loans.use: to buy food products, medicines, and grocery products.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a married woman. She has 5 children ranging from 15 years to 30 years. She describes herself to be a visionary and a passionate woman in her work. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sodas, sugar, salt, flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located within a conducive business environment. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs from the source of household items. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more household items. Her business goal is to run a wholesale shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have expanded her business.

loans.use: to buy more household items.

loans.name: 3.5.167.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Vân works in agriculture, farming poultry and cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. Vân has been involved in this business for 3 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Vân is 25 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 3.5.167.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of 10 members. Vân supports 2 dependents with her business in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Vân has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Vân hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 38-year-old Msambweni resident who works selling fruit, tubers, and vegetables. With the loan she is requesting, she hopes to better organize her business by buying baskets for displaying her fruits and a larger, more presentable table than the one she has. She also wants to increase the variety of the products she offers at this time.

Fatuma has her family's help in staffing her business; for that reason, her biggest dream is to continue growing and eventually have a large store that can accommodate everyone and to earn greater profits to improve her and her family's quality of life. With the loan, she purchased sacks of potatoes, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Ninah

texts.en: Ninah is 52 years old and married with four children. She operates a boutique and has one employee. She has been in the business for one year. Besides, she also generates extra income from her rental premises. Previously, she used to do pig farming. She had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which has helped her expand her business. She has also learned how to save because she has been trained in financial management. She hopes to grow her business and operate a wholesale business in five years. She needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy clothes, handbags, and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothes, handbags, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi, 49, lives with her husband, Athuman, and six children in Msambweni, Kenya. This is a cheerful party area and is where Mwanamisi runs her business selling fast food, such as chapati (flat bread), hot dogs, burgers, natural juices and fried products.

In her community, which is large, and in the surrounding neighborhoods, everybody is familiar with her food. Her business came about when she found herself without a formal job. The success factor of this businesswoman is her persistence in going from less to more. She has managed to go from selling just a few products to selling many more, adding soft drinks to her line of products. Mwanamisi prepares natural juices with fresh tropical fruits such as mangos, watermelon, mandarins, bananas, etc. Her business is always busy, with customers seeking a taste delight, good hygiene and good food.

This Kiva loan is Mwanamisi' seventh with Yehu Microfinance, and she will use it to buy sauces, fats, vegetables, cold cuts, tropical fruit and sugar in larger quantities. Her dream is to acquire a bigger and more comfortable sales location.

loans.use: to buy sauces, fats, vegetables, cold cuts, tropical fruit and sugar.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
This is Gina, 39, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Jonie, her business partner, and a mother to her children. She, and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Gina operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Gina hopes to grow her business and dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a married woman. She has 2 children ages 6 and 9. She describes herself to be ambitious and honest . She operates a retail store where she sells plastic items such as bowls, plates etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 1 staff member. Her business is located within an area conducive to her business. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transportation costs from the source of plastic items. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more plastic items. Her business goal is to run many more retail shops within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have diversified her business.

loans.use: to buy more plastic items.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 35-year-old single mother of two children, aged 20 years and nine months. She operates a grocery stall, a business she started six years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is requesting a first loan of KES 14,000 to purchase fruits, vegetables and green grams (mung beans) for sale. The profit she earns will be plowed back into her business. 

She hopes to see her business grow into a wholesale store.

loans.use: To purchase fruits, green grams (mung beans) and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: Jeannett

texts.es: La Sra. Jeannett tiene 30 años y es casada con 2 hijos que son de las edades de 4 y 2 años, la Sra. se dedica a la venta de artículos varios en su puesto de venta que se encuentran ubicado en la zona sur de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su cuarta secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Jeannett  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de papelería y otros productos para surtir  su negocio,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su mercadería para así ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes, la Sra. Jeannett  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son diversificar su mercadería y va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando mercadería al por mayor, su deseo para  su negocio es compra de otro puesto de venta.
texts.en:
Sra. Jeannett is 30 years old, married, and has two children (ages 4 and 2). She sells various articles from a vending post located in an area south of the city of La Paz. This loan is her fourth cycle with Emprender.

Sra. Jeannett will use this loan to buy stationery and other products to restock her business. Her reason for requesting this loan is so that she can increase her inventory and offer a variety of products to her customers. Sra. Jeannett faces challenges in her business, such as diversifying her inventory, so she will utilize the benefits of this loan and continue buying merchandise in bulk. Her wish for her business is to acquire another vending post.

loans.use: to buy stationery and other products.

loans.name: Jecinta

texts.en:
Jecinta is 42 years of age and a single mother of one child. She owns a quarry business in Nakuru town from which she makes building blocks and stones for sale to various construction sites in and out of Nakuru town.

This will be her second loan from KADET, LTD. and she plans to use this amount to buy more quarry equipment and thereby increase her business output since demand is high. She also plans to employ more quarry workers.

In the future, Jecinta hopes to build her own permanent house as well as start other businesses such as a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to buy more quarry equipment.

loans.name: Vilma Diana

texts.es:
La Sra. Vilma de 30 años está casada con Eulalio de 34 años, tienen 3 hijos por quienes ambos se esfuerzan ya que quiere darles todo lo que necesitan.
Doña Vilma se dedica a la venta Ambulante de productos de mercería y artículos de bazar, hace diez años, trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo Eulalio, ambos se iniciaron en este rubro desde muy jóvenes, trabajando para otras personas. Vilma tuvo que hacer un viaje a España por un periodo de 2 años aproximadamente, donde trabajo en servicios domésticos,  durante ese tiempo juntó un capital, para cuando regrese al país, y así fue, pudo empezar con su esposo un  negocio por cuenta propia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
Vilma solicita el crédito para la compra de cacerolas, asaderas, platos, vasos, ollas, etc., con lo cual tendrá un buen stock de productos que poder ofrecer a sus clientes. Agradece a la fundación y a Kiva por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, pues le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Vilma, 30, is married to Eulalio, 34; they have three children they both strive to provide everything they need for.  Vilma sells merchandise and housewares from place to place; she’s been doing this for ten years.  She works together with her husband, Eulalio.  They both started this line of work while still very young working for others.  

Vilma traveled to Spain for two years approximately and worked there as a domestic employee.  During that time she saved up some capital for when she returned to the country and having done so was able with her husband to start their own business.  She is a very hardworking person who very much wants to get ahead and make progress.

Vilma is asking for a loan to buy pots, pans, griddles, glasses, dishes, pans, etc. to have a good stock available to offer her customers.  She thanks the Fundación and Kiva for the opportunity she’s getting because it will be of great help to her.

loans.use: to buy pots, grills, dishes, glasses, casserole dishes, etc.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence has a retail shop in Naivasha, which she has operated for the past two years. She is 34 years old, married to Erick, who is a driver, and they have five school-age children.

This will be her second loan, and she plans to use it to pay school fees for her child who is in primary school.

In the future, Florence hopes to grow her business and to own a large transport business and supply business products and goods to various traders in Naivasha and other towns.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en: Isaac is 30 years old, married, and has three children. He does quarrying to earn a living. He has been in the business for two years and has two employees. Previously, he used to run a motorcycle transport business. Through Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in bookkeeping, which has helped him to manage his business. He hopes to become competent and successful in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a drilling machine.

loans.use: To buy a drilling machine.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
En el Barrio Villa San Juan de la ciudad de Caaguazú, se formó el comité Kuña Kyrey integrada por 16 señoras humildes con gran espíritu emprendedor, el propósito inicial de este grupo fue el de ayudarse a sobresalir  económicamente, con la ayuda del préstamo y las capacitaciones.
Ida es la presidenta del grupo, y ella nos dice que siempre motiva a sus compañeras para seguir trabajando y de esa forma estar cada vez más cerca de cumplir con sus metas. Ida tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy tempranas horas, y es gracias a este negocio que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de bebidas, azúcar, harina, yerba, etc. Con lo cual desea poder surtir su negocio para poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Kuña Kyrey” committee formed in the city of Caaguazú’s Villa San Juan neighborhood; it has 16 humble members with a great entrepreneurial spirit.  The initial purpose of this group was to help them to get ahead economically with help from the loans and the training.

Ida is group president and she tells us that she always motivates her fellow members to continue working so that they can be closer to reaching their goals each time.  Ida has a grocery store where she works daily starting very early and thanks to this business has the means necessary to be able to help her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy soft-drinks, sugar, flour, tea, etc. to stock the store and be able to continue to provide good customer service.

loans.use: to buy soft-drinks, sugar, flour, tea, etc.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene has been operating a cereals store in Nakuru town and it has been profitable. She is 28 years old and a single mother of two children.

This will be her first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of beans, maize, rice, and peas among other cereals. This will enable her satisfy customers' needs as well as make more profit with which she intends to buy more stock.

In the future, Irene hopes to grow her business and be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is 35 years old, married to James, and blessed with two children, ages 16 and four. She sells firewood, a business she started three years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 

She is requesting a first loan of KES 25,000 to purchase firewood and charcoal for resale. The profit she earns will help her repay her loan, as well as increase her stock. 

She hopes to do well in her business and in life.

loans.use: To purchase firewood and charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is 47 years old, married and has two children.  He sells clothes in a busy environment and has reliable customers.  Previously, he acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him to grow his business.  At this time, he is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES in order to buy clothes for resale.  He has also learned how to save because he has received training on financial management.  He hopes to expand his business in five years.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys es socia del Bancomunal Urubamba y tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y madre de 1 hijo. Es socia de FINCA Perú hace 2 años y tiene un negocio de venta de pollos, gallinas, cuyes y otros animales menores. En todo este tiempo como socia de FINCA Perú aprendió a ser responsable, puntual y también aprendió a ahorrar, le gusta asistir a las reuniones de su Bancomunal porque allí se distrae mucho y le permite compartir experiencias con otras socias y más aún se fortalece con las capacitaciones que recibe allí. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de un vehículo para así poder ir a las ferias y traer los animales menores en cantidad y así poder venderlos al por mayor y aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Gladys is a member of the "Urubamba" communal bank.  She’s 33-years-old, has a spouse and is the mother of a son.  She’s been a member of FINCA Perú for two years and she has a business selling chicks, chickens, guinea pigs and other small farm animals.  

In all the time she’s been a member of FINCA Perú she’s learned how to be responsible, punctual and also how to save; she likes attending her communal bank’s meetings because she entertains herself there and she’s able to share experiences with other members and even more so is able to be strengthened with the training she receives there.  

She will use the loan she’s requesting to buy a vehicle to be able to go to the livestock fairs and bring small animals in quantity to be able to sell them at wholesale and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy a vehicle for work.

loans.name: Santa Librada Group

texts.es:
El Comité Santa Librada, está integrado por 24 señoras humildes con ganas de superarse laboralmente, son de  ciudad de Caaguazú, estas mujeres se unieron como grupo cuando se enteraron sobre el programa de Comité de mujeres de la Fundación Paraguaya, viendo los beneficios y oportunidades que la empresa le ofrecía.
Rufina es la presidenta del grupo, ella comenta que se dedica a la venta ambulante desde hace ya un buen tiempo, por lo que ya tiene su clientela formada. Tiene muy buena habilidad para las ventas,  y es por ello que le va muy bien.
Solicita el crédito para poder surtirse con todo tipo de productos, como ser prendas, sabanas, frazadas y edredones, y de esa forma poder darle a sus clientes mayor variedad.
texts.en:
The “Santa Librada” committee is made up of 24 humble ladies who want to get ahead in their work; they are from the city of Caaguazú.  These women joined together as a group when they found out about Fundación Paraguaya’s  women’s committee program and became aware of the benefits and opportunities the firm offered.

Rufina is group president.  She comments that she been a street vendor for quite some time now so she has a well-established clientele.  She’s very skilled in sales and this is why she does very well.

She’s asking for the loan to stock up on all types of products like clothes, sheets, blankets and comforters so that she can have more variety for her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothes, sheets, blankets, comforters, etc.

loans.name: Dolphine

texts.en: Dolphine is 28 years old and married.  She works as a tailor to earn a living and she has been in business for five years.  She also knits sweaters to increase her income.  Previously, she acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her to expand her business.  At present, she is requesting a loan of 80,000 KES in order to buy a tailoring machine, fabric and yarn for knitting.  She has also learned how to save because she has received training on financial management.  She aspires to open a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: to buy a tailoring machine, fabric and yarn for knitting.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for making jewelry.

loans.name: Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este comité es de la Ciudad de san Lorenzo,  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo principal el crecimiento de cada una de ellas, no solo en lo económico, sino también en lo personal. Las mismas son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras.
La Sra. Zulma, presidenta del grupo, es casada, tiene 3 hijos, es una mujer muy activa y promueve el fortalecimiento del comité. Ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de todo tipo, con lo cual ayuda a sus familiares a tener los medios suficientes para el día a día. Su meta es poder tener una gran tienda, con la cual podrá seguir creciendo más y más.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de invierno, con las cuales podrá seguir bien abastecida y cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee is from the city of San Lorenzo.  The members of the committee set as their main goal their individual growth not only economically but also personally.  They are noted in their location for being very hardworking women.

Zulma is group president.  She’s married and has three children.  She’s a very active woman who promotes the group’s strengthening.  She sells all types of clothes through which she helps her family to have means for everyday support.  Her goal is to have a big store with which to continue to grow more and more.

She’s asking for a loan to buy winter clothes in order to be well-stocked and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy winter clothes to sell.

loans.name: Josephat

texts.en: Josephat is 28 years old and hardworking. He operates a mobile business where he sells clothes. He has been in the business for four years and has one employee. He describes his business environment to be good with loyal customers. Through Faulu Kenya, he has acquired saving skills because he has been trained in financial management. He hopes to have a permanent shop and operate a boutique in five years. He needs a loan of 10,000 KES to buy clothes.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache, a 24-year-old married mother of a year-old son, describes herself as a faithful woman who for the past year has been operating a retail stall selling clothes. Her enterprise is located in a viable business area, and her primary customers are local residents.

Describing her biggest business challenge as a shortage of stock due to insufficient funds, Kache will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to improve her business within five years, and she hopes to diversify in the future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anastasia

texts.en:
Anastasia is a married woman.  She has two children who are aged 6 and 12 years. She describes herself to be a decisive and honest person. 

She operates a retail stall where she sells paraffin, an oil similar to kerosene that is used for fuel.  She has been involved in this business for one year.  Her business is located in a viable business area and her primary customers are local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high price of paraffin.  She will use the loan of 20,000 KES to buy more paraffin to sell. Her business goal is to own a paraffin pump within five years. 

She hopes to improve her standard of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more paraffin to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Sabias Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres sabias es de Ciudad del Este, está integrado por 12 mujeres, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de ese lugar, que se unen para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
Maria forma parte del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de todo tipo, comenta que ya tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella los productos que trae. Su sueño es poder tener un local donde vender todo tipo de productos y de esa forma seguir creciendo. Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos, con los cuales podrá tener una buena cantidad de productos y variedad que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Sabias” (Wise Women) committee is from Ciudad del Este; it has 12 members who are all friends and neighbors from that place who joined together to help each other out through teamwork.

María forms part of the group; she sells all types of cosmetics.  She comments that she already has a good clientele that always buys the products she brings.  

Her dream is to be able to have a locale in which to sell all the products and to continue growing this way.  She’s asking for the loan to buy cosmetics to have a good amount and variety of products to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy costmetics to sell.

loans.name: Mwashamba

texts.en: Mwashamba, 37, lives in Msambweni and has a family business preparing food, such as fried food and fast food. She is gradually making progress attracting customers, mainly in the neighbouring community. Now she is applying for her first loan because she needs to grow and to do that she needs to find suppliers from whom she can buy in volume and on a cash basis, as they offer a better price. This is the reason for this Kiva loan, the fourth loan that she has taken from Yehu Microfinance Trust. She will use this loan to buy raw materials, such as cooking oil, cereals, and tubers. Her investment will be successful because she will get discounts that will increase her profits right away and also benefit her customers. Her goal for the future is to have her own place where she can operate a big restaurant, offering a variety of dishes that are specialties of the region. While she works to achieve her dreams, she will manage a 15-day rotation of accounts receivable, and her inventory turnover will be every 2 days; these are the financial indicators from which she projects her growth.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as cooking oil, cereals, and tubers.

loans.name: Fatma

texts.en: Fatma is the single mother of a 5-year-old child. She describes herself as social and respectful. She operates a retail store where she sells household items such as sugar, salt, tea leaves, rice, flour, etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more household items. Her business goal is to expand her business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future she will expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more household items.

loans.name: Las Recicladoras Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades. La  mayoría son madres de familia y  cabezas de hogar por lo que día a día se sacrifican mucho para salir adelante.  Este comité se encuentra en su tercer ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad y los deseos de progresar que tienen de cada una de las integrantes en la asistencia en las capacitaciones.
Fernanda es miembro del grupo, fue elegida como la presidenta por el gran espíritu de liderazgo que tiene y por su capacidad. Fernanda se dedica al reciclaje de productos como ser papel, cartón, bronce plástico, etc. Ella junta esos productos y también los compra y vende y de esa forma ayuda a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de papel, cartón, bronce y demás para poder venderlos y así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
The members of this committee carry out a variety of activities.  Most of them are mothers and heads of household which is why they sacrifice much day to day in order to get ahead.  This committee is in its third cycle and their sense of responsibility and the desire each one has to get ahead is notable in their attendance at training.

Fernanda is a group member.  She was elected president because of the great leadership spirit she has and because of her ability.  Fernanda works recycling products like paper, cardboard, bronze, plastic, etc.  She gathers these products and also buys and sells them and helps her family this way.

She’s asking for the loan to buy paper, cardboard, bronze and others to be able to sell them and earn higher profits this way.

loans.use: to buy paper, carboard and bronze to sell.

loans.name: Semillero Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Semillero” está conformado por 16 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de leña, venta de ropa nueva, venta de comida, confección de ropa deportiva, venta de mayonesa de leche, masas, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la comuna de  Padre las Casas, ubicada en la ciudad de Temuco.
Julie, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra sentada en primera fila ocupando el tercer lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste una chaqueta de color violeta, su cabello es largo de color castaño oscuro y  lo usa suelto, en sus brazos carga a su hija.
Ella se dedica al rubro de decorar y tallar en vidrio, desde hace 9 meses. Comenta que trabaja desde su casa de lunes a viernes y su  horario de trabajo  lo distribuye de acuerdo a su disponibilidad.
Su mercadería para el tallado en vidrio lo compra en distribuidoras en ventas de vidrios, ya que el tallado lo realiza específicamente en vasos, decora, pule y le dibuja alguna figura, compra a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará vasos y cajas de madera para tallar figuras.
Sus metas a corto plazo son darse a conocer con su taller y su arte de tallar en vidrio, y a mediano y largo plazo ampliar su taller, para generar mayores ingresos, así con esto optar a una mejor calidad de vida.
Julie vive junto a sus 2 hijos de 18 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando y  una hija pequeña de 11 meses de edad. Sus sueños son capacitarse en su rubro y que se conozca el producto de la zona y fuera de la zona, y la vez generar empleo para otras personas que lo necesiten.
Julie está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito y servicios otorgados por Fondo Esperanza. Además comenta que se siente muy cómoda con las reuniones y grupo del Banco Comunal, ya que existe generosidad y unidad.
Padre Las Casas es una comuna del sur de Chile, cercana a la ciudad de Temuco, región de la Araucanía.  Su nombre le fue dado en honor al sacerdote español Bartolomé de Las Casas, quien fue un defensor de los indígenas durante la conquista de América. Destaca una numerosa población mapuche en esta comuna. Basa su economía en la agroindustria y servicios comerciales.
texts.en:
This "Semillero" communal bank is composed of 16 entrepreneurs who are dedicated to different trades, among which are selling firewood, selling new clothes, selling food, sportswear, selling mayonnaise, and making dough, among other services. All come from Padre Las Casas, near the city of Temuco.

Julie, president of the communal bank, is sitting in the front row of the photo in third place from left to right, wearing a purple jacket and with her long dark brown hair worn loose. She has her daughter in her arms. Julie dedicates her time to decorating and engraving glass, which she has done for 9 months. She says she works from home Monday to Friday, arranging her work schedule according to her availability. She buys the items for engraving from wholesale distributors, and decorates, polishes and draws figures on them. She buys at low cost so it makes good economic sense. With the loan she intends to buy glasses and wooden boxes for engraving. Her short term goals are to get people aware of her workshop and her glass engraving. In the medium and long term her goals are to expand her workshop, to generate more income, and with this to obtain a better quality of life. Julie lives with her 2 children: her 18 year old son who is studying and her little girl who is 11 months old. Her dream is to increase her skills in her field and get her work known in the local area and beyond, while creating jobs for others in need. Julie is very happy and grateful for the loan and the service provided by Fondo Esperanza. She also says that she feels very comfortable in meetings of the communal bank, as there is an atmosphere of generosity and unity. 

Padre Las Casas is a community in southern Chile, near the city of Temuco, Araucania region. The town was named in honor of the Spanish priest Bartolomé de Las Casas, who was a defender of the indigenous people during the conquest of America. The town boasts a large indigenous (Mapuche) population. Its economy is based on agribusiness and commercial services.

loans.use: To buy glasses and wooden boxes to engrave

loans.name: Catherini

texts.en:
Catherini is 39 years old.  She is the single mother of two children aged 12 and eight years who both attend school.  She has a retail business in Nakuru town where she sells household items like jugs, basins, kitchen utensils and children’s clothing.

This will be Catherini's first loan from KADET LTD and she plans to use it to buy mattresses to sell in her business.  With the anticipated profit, she plans to expand her business by adding more items to sell.

In the future, Catherini hopes to grow her business and increase her income so that she can provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to buy mattresses to sell

loans.name: Santa Rosita De Lima Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece  al banco comunal SANTA ROSITA DE LIMA; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.
